King Fado confided in me himself.|The Sacred Stoned banished evil long ago and possess power beyond our ken.|The ancient kings of Renais felt it prudent to seal ours away.|They feared its power could be misused.|They thought to remove the temptation.|The keys to break the seal were hidden, too...|Forged into bracelets...|...The very ones that you and your brother, Prince Ephraim, wear.
speak;Eirika;Our bracelets?|How could Father keep this a secret from me for so long?

speak;Seth;They must know nothing of the bracelets.|Tell them only if some great peril strikes.|These were King Fado's exact orders.|Prince Ephraim knows nothing of the bracelets secret, either.|The king told me this out of fear that something might happen to him.|So that, when the time came, the two of you would learn the truth.
speak;Eirika;Yes.|And we are the only living souls who know the secret of the Stone of Renais.|At least, that's what I was given to believe.|And yet...
music;52- Into the Shadow of Victory Orchestral Cover;500
speak;Eirika;Yet the Grado army has made it clear that they want me only for my bracelet.

speak;Seth;Yes, quite clear at that...|I don't know how, but Emperor Vigarde must have learned the secret somehow.|And now, his troops pursue the bracelet, and we are no closer to knowing his motives.
speak;Eirika;He would use the bracelets to unlock the Sacred Stone and destroy it in secret...
speak;Eirika;Which means that my brother...|and his bracelet...
speak;Seth;If he's been captured, they may have the bracelet already, and he may be-

speak;Seth;Princess, we must take Novala's words to be true.|We must hurry to Prince Ephraim.|The enemy soldiers who fled the battle will have reported our location by now.|If the prince is being held prisoner at Renvall...|I fear they might execute him once they learn of our approach.
speak;Eirika;You're right.|We've no time to waste.|We must hurry to Renvall!|Let's go rescue my brother!

name: OnLevelSelect_7
_source: speak;Narrator;Rumors say that Ephraim has been defeated and taken prisoner.|Now Eirika must find a way to rescue her brother from beneath enemy eyes.;;;narration
speak;Narrator;Eirika's company rushes towards Castle Renvall, where Ephraim is being held.;;;narration

speak;Narrator;Surrounded by lakes, Renvall is a natural fortress, all but unassailable.|A lone bridge, held by the enemy, is its only entrance.|Eirika has only one choice.|Eirika decides to confront Grado's soldiers head on...;;;narration

name: Intro
_source: speak;Eirika;My brother is somewhere inside that castle...

speak;Seth;Renvall is surrounded by lakes.|The only entrance is the bridge to the main gate, and it's well guarded.|Castle Renvall is a natural stronghold, easy to defend and difficult to assault.|We must plan our attack carefully.
speak;Franz;Princess Eirika!|Please allow me to fight beside you.|My elder brother, Forde, is in there with Prince Ephraim, Sir Kyle, Sir Orson...|Let me help you set them free!
speak;Gilliam;There is nothing to discuss.|We will fight.
speak;Moulder;The hour of your reunion is not far off now.
speak;Vanessa;I am yours to command, Your Highness.
speak;Ross;We're with you all the way!|Right, Dad?
speak;Garcia;Don't work yourself into a lather, Ross.|In the heat of battle, a good warrior remains calm where lesser men do not.
speak;Colm;You need anything stolen, I'm your man.|'Course, my blade's no joke either.
speak;Neimi;I'm sure I can help you if you'll let me...|I'll keep you safe.
speak;Lute;You can't possibly consider fighting without my genius at your side!
speak;Artur;I have yet to repay you for helping me fight those abominations.|Please, let me stand by your side a while longer.
speak;Joshua;This has trouble written all over it.|Bet you it's all a trap...|Ah, well...|My luck's gotta turn around sometime, right?
speak;Natasha;May the sacred light surround us and protect us all.
speak;Seth;Well, Princess, let us prepare for battle.
speak;Eirika;...Brother, I'm on my way.|Let's go!

name: House_2
_source: speak;Villager Old Woman 1;Prince Ephraim?|Well, gracious me...|I haven't heard anything about him.|But now that you mention it, there was a big commotion a few days back.|I guess the soldiers were chasing somebody, but...|Well, I was so tired, I fell asleep and missed the whole thing.

name: House_1
_source: speak;Villager Man 7;Tirado's the new master of Castle Renvall.|He's supposed to be an adjutant to General Valter of Grado.|Who knows, though...|Rumors say he's been plotting behind Valter's back.|You should watch where you step.

name: EnTurn1
_source: speak;Murray;We're under attack!|Rouse yourselves!|General Valter's adjutant, Lord Tirado, has charged us with defending the castle!|Show them the might of Murray's Brigade!|Don't let anyone near the castle!

name: FightMurray
_source: speak;Murray;Our ballistae have failed?|How could this be?|Grrr...|I guess it's up to me!

name: Outro
_source: speak;Eirika;My brother is somewhere in this castle...|Seth, we must go inside!
speak;Seth;Hold, Lady Eirika.|Look, in the shadows-|a figure...
speak;Orson Evil;Princess Eirika And...|Is that you, Seth?
speak;Seth;Sir Orson...|Why are you here?|You should be with Prince Ephraim.
speak;Eirika;Are you all right, Orson?|If you're here, my brother must be here as well, right?
speak;Orson Evil;Yes...|Prince Ephraim and I were brou...|captured by Grado forces and held here as prisoners.|I just managed to escape my cell...|A chance to escape...|It's what I had prayed for...
speak;Eirika;Orson...are you well?|Your face is so pale.|Grado's men, don't tell me they've-
speak;Orson Evil;No...|it's nothing.|But Lord Ephraim...|I cannot say whether he's still unharmed.
speak;Eirika;What!?|Where is he?|Where is my brother?
speak;Orson Evil;If he lives still, he will be in one of the deeper cells, where I was held.|Head down this corridor to the dungeons.|Quickly, before reinforcements arrive.

name: Intro
_source: speak;Orson Evil;This way, Princess Eirika.|Prince Ephraim is being kept in a cell back here.
speak;Seth;...Sir Orson.|How long ago were you taken prisoner?
speak;Orson Evil;Some two weeks past.|Prince Ephraim and I were forced to surrender.|We've been held captive here in this dungeon since that black day.
speak;Seth;Did you gain any news from your captors during that time?

speak;Orson Evil;Unfortunately, no.|Not a word...|Our daily meal was brought to us by servants from the neighboring village.|They were instructed not to speak to us, and we heard nothing of the war.|Tell me, Seth.|How fares Renais?
speak;Seth;...Renais has fallen.|King Fado...|The king is dead.
speak;Orson Evil;Dead...|My King...|My apologies, Princess Eirika.|I have served you poorly....

speak;Eirika;You're not to blame, Sir Orson.|We must look to the future, not find fault in the past.|The Grado army pursues me in hopes of acquiring my bracelet.|My brother wears this bracelet's twin, and he is in danger, too.

speak;Orson Evil;Bracelet?|Ah, I remember...|Prince Ephraim still wears the bracelet.|And Grado is after them?|If that's the case, Princess...|Perhaps you should entrust the bracelets to someone else.

speak;Orson Evil;Give them to me or Seth.|Let someone you trust guard them.|If the empire desires you bracelet, you are in danger as long as you hold it.|For your own safety, Your Highness, please.|What say you?|We must not allow the Sacred Stone of Renais to be taken.
speak;Eirika;Everything you say is true and sensible, yet...
speak;Seth;...|Sir Orson.|I am sorry for this, but please give me your weapons.
speak;Orson Evil;What are you talking about, Seth?|Can't you see I'm unarmed?|Do you think they allow prisoners weapons?|What kind of injury have you taken that you suggest such foolishness?

speak;Seth;If I am mistaken, then I will give you all due apologies.|However, there are questions I have that I cannot answer.|Too many questions.|Why did no enemy reinforcements come from the castle during our battle outside?|Why would you escape your cell and yet leave Prince Ephraim in chains?|How do you know of the tie between the bracelets and the Sacred Stone?
speak;Orson Evil;Seth, there is some misunderstanding here.|I...
speak;Seth;And why...|Why do you conceal a blade within your doublet?
speak;Orson Evil;...Very well.|You haven't changed a bit, Seth.|If only Eirika had been alone.|You, however, simply will not be deceived.
speak;Orson Evil;My fondest wish will be granted...|To spend the rest of my days in the embrace of my loving wife once more...
speak;Tirado;That's enough.|You've done well, Orson.|I'll take over now.|You may return to your beloved wife.
speak;Tirado;We've never met.|I am Tirado.|Loyal and talented aide to Valter, general of the Grado army.
speak;Tirado;And you are General Seth of Renais, yes?|I thought to catch a little bird in my net, and it seems instead I've snared a hawk.

speak;Tirado;Ah, yes.|Your brother.|He's not here.|The coward fled Lord Valter's pursuit...|Somehow, he escaped the castle.|And escaping under these conditions...|Tch!|Such stubbornness is quite annoying.|It was my cunning that led us to turn this unfortunate blunder to our advantage.|I spread the rumors myself.|I led the villagers to believe he was our prisoner.|What better trap with which to catch his sweet, devoted sister?
speak;Tirado;Yes, but your no-doubt emotional reunion will have to wait until the afterlife.|Let's end this, shall we?|First, to destroy the bridge and cut off your only avenue of escape...
speak;Tirado;All soldiers to arms!|Kill the princess!|Take her bracelet!
speak;Seth;Princess Eirika, we have to get away from this place!

name: Talk_Seth_Kyle
_source: speak;Seth;Well met, Kyle.|I never thought for a moment that you could be bested easily.
speak;Kyle;No, sir!|And I never doubted that I would see you again.
speak;Kyle;We heard it all.|Unbelievable, isn't it?|But facts are facts.
speak;Seth;Yes.|If Orson can turn his back on Renais...|We remaining knights will have to work all the harder to prove ourselves!|Let's go, Kyle.

name: Talk_Franz_Forde
_source: speak;Franz;I should ask you!|We'd heard you were captured by Grado's men.|I was worried.

speak;Forde;Worried?|I ride with Prince Ephraim, little brother.|Death will have a tough time catching anyone who rides with our prince!|But it's not like we've avoided trouble altogether, that's for sure.|Hm?|Say, have you grown taller on me?
speak;Franz;I have.|I've also finished my training.|I'm now a sworn Knight of Renais.|You just watch-I'm going to be on par with General Seth one day!
speak;Forde;You want to be like the general, eh?|...What about me?
speak;Franz;Oh I...|I still want to be like you, too, Brother!

name: TiradoFight
_source: speak;Tirado;Hmm...|My men were unable to finish the job, were they?|It falls on me to show you my own special brand of power.

name: TiradoDeath
_source: speak;Tirado;Very...impressive...|However...|I expect you'll wish you'd died here on my steel.|Lord Valter is...not nearly as merciful as I...

name: EphraimEnter
_source: speak;Kyle;Prince Ephraim, I hear sounds from the east corridor.|Sounds like fighting.
speak;Forde;Do you think it could be General Seth and Princess Eirika?
speak;Ephraim;We have to goals here, men.|Save Eirika and vanquish the enemy.|Kyle.|Forde.|Are you ready?
speak;Kyle;Lord Ephraim, we should join forces with Princess Eirika first.|We should be able to reach them by way of the eastern corridor.
speak;Forde;Come now, Kyle.|That seems like a lot of trouble when we could just crush Grado between us.
speak;Kyle;A lot of trouble?|Forde, you're as insolent as you are careless!|If anything were to happen to Princess Eirika, we Knights of Renais would...
speak;Forde;Fine, fine.|I see where you stand.|Calm down, before you boil over.|Prince Ephraim will decide.|How shall we proceed, Your Highness?
speak;Kyle;We await your command, Prince Ephraim.

name: Talk_Seth_Ephraim
_source: speak;Seth;Princess Eirika is safe as well.|I'm afraid I have much news to relate to you.|That will have to wait, though.|For now, we must cut our way out of here.
speak;Ephraim;Yes.|Let's conclude our business here before we talk of other matters.|Come on!

name: Outro
_source: speak;Ephraim;I worried you, didn't I, Eirika?|And you as well, General?
speak;Seth;Not at all.|We're happy you're safe.|But tell me, Prince, do you know of Orson's treachery against you and all of Renais?

speak;Ephraim;Yes, though I learned of it all too late, after we'd been trapped at Renvall.|I still find it difficult to believe that after all his years of service to Renais...|I am morally responsible for his plight.
speak;Myrrh;Something's coming...|It's drawing near.|Dark...big...and great in number.
speak;Ephraim;I understand.|It looks like we should get out of here.
speak;Eirika;Um, Brother?|This girl...|Her hair is indigo...|Where did...
speak;Ephraim;Ah, that's a long story.|For now, we must move.|Suffice to say Emperor Vigarde has enlisted some...|otherworldly powers.|We must warn everyone of the danger.
speak;Eirika;I was thinking about Lyon.|The last time we saw him was a year and a half ago...
speak;Ephraim;You're right.|It was at Grado Keep.|...Has it really been only a year and a half?
speak;LyonF;We're over here, Eirika.|You'd better be quick.|Ephraim says he's tired of waiting.
speak;EirikaSepia;Oh, please, I'm sure you could wait a few moments longer...
speak;EphraimSepia;You're late.|How does it take you so long to prepare for such a simple trip?
speak;LyonF;Rest easy, Ephraim.|There's no need to be so curt with your own sister.|After all, a king must learn how to treat women with honor and discretion.|That's what Father MacGregor says.
speak;EirikaSepia;Thank you, Lyon.|You, unlike my dear brother, are a true gentleman.|I was up far too late thinking about my prayer to the temple flame last night.|And I'm afraid I...|I overslept...
speak;EphraimSepia;Your prayer?|What are you babbling about?
speak;LyonF;Come now, you know that the flame has been burning since the time of darkness ended.|You must know the story that the flame will answer the prayers of any pilgrim!
speak;EirikaSepia;Oh, Ephraim...|Father MacGregor is going to scold you for neglecting your studies so.
speak;EphraimSepia;...Don't even joke about that.|So tell us, what have you decided to pray for, Eirika?
speak;EphraimSepia;Me? Let's see...|I guess I'll pray to become a stronger fighter.
speak;EphraimSepia;...|I can never tell if you're complimenting me or mocking me.
speak;EphraimSepia;And you, Lyon?|What will you pray for?
speak;LyonF;What?|Me?|Hm...|I suppose all I really want is for all our people to be happy.
speak;EphraimSepia;...That's very, uh...|That's very much like you.
speak;LyonF;...Now, I'm the one who cannot tell if he's being praised or...
speak;EphraimSepia;You're being praised, as always, Lyon.
speak;EirikaSepia;Tell me, why the sudden decision to visit the temple?|Did my brother do something again?
speak;LyonF;Oh no.|It's not what Ephraim's done.|It's what he hasn't done.|He's learned nothing at all about the Sacred Stones and the temple flame, so...

speak;EphraimSepia;Father MacGregor became angry.|He said, One destined to become king and rule over a nation...|must know the history of his kingdom and must respect the Sacred Stones.|Ever since I came to Grado, my life has been chastisement and castigation.|Father MacGregor does not think me to be altogether too...kingly.
speak;LyonF;And yet General Duessel has nothing but praise for you, Ephraim.|He says you've brave and true, that you've the making of a great king.
speak;EphraimSepia;A great king?|I honestly have no idea what that means.|Eirika should succeed the throne.|I would be happy simply taking my lance and traveling the land as a mercenary.
speak;EirikaSepia;Ephraim, that is nothing but foolish, irresponsible romanticism!|Do you realize how much your words would fill Father's heart with grief?

speak;EphraimSepia;Are we speaking of the same man?|Our father will likely outlive us all.|For now, I'm content just learning the lance from General Duessel.|What about you, Lyon?|Is there anything you want to do?
speak;LyonF;Me? Well, I...|I suppose I want to become like my father.
speak;EirikaSepia;You were born to be the Emperor of Grado, Lyon. It suits you.

speak;LyonF;No, I don't think so.|I'm not-|One thing I do know from watching my father is that being emperor is hard.|Every day, he answers the complaints of the people, and he almost never sleeps...|My father is always so very tired. I hope one day that...|I hope that I can help him.
speak;EirikaSepia;Lyon...|You are so honorable.|You should learn from him, Brother.

speak;EphraimSepia;...Again with your criticism!|Tell me, Eirika.|What say you to dressing like me and becoming king in my stead?|You're so skinny, I doubt anyone would notice you're not really a man.
speak;Eirika;What do you suppose Lyon is doing now?|When Emperor Vigarde ordered the invasion...|How do you think Lyon felt?

speak;Ephraim;He's always been so gentle, but he worships his father.|He'd never question him. But the emperor...|He's clearly not behaving rationally.|I just hope he's not so far gone that he'd hurt his own flesh and blood.
speak;Eirika;I just pray for the day when the three of us can be together once again.
speak;Tana;Eirika!|Ephraim!|Welcome!|The two of you returning together, it's like a dream come true.|You must know, I've prayed every day for your safe return.
speak;Eirika;I'm so happy to see you, Tana.
speak;Ephraim;I'm sorry, Tana.|I didn't want for you to worry.

speak;Tana;Oh, it doesn't matter now...|All that really matters is that we've been brought together again.|My own brother will soon return from the field.|It will be nice to sit down and discuss things again.
speak;SoldierGreen;Princess Tana!|Prince Innes has returned from the front!
speak;Tana;Welcome home, dear brother!|I'm so happy to see you return safe and sound!
speak;Innes;You didn't expect less, did you?|Do you think Grado's slugs could touch me?|With my bow, I'll take down every Grado soldier form here to the emperor's palace!
speak;Eirika;It's good to see you, Prince Innes.
speak;Innes;...They say Renais has fallen.|I believe I warned you before.|This happened because you provided Grado the opportunity to strike.
speak;Tana;Brother!|Mind your tongue!|This is no occasion for such harsh words.|Ephraim and Eirika have lost their father to this terrible war...
speak;Innes;I'm sorry to hear of your father's death.|Hear me, Ephraim.|Our most important task is to defeat Grado and end this war.
speak;Ephraim;It's all right.|It's comforting to see that, in all of this, at least he hasn't changed.|Innes has hated me for as long as I can remember.

speak;Tana;My brother looks upon you as a rival, Ephraim.|And as you know, he wants to be the best at everything.|The best king, the best general, the best fighter, the best man...|He won't allow himself to be beaten at anything.
speak;Innes;...My father would like both of you to sit with him in a war council.|Will you come with me to take part in your official audience?
speak;Ephraim;Yes, of course.|There's much that I have to tell him.
speak;Eirika;It will be out honor to attend.
speak;Hayden;It does my heart good to see you all here safely within our castle walls.|...Would that we had more time for pleasantries, but...let us hear your news.
speak;Innes;Very well, I will begin.|I've directed the body of Frelia's army south to engage Grado directly.|Our troops are proving themselves superior, and the battle progresses favorably.
speak;Hayden;Hmm...|But the riddle still needs answering.|Why did Grado begin this war in the first place?
speak;Eirika;Your Majesty, we may well have found something relating to that...|We learned something on our travels, news that weighs heavily upon us.
speak;Hayden;Ah, yes.|Our messenger delivered your report to us a few days ago.|Grado is trying to destroy the Sacred Stones...|Is that it?
speak;Hayden;We've strengthened the tower's defenses.|Frelia's stone is safe for the time being.|But we remain confused in this.|What does Grado hope to gain by destroying the Sacred Stones?
speak;Eirika;We don't know.|The legends say the stones protect us all from the power of darkness.
speak;Ephraim;...I can't say if it relates, but I have a story about Grado.|It's...been troubling me, and I would like to share it with you all.|Myrrh.|Come here, please.
speak;Eirika;On her back...|Wings?|Ephraim, who is she?
speak;Ephraim;This is Myrrh.|I met here while fighting in Grado territory.|Myrrh, would you please tell everyone here the story you told me?
speak;Ephraim;Very well.|Myrrh tells me that she belongs to an ancient race of dragon folk.|They're mentioned in a few legends.|They're called the tribe of Manakete.
speak;Hayden;Yes, their name appears several times in the tale of the Sacred Stones.|It says they were neither human nor demon but a separate, aloof race.
speak;MyrrhD;......|We live in the east...in Darkling Woods.|One day...
speak;MyrrhD;We felt something.|An ominous energy to the south.
speak;Ephraim;From the direction of Grado.|They felt a...force flowing out of the Grado Empire.
speak;MyrrhD;Saleh and I...|We went to investigate this energy.|But on our way down, we came across a battle and were drawn into the conflict.
speak;Ephraim;Myrrh got lost and was wandering aimlessly in an isolated region near Grado's border.
speak;MyrrhD;I met some wicked folk there.|They deceived and enchained me. They stole my dragonstone.|They were preparing me for transport.|It was in that moment when Ephraim appeared and rescued me.
speak;Ephraim;I stumbled across Myrrh by chance when Grado's men had ambushed us.|Everything she told me seemed beyond belief, and yet...|And yet, when I saw her wings, what could I do but believe?
speak;MyrrhD;This dark wave of energy still flows from the southlands.|Its current is strong and runs deep.|It has awakened the evil ones.|I want to stop it.
speak;Hayden;What is so urgent you would interrupt a private council?
speak;SoldierGreen;The tower holding the Sacred Stone of Frelia...|It's been destroyed by the Grado Army!
speak;Hayden;What?|That's impossible!|What of the soldiers on watch?|There were supposed to be many...
speak;SoldierGreen;The enemy forces...|They were led by Caellach the Tiger Eye and Selena Fluorspar!|Our soldiers fell before even half a day had past!
speak;Seth;Selena Fluorspar...|Only General Duessel is higher in Emperor Vigarde's esteem...|She's the one.
speak;Hayden;She came personally...|So they really do wish to see the Sacred Stones destroyed.|Blast...
speak;Caellach;Hah!|So this hunk of rock is a Sacred Stone, eh?|So much fuss over something as fragile as this.|Watch.|It crumbles so easily.|Do we gain anything by this?|Not that I care, but...
speak;Caellach;Huh?|What's this?|Still breathing, are you?|Come.|If you've any last words, I'll hear them, fool of Frelia.
speak;Caellach;You waste your last words on insults?|And feeble ones, at that...|Hardly the right note to enter the eternal on, wouldn't you say?|Well then, die.
speak;Selena;Hold!|What are you doing, Caellach?!|Our job was to destroy the Sacred Stone.
speak;Caellach;I know that.|And I crush it, did I not?|But if we don't clean up these Frelian curs, they might-
speak;Selena;You do not raise your blade to anyone who is powerless to resist you!|The emperor does not desire us to kill without cause!|That would be murder!
speak;Caellach;Right, the emperor...|Your name's Selena, ain't it?|Tell me, Selena.|What makes that pasty-faced old fool's word so important?
speak;Selena;Wretch...|Do you dare insult His Imperial Majesty!?
speak;Caellach;Hey, hey, I'm joking.|Don't get so worked up.|I get it now. You're a true and loyal soldier.|I'm leaving before Frelia sends reinforcements.|Coming?

speak;Hayden;How could this happen...|How could I have allowed our Sacred Stone to be destroyed?|Dark energies from the empire's capital...|Evil monstrosities roaming our lands...|Vigarde's mad invasion...|And now this, the destruction of our sacred talisman.|And we have no idea of Grado's goals.|We are in the dark times once again.|But even so, we cannot sit here, wringing our hands.|First, we must warn the nations that house the remaining Sacred Stones.|If Vigarde seeks to destroy the Stones, they are all in grave danger.|Jehanna and Rausten must be warned.|The nations must joined together to fight our common foe.
speak;Eirika;Do you think they will believe us?
speak;Hayden;Hm...|It is a difficult tale to believe, I must agree.

speak;Innes;A direct visit from the Prince of Frelia is not something they can ignore.|I will travel to Jehanna, where I will forge an alliance with her queen.|If our Sacred Stone has been destroyed, the Frelia could be in greater danger.|Father, I cannot let you leave the nation in such a time of crisis.|It is imperative that I be the one to go.
speak;Eirika;And I will head for Rausten.
speak;Ephraim;Eirika?|You know I can't let you put yourself in such danger.

speak;Eirika;Rest easy, dear brother.|I will journey to Rausten by ship across the North Sea.|There will be no danger.|And I have made a vow.|I will fight as you have until the day Renais is liberated.
speak;Ephraim;King Hayden, I will take troops and march on the imperial capital from the west.
speak;Hayden;The west?!|Are you saying you will begin an assault on Grado from here?
speak;Ephraim;If we can take Grado Keep, the war will be over.|The Sacred Stones will be safe.|If we start here and press forward with all our might...
speak;Hayden;And once you reach the capital?|Vigarde's generals will be there waiting for you.
speak;Ephraim;If they oppose us, we will fight.

speak;Hayden;...You've got your father's foolhardy courage, don't you?|...Very well.|I entrust all our hope to you three.|Innes, you will go to Jehanna, Eirika to Rausten, And Ephraim to the imperial capital.|Funding you will have, but of soldiers, we have few to spare.|For each of you, a difficult road awaits.
speak;Ephraim;If any of us meets defeat, the battle will turn to Grado's favor.|There must be no errors.|We must not fail.
speak;Innes;Where I command, there are no mistakes.
speak;Eirika;I have no doubts.|I'll succeed, I swear it.|Come, it is time to go!
speak;Ephraim;Mm...|To be honest, I still do not want you to go.|I would rather you wait here for my return.

speak;Eirika;Please, Ephraim...|I will be fine.|There's no need for you to worry.|Mine is the easiest task, and I'll be in no danger.|I'm far more worried about your mission.|Challenging the might of an empire with a handful of men?
speak;Ephraim;What's this now?|Have you lost your faith in me?
speak;Eirika;No, of course not.|I know your true strength, Ephraim.|No one can defeat you.
speak;Ephraim;Ha ha!|Hearing you say that fills me with confidence.|I think I know my own limitations.|I won't overextend my reach.|I can't die and leave you on your own, can I?
speak;Ephraim;Let us both survive to be reunited.|Give me your word, Eirika.
choice;PathSplit;Will you accompany Eirika or Ephraim?;Eirika,Ephraim
speak;Ephraim;Is that you, Seth?|I'm almost ready to depart.|I'm leaving Eirika in your care.
speak;Seth;Actually, milord...|We have the honor of riding with you.
speak;Seth;The princess informs me that she will be accompanied by a Frelian escort.|She tells me she does not need a large retinue on such a small ship.
speak;Ephraim;I understand, but we must be prepared for anything.|I will be fine, Seth.|Please go and attend Eirika.

speak;Seth;Lord Ephraim, this is Lady Eirika's wish.|She implored us to lend our blades to you on the front lines...|She spoke to each of us individually.|She knelt before us and beseeched us to go.|Her sincerity, her concern...|We could not help but be moved by her plea.
speak;Ephraim;Oh, Eirika...|Very well.|You will all come with me.|But steel yourselves.|This will not be an easy journey.|I want only volunteers who are unafraid of meeting death.
speak;Seth;I'll let the others know.|I must tell you, milord-they are already preparing to depart.|They know the risks they are taking, and not a one will be deterred.
speak;Eirika;Yes.|Kyle, Forde, I'm traveling to Rausten.|I ask that you two serve my brother well.
speak;Forde;Actually, there's been a slight change of plans.
speak;Kyle;We're going with you, Your Highness.
speak;Kyle;Prince Ephraim rides with Frelia's finest at his back.
speak;Forde;And this was a personal order from the prince himself.|He said, I don't need you loafing around here.|Go and keep Eirika safe.|Since when is battling all of Grado loafing about?|Honestly!
speak;Eirika;You're right!|My brother's mission is far more dangerous than mine.|I will go and speak with him...
speak;Kyle;Princess Eirika.|Prince Ephraim said he's not concerned for his own safety.|These are the words our prince gave us, and we believe he means them.
speak;Forde;That's the truth of it.|There's no cause for worry, Princess Eirika.|We can all attest to the prince's tenacity.|No matter how close death comes, the Pale Horse will not catch him.
speak;Eirika;...Kyle, Forde...|I understand.|Thank you for your service and bravery.|You are my brother's most trusted and most valiant companions.|I would be honored to have you ride at my side.
speak;Kyle;The honor is ours.|We ride for Renais and for Princess Eirika!
speak;Forde;Let's not work ourselves into a frenzy right now.|When the time comes, I will be there to handle things.
speak;Eirika;Of course.|I'm depending on both of you.

name: OnLevelSelect_9A
_source: speak;Narrator;Eirika chooses to travel by sea to the theocracy of Rausten.|
speak;Narrator;Her search for a ship leads her to Port Kiris in Carcino.

speak;Narrator;Carcino is a young nation ruled by a council of merchants, and it is an ally of Frelia.|Carcino council leader Klimt, a staunch opponent of Grado's imperialistic actions, has pledged Carcino's support to Frelia in this conflict.
speak;Narrator;Prince Innes also intends to pass through Carcino on his way to Jehanna.|Eirika believes there is nothing to fear in Carcino, but she is wrong.

name: Village_2
_source: speak;Villager Man;Wh-what do you want?|Gimme a break...|Leave us out of this stupid war of yours!|We don't want anything to do with it!|Or... are you just another victim, like the rest of us here?|Well, regardless...|Here. Take this, and go do something about all this fighting, will you?

name: Village_1
_source: speak;Rennac;My, oh my...|It's about time they left.|I'm finally done getting ordered about without getting paid.|Huh?|Oh, don't mind me.|Just talking to myself.|Here, I want you to hold on to this for me.|Don't tell anyone.|Oh, and don't say a word about seeing me to Lady L'Arachel, all right?|Deal?

name: Turn5Rein
_source: speak;SoldierRed;Attention!|Carcino's mercenaries will arrest the princess of Renais shortly.|Our duty here is nearly ended, and I expect no further hostilities.|If you must fight, however, remember that the whole empire fights with you!
speak;Amelia;Sir!|I'm Amelia of Silva, sir!|I'm new.|I was only assigned to your command today.|I wanted to fight for the empire!
speak;SoldierRed;I don't need your life story, fool!|Recruits are in front!|Grab a lance and move!
speak;Amelia;Sir, yes sir!|This lance...|Stab the enemy.|I'm not afraid...|I'm a citizen of Grado.|It's my duty to fight.|And I'll fight my best!

name: Intro
_source: music;48- Solve the Riddle Orchestral Cover;500

speak;Vigarde Zombie;Frelia's Sacred Stone has been destroyed.|And yet you cannot locate the Stone of Renais.|Glen.|Valter.|Find the children of Renais.|Find them and take from them the bracelets that they wear.|Glen, take Eirika.|Valter, take Ephraim.|Find them.|Conquer them.
speak;Valter;Ha ha...|Eirika, eh?|She's a ripe little peach.|And her brother, Ephraim...|He's better prey than I'd imagined.|I can feel my blood rushing at the thought.|This might be fun after all.
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Caellach.|Riev.|Shatter the remaining Sacred Stones.|Caellach, take Jehanna.|Riev, take Rausten.|Go.|Crush the Sacred Stones they house.
speak;Riev;Heh heh heh...|As you will.|I'll begin making arrangements for Rausten's downfall immediately...
speak;Caellach;Bah!|Why am I stuck with Jehanna?|Accursed ill luck.|I became a mercenary to escape that wretched place, and now I must go back?
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Duessel.|Go to Frelia.|Take the Frelian army and punish Ephraim.
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Selena.|Remain in the capital.|Soon, I will have new orders for you.
speak;Eirika;Tana?|What are you doing?|You were supposed to remain in the palace.

speak;Tana;You left so abruptly, without any warning or farewell.|You and Ephraim have only just arrived, and already you leave on another quest?|Well, I'm your friend, Eirika, and I won't let you go into danger without me.
speak;Eirika;Does King Hayden know of this?
speak;Tana;No.|He'd just say I forbid you to go on this foolish errand, like always.|But I'm so worried about you.
speak;Eirika;Thank you, Tana.|I appreciate your concern, but King Hayden would-
speak;Tana;You and Ephraim, my father and my brother...|You're all fighting together, fighting for a noble cause.|I cannot be left out.|I will not be left out.|Please, Eirika.
speak;Eirika;...Oh...|All right.|I never could refuse you anything.|Come on.|Let's go, Tana.
speak;Seth;Your Highness, we've reached Port Kiris.|If we can find passage across the North Sea, we will reach Rausten in 10 days.
speak;Eirika;It smells of the tides...|This is a busy place, isn't it?
speak;Seth;It's a trade center.|Peoples of all nations pass through here.|Do not become so enthralled with the sights and sounds that you forget your mission.
speak;Eirika;I won't.|I'm a mercenary by the name of Erina.|I'm traveling to Rausten to receive a commission.
speak;Seth;Let us look for a ship then, Erina.|The docks are this way.
speak;Eirika;Seth, that woman over there?|Is that...
speak;Larachel;Oh, these dainty sugar pastries!|They're delightfully scrumptious!|Flavorful without being overwhelming, refined without being banal...
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Right you are, Lady L'Arachel!
speak;Eirika;We've met before, haven't we?|You arrived with your companions when we encountered those creatures...|Your name is L'Arachel, is it not?
speak;Larachel;A wonder and pleasure that we should meet again so soon!|It is providence!
speak;Rennac;Bad luck is the only thing the divine has ever provided you!
speak;Larachel;Oh, and if you have not yet tried one, these pastries are also divine.|Would you care for one?
speak;Eirika;Uh, thank you...|No, wait...|That's not why-|We're actually on our way to the Theocracy of Rausten.|We're rather in a rush and need to find passage on a ship...
speak;Larachel;Oh, dear.|I'm afraid you'll find none to assist you.|No ships are leaving port.

speak;Larachel;You see, I find myself heading home once more to my beloved Rausten as well!|And actually, I'm quite well known with the powers-that-be here in Port Kiris.|So I ordered them to ready the finest passenger vessel for me.|But both merchants and passenger ships alike are too frightened to set sail.|It seems a giant ghost ship has been sinking every ship it finds...|Would that I could confront it, I could stop its foul villainy in a moment.|Alas. It's such a shame.
speak;Eirika;Yes, yes...|Uh...|That is troublesome.|Still, I must get to Rausten somehow.
speak;Larachel;You needn't worry too much.|After all, if the sea is closed to you, simply follow the overland route!
speak;Eirika;The overland route?|I've heard that's a terribly roundabout path to travel.

speak;Larachel;Oh, it is, but don't you see?|The hardships of the road, they are truly blessings!|They will toughen you and strengthen your resolve when you need to face great evil.|For example, I have been tasked with a great trial in order to better me.|I understand my path, O unknowable forces of providence!|I, your faithful servant L'Arachel, shall overcome!|With faith and divine strength!
speak;Rennac;Now, listen, L'Arachel!|You might be thrilled about going the long way, but-
speak;Larachel;Come now, we're leaving.|Dozla?|Rennac?|Don't fall behind!
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Wait for us, Lady L'Arachel!|Come on, Rennac!|We run 'til we drop!|The first one to collapse from exhaustion is the winner!
speak;Rennac;Help...|Why is this happening to me?
speak;Eirika;...Uh, Seth?|Isn't Rausten in the other direction?|Aren't they heading toward Frelia?

speak;Seth;...It's nothing you need concern yourself with, milady.|Our only concern now is to decide our next course of action.|An overland journey would be very long.|However, it seems that may be our only choice at the moment...
speak;Binks;...You're Eirika, the princess of Renais, ain't ya?
speak;Binks;No need to get personal!|You know, there's a pretty price on your pretty head.|Sorry, but I need that gold.
if;game.check_alive("Colm") and game.check_alive("Lute") and game.check_alive("Ross") and game.check_alive("Kyle") and game.get_unit("Ross").klass != "T2_Lizard_Pirate"

name: Outro
_source: music;52- Into the Shadow of Victory Orchestral Cover;500
speak;Eirika;Yes, I believe so...|Who are these men?|They don't appear to be Grado Imperial troops.
speak;Seth;Judging by their crude swordplay, I'd say they're mercenaries.|We can expect more of them in the area, too, I think.|Wait here.
speak;Mercenary1;W-wait!|I give up!|I don't want to fight anymore!|We were just doing a job.
speak;Mercenary1;I may be nothing but a hired blade, but I have my honor.|I won't say a word.
speak;Seth;I admire your professionalism.|I guess we have no use for you.
speak;Mercenary1;No, wait!|I'll talk!|Carcino!|It was Pablo of the Carcino Council of Elders!
speak;Eirika;That doesn't make sense!|Carcino and Frelia are allies.|Why would they target me?

speak;Mercenary1;I don't know...|Could be they've decided Grado's going to win.|They want to be on the winning side.|Some of the others opposed Pablo, but I heard he had 'em all silenced but quick.|That's all I know, I swear it.

speak;Seth;We were careless.|We should have seen this coming.|Carcino's a young and ambitious nation ruled by power-hungry merchants.|And Grado grows more powerful with every passing day.|So it's no surprise Carcino's merchant lords would throw in with Grado now.
speak;Eirika;Wait! Prince Innes...|Prince Innes was to pass through Carcino on his way to Jehanna...|If Carcino has betrayed us, then he ran headlong into enemy territory...
speak;Eirika;I know you...|You were a messenger riding with Prince Innes.
speak;Messenger;Yes, and I have news of him.|Prince Innes is in danger!|Carcino's merchant army struck and cut through half our men.|The prince is trapped in a siege.|He has no means of escape, and-
speak;Eirika;No more!|I understand.|Return to Frelia and deliver your message!
speak;Eirika;Leave him to us.|The prince's troubles should burden you no more.|We will see him to safety.
speak;Rennac;...Hey, you.|Have Lady L'Arachel and her man, Sir Stubble-chin, gone yet?
speak;Eirika;Aren't you-|Yes, they no longer appear to be in the city.
speak;Rennac;Whew...|I'm finally free!|No more getting bossed around by that witless ninny!|Thanks. I owe you one.|Take this.|Now that I'm free again.|I think I'm just gonna wander about for a while.
speak;Eirika;...What a strange relationship they have.
speak;Seth;Lady Eirika, I think we ought to be leaving soon.
speak;Eirika;Yes.|We must hurry to Prince Innes's side!

name: LevelSelect_9B
_source: speak;Narrator;Ephraim begins his march south toward Grado from Castle Frelia.
speak;Narrator;Upon conquering Renais, the Grado Empire has set its sights on Frelia.
speak;Narrator;However, Innes and his troops meet the invaders at the waters edge.
speak;Narrator;Against all odds, Innes halts the invasion, keeping Frelia's border intact.
speak;Narrator;Ephraim coordinates Frelia's troops in an effort to advance the front lines.|Unbeknownst to Ephraim, Grado forces are waiting for them at Fort Rigwald.
speak;Narrator;They've fortified their positions and plan to wait out Frelia's siege.|Undaunted, Ephraim remains determined to root out Grado.

name: Intro
_source: music;48- Solve the Riddle Orchestral Cover;500

speak;Vigarde Zombie;The Stone of Frelia has already been taken care of...|How is it the Stone of Renais continues to elude us?|Glen.|Valter.|Find the children of Renais.|Find them and take from them the bracelets that they wear.|Glen, take Eirika.|Valter, take Ephraim.|Find them.|Conquer them.
speak;Valter;Ha ha...|Eirika, eh?|She's a ripe little peach.|And her brother, Ephraim...|He's better prey than I'd imagined.|I can feel my blood rushing at the thought.|This might be fun after all.
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Caellach.|Riev.|Shatter the remaining Sacred Stones.|Caellach, take Jehanna.|Riev, take Rausten.|Go.|Crush the Sacred Stones they house.
speak;Riev;Heh heh heh...|As you will.|I'll begin making arrangements for Rausten's downfall immediately...
speak;Caellach;Bah!|Why am I stuck with Jehanna?|Accursed ill luck.|I became a mercenary to escape that wretched place, and now I must go back?
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Duessel.|Go to Frelia.|Punish the Frelian army and their commander, Ephraim.
speak;Duessel;Begging your pardon, Your Majesty...|Now that you've conquered Renais, what are your plans for her citizens?|The country is in ruins.|Thieves and bandits swagger about as if-
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Selena.|Remain here in the capital.|We shall have new orders for you shortly.
speak;Duessel;Please, Your Majesty!|Grant me the privilege of a single question.

speak;Duessel;Your Majesty, you know that I will gladly lay down my life for an honorable cause!|But these orders-and all of our recent actions-they are not just!|If I saw in any way in which this invasion protected Grado, I would hold my tongue.|But now, Renais is left ungoverned to drown in chaos, and we gain nothing!|Why do you wage this war?|What is it you hope to achieve?|You've sent our men to fight and die for nothing!|This isn't war-it's murder!
speak;Vigarde Zombie;...Duessel.|This decision is ours to make.|You have no voice in these matters.
speak;Duessel;Punish me if you must, Your Majesty, but I implore you!|Please rethink this!!|If this continues, Grado will-
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Duessel.|Go to Frelia.|Crush the Frelian army and he who leads them, Prince Ephraim.
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Have you gone deaf?|Duessel.|Go to Frelia.|Crush the Frelian army and he who leads them, Prince Ephraim.
speak;SoldierRed;Commander Gheb!|We captured a pegasus knight snooping about outside.
speak;Gheb;Ooooh...|You didn't tell me she was such a treat for the eyes.|Heh heh...|This is a prize worth catching.
speak;Tana;I-I came for Ephraim.|If you do anything to me, he will not be merciful.
speak;Gheb;Heh heh...|I like her.|Throw her in a cell.|I'll spend the evening giving her a thorough interrogation.|Heh heh heh...
speak;Seth;That is Fort Rigwald.|It has stood unconquered for generations.|Its defenses are legendary.|It is the jewel of Grado's fortifications, and its walls have never been breached.
speak;Ephraim;And if we don't capture it, any attack on the capital will be pointless.|Tell me what you see, Seth.|Do we have the power to take it?
speak;Seth;It's a daunting task.|The enemy has the advantage of both terrain and numbers.
speak;Seth;Do you suspect the soldiers may be unwilling to fight?

speak;Ephraim;Anything's possible.|This war is a sudden thing, but Grado and Renais had long been friendly.|Before these hostilities, our nations were allies...|No, closer even than that.|This is the emperor's war, but the hearts of the people are not so swift to change.|For example, General Duessel, one of the Imperial Three they call Obsidian...|He was the one who taught me what I know about fighting with the lance.|Duessel's sympathies are sure to remain with Renais-and with our cause.|He is loyal to Grado, but he has no love of war.|I'm sure he will speak with me.

speak;Ephraim;And more than that, Prince Lyon has been my friend for years.|He can be timid at times and perhaps was unable to oppose his father in this.|But I'm sure he detests this fighting and shares my opinions.
speak;Ephraim;There must be some Grado soldiers within the castle who do not want to fight.|If we can rush the fort and seize the throne room, I believe they will surrender.
speak;Seth;...Optimism here may be deadly.|Still, it's a far better plan than challenging the main army face-to-face.
speak;Ephraim;Eirika is on her way to Rausten to help end this conflict.|We cannot afford to wait here for much longer.|We must take this fort and then press on to the capital itself.|Let's go!
speak;SoldierGreen;Attack!|We're under attack!|...Looks to be Frelian troops.|Their commander is...|Prince Ephraim of Renais!
speak;SoldierRed;Renais?|This whole thing stinks.|My younger sister and her husband were living in Renais...|What is the emperor thinking, starting this war?|I think-
speak;Gheb;Yeah, I heard you.|Talking about not fighting, are you?|Losing your nerve?|The punishment for treason is harsh.|You'll burn at the stake.
speak;SoldierRed;B-but-|It's not just me!|Even General Duessel is opposed to this war!
speak;Gheb;Duessel?|You'd side with that washed-up coward?|And who is your commanding officer?|Is it Duessel?|Come on, out with it!

speak;Gheb;That's right.|So that should make it clear whose orders you follow, eh?|You got that, dolts?|If you do, then shut up and get in formation.|No one cares whether you minnows live or die anyway.|Got it?
speak;Amelia;W-wait a moment!|That's a horrible thing to say!
speak;Gheb;And who are you supposed to be?|Your name!|Out with it!
speak;Amelia;I-I'm Amelia...|I was assigned to this fort today!|I am a soldier of Grado.|I am not a slave!
speak;Gheb;What's this now?|You're a girl?|You've got a lot of nerve talking like that to your commander, recruit.|Looks like I'm going to have to teach you about the chain of command.

speak;Gheb;Grrr!|Stinking interruptions...|Form up, you useless worms.|Don't let those dogs near the throne.|Grado cannot afford to lose a brilliant tactician of my stature!|No one will blink if any of you worthless toads dies.|But if I die-|You should be happy to fight, kill, and die in my service!
speak;Amelia;I became a soldier to honor the emperor, General Duessel, and the people of Grado.|But this...this is wrong!
speak;SoldierRed;That's the lot of a soldier.|We're pawns in the games of kings and emperors.|We fight as ordered, and we die as ordered.|That's it. C'mon, time to go.

speak;Tana;Oh, what a fool I've been...|I came all this way to help Ephraim, and I end up getting captured again.|That General Gheb had the creepiest eyes...and that laugh!|Oh!|Hurry, Ephraim...|Please. Hurry and rescue me.

name: RecruitAmeliaFranz
_source: speak;Franz;Are you one of the locals?|This is a dangerous spot.|You should hide.|Here, come with me.
speak;Franz;I'm Franz, a Knight of Renais.|What's your name?|What are you doing here?
speak;Amelia;I-I'm Amelia.|I'm...|Actually, I'm a Grado soldier.|I'm supposed to be fighting you.
speak;Amelia;...I guess...|Are you...|Are you going to make me your prisoner?!
speak;Franz;No!|No, I wouldn't do that.|But...this is a problem.
speak;Franz;First of all, you must listen to me and do as I say.|We'll talk to Princess Eirika later.
speak;Amelia;What?|NO!|My commander told me Eirika's a cruel and merciless fiend who-

speak;Franz;Oh, that's utter nonsense.|I've never heard the princess utter an unkind word to anyone.|I understand why you're frightened.|You think we're the enemy.|But if you'd only trust me...|Will you come with me?
speak;Amelia;Mm...|Well, all right.|I'll trust you, Franz.

name: AmeliaRecruitFranz
_source: speak;Amelia;Ah!|Don't make fun of me!|I'm a soldier of Grado!|Prepare yourself, Frelian dog!
speak;Franz;Are, are you all right?|It's not surprising you fell over from that stance.|Can you get up?
speak;Franz;Did you hurt your knee?|I know how it feels.|I did it often enough as a recruit myself.|To be honest, I still do it more than I should.
speak;Franz;I'm Franz.|I'm a Knight of Renais.|What's your name?
speak;Franz;Amelia, do you think I could ask you to surrender?|This may be odd, but I really have no desire to fight you.
speak;Franz;I get the feeling you don't want to fight either.|Am I right?
speak;Amelia;I...|B-but...|I've heard Prince Ephraim takes female prisoners and uses them as palace slaves.|If I surrender, will I be forced to work in the palace, too?
speak;Franz;N-no, don't be silly!|Prince Ephraim would never do such a thing...I think...
speak;Franz;No, he wouldn't!|Of course not.|You have my word of honor.
speak;Amelia;...Well, you seem sincere.|I'll trust you, Franz.

name: AmeliaRecruitEphraim
_source: speak;Ephraim;You're a Grado soldier?|But you're just a child.
speak;Amelia;I am not a child!|I'm a soldier of Grado, and I will defeat every soldier of Frelia I meet!
speak;Ephraim;Is that so?|Guess I'm ready then.
speak;Ephraim;...Is that the stance you're going to use?|You'll drop your lance that way.|I'm Prince Ephraim of Renais.|Why don't you surrender and come with me?
speak;Amelia;Wha-what are you going to do to me?!
speak;Ephraim;Calm down.|As long as you don't try to stab me, I won't do a thing to harm you.
speak;Amelia;You lie!|You're a liar!|Everyone knows about Prince Ephraim of Renais.|He's a beast who attacks any woman he sees...

speak;Ephraim;.....Right, this has gone far enough.|I am not going to hurt you.|If you're scared, throw down your weapon and run away.|But...If you're willing to listen, I'd like to ask for your help.|You must realize this whole war is madness, right?|Something is wrong in Grado.

name: FightGheb
_source: speak;Gheb;Wh-what was that?|You piece of trash, what do you think you're doing?

name: FightBinks
_source: speak;Binks;Blast!|This ain't right!|These guys are too tough...|5,000 gold ain't nearly enough for this!

name: Outro
_source: speak;Seth;Prince Ephraim, the rest of the enemy troops have been routed.
speak;Ephraim;Bring me one of the prisoners.|I have a question I need answered.
speak;Ephraim;I'm going to ask you a question.|If you've no wish to answer, remain silent.|If you wish this conflict to end quickly, however, you will cooperate.
speak;SoldierRed;...I can't say.|This war began on the emperor's orders.|Soldiers like me haven't the foggiest idea what he's after.
speak;Ephraim;Then tell me this.|Where is General Duessel?

speak;SoldierRed;In the capital.|The general's been opposed to this war from the start.|He's been pleading with the emperor for days now, but the emperor ignores him.|They say some are questioning the general's loyalty.|He's putting his standing-and his life- in danger by being so vocal.

speak;Ephraim;Is that so...|Well, it appears that General Duessel remains the same true man I knew before.|What about Prince Lyon?|Where's he been through all of this?|Why didn't he do anything to temper his father's aggression?
speak;SoldierRed;According to rumors...|Emperor Vigarde was convinced to start this war by none other than the prince himself.
speak;Ephraim;What did you say?|That's ridiculous!|I know Prince Lyon well.|No one hates fighting more than he does.|He would never do anything to trigger all this bloodshed!

speak;Ephraim;We leave the prisoners and the fort to the Frelian troops.|Seth, I intend for us to press on toward the capital.|At some point, I expect we'll find either Duessel or Lyon.|I'm sure we can convince them to join us in stopping Emperor Vigarde.
speak;Seth;Understood.|But I have misgivings, my prince.|General Duessel and Prince Lyon are both men of Grado.|If we are forced into conflict with them...
speak;Ephraim;It won't happen.|Duessel was my teacher, and I know he is a man of character.|And I've known Lyon since we were children.|He, Eirika, and I are old friends.
speak;Ephraim;I understand your concerns.|If worse comes to worst and steel is drawn, I will not hesitate.|I'll fight and kill anyone who thinks to oppose me.|Are you satisfied, Seth?
speak;Seth;Yes...|I apologize for my rudeness.|Your father is gone, and that means you are king of Renais.|There is no other.|I just ask that you not throw yourself into needless danger.
speak;Ephraim;I hear you.|The decisions I make affect more than my own life.|Once this war is finished, I will rebuild Renais with Eirika.|That is my mission.
speak;Ephraim;You must return to Frelia.|I cannot take you any farther on this journey.
speak;Myrrh;What?|No.|I want to stay with you...
speak;Ephraim;No, Myrrh.|I'm continuing on to the Grado capital.|It's going to be very dangerous.|I can't protect you-not as well as I'd like to, anyway.
speak;Myrrh;Everything comes from that direction.|I can feel my lost dragonstone...|And that's not all.|The dark energy still flows unchecked...|I cannot go home while it stains the air...
speak;Ephraim;...Very well.|Ah, I simply cannot refuse you anything.|Your eyes remind me too much of Eirika.|You must not stray from my side, do you understand?
music;48- Solve the Riddle Orchestral Cover;500
speak;Selena;I am ready, Your Majesty.|In your service, I am prepared to do-
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Duessel has left for Bethroen.|Take a battalion and follow him.
speak;Selena;Understood.|When I arrive, I will place my troops at his disposal.
speak;Vigarde Zombie;No...|You will not.|You will strike Duessel down.
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Duessel is a traitor.|He has abandoned his country and sided with Renais.|The punishment for treason is death.
speak;Selena;B-but...|General Duessel a traitor?|That's just not possible!|There must be a mistake...
speak;Selena;No...|I did not mean that you are mistaken, Your Majesty.|But...but...
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Selena.|You have your orders.|You will execute Duessel.
speak;Selena;...Your Majesty.|Will you allow me to ask you a question?

speak;Selena;When Your Majesty saw fit to make me a general, you shared with me some words of wisdom.|I remember the moment quite clearly.|You told me the role of an imperial general is that of the shield, not the blade.|We are here to protect our citizens, you said-not to threaten our neighbors.|I have never forgotten your words, Your Majesty.|I have held them to my breast.|They govern my every action as general.|Your Majesty, that sentiment is still alive, and-
speak;Selena;I humbly acknowledge your orders.|Your Majesty...|I am the empire's servant.|I am Your Majesty's vassal.|I am General Selena, the Fluorspar of the Grado Empire.

name: OnLevelSelect_10A
_source: speak;Narrator;Carcino has betrayed Frelia and joined forces with Grado.

speak;Narrator;Carcino's troops stop Prince Innes, blocking his way to Jehanna. With soldiers occupying the road forward and back, he is trapped in a hopeless situation. Eirika rushes to the prince's aid.

name: Intro
_source: music;48- Solve the Riddle Orchestral Cover;500
speak;Vigarde Zombie;General Glen of the Grado Imperial Army, also known as the Sunstone...
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Your orders.|Capture the leader of the rebel army in Carcino.|Capture Eirika.
speak;Glen;Eirika...|Do you mean the princess of Renais?
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Eirika invaded Carcino.|She massacred the citizens of Port Kiris.|Then, she fled south.|Glen.|Go.|Crush the rebels who brought ruin to Carcino.
speak;Cormag;What did the emperor say, Brother?
speak;Glen;I've been ordered to kill the princess of Renais.|Cormag, I want you to remain here in the capital.|I'll go alone.
speak;Cormag;If that's what you want, Brother, so be it.|But you seem troubled...|Don't tell me you're concerned about fighting the princess of a ruined land!
speak;Glen;...Hm...|I never was able to slip anything past you, little brother.|You're right.|This duty falls heavily on my shoulders, more then any other.
speak;Cormag;Tell me, Brother, do you know this princess?

speak;Glen;Yes.|When Renais and Grado were still close...|I met the girl-|I met Eirika only once.|We spoke briefly, but I felt she was a woman of great kindness.|I cannot bring myself to believe Princess Eirika is evil.|I cannot.

speak;Glen;There's the rub, Cormag.|That's it exactly.|His Majesty has never spoken a falsehood in all the time I've served him.|And as a servant of the empire, I am duty bound to obey his orders.|But I can see no reason to think Princess Eirika's heart is any less gentle now.

speak;Valter;What are these cowardly mutterings?|It is because you three generals are weak that we others must work so hard.|And yet you get the honor of killing the girl.|How I long to do your duty for you!
speak;Valter;What's this?|Is this how you speak toward your peer knights of the realm?|Lest you've forgotten, I, too, am a general-the same rank as you.
speak;Glen;You wretch.|You were cast out from the army for mistreating civilians.|What lies have you told to receive pardon and reinstatement at the same time?

speak;Valter;Our beloved emperor felt my skills were needed, and his word is law.|His majesty has earned my sincerest and most undying gratitude.|And then we have you three.|Duessel, Selena, and you...|The three of you have proven to be unreliable time and time again.|We were brought in to plug the holes, don't you see?|You ought to thank me, Glen!
speak;Cormag;Valter!|If you dare insult my brother further...
speak;Valter;Come now, Cormag.|And what would you do to me if I did?|Would you fight me?|Here?|Would you show such disloyalty to the emperor?
speak;Glen;Peace, Cormag.|We are His Majesty's men.|We will honor his commands.|Mark my words, Valter.|Your crimes are neither forgotten nor forgiven.
speak;Gerik;Prince Innes.|What do you say?|Can you continue?
speak;Innes;Yes, of course.|Do you believe this is enough to make me give up?|I am surprised you mercenaries haven't turned and fled, though.

speak;Gerik;Naw. You see, Gerik's Mercenaries takes its name from me, Gerik.|I'm the chief here.|If I quit while our employer still fought on, they'd want a new name, you follow me?|So... What's the plan?

speak;Innes;Same as before.|We remain surrounded.|They're not going to allow us simply to walk out of here...|I send a messenger off with news of our plight.|However, even on the wings of a pegasus knight, Frelia is days away.|We can expect no help from them.
speak;Gerik;So we tighten our belts and survive, is that it?|Or would you rather quit this place and rest in comfort?
speak;Innes;Surrender?|I'm the prince of Frelia.|I don't know the meaning of the words.|The fate of the world rides on my shoulders, and I'll make it to Jehanna.|Even if I have to crawl to do it.
speak;Gerik;Now, that makes me feel better.|If you're so determined, we may all live a little while longer...
speak;Tethys;I've got bad news...and then I've got worse news.
speak;Tethys;We've no more weapons in reserve.|What you're holding is what we've got.|Once those are gone, there won't be much fight left in us.
speak;Gerik;That is bad news...|Well? What's the worse news?
speak;Tethys;They've begun to move.|They're going to attack again.|Looks like they're sending up the whole lot of 'em this time.
speak;Innes;Right.|You two, you're done here.|Discharged.|Fired.|Whatever.|You can surrender or flee.|The choice is yours.

speak;Innes;I'm the one they're after.|Throw down your weapons, and you'll walk away alive.|I don't need you here.|You'll only be in my way.|Who knows?|You filthy sellswords'll probably sell me out anyway.
speak;Tethys;Hold on there!|That's not true, and you know it!
speak;Gerik;Peace, Tethys.|Hey, Prince.|What are you going to do?
speak;Innes;I'm going to get out of here on my own.|I'll break to the south and escape into the mountains.
speak;Gerik;That ain't gonna be easy.|How you plan on doing that.
speak;Innes;I'm not telling you.|I've no idea when you'll decide to betray me.|Go on.|Get out of here.|I'd rather do this alone.
speak;Gerik;Sounds like you're trying to make sure you're the only one who dies.

speak;Innes;Fool.|I've no intention of dying.|But there can be no false hope of reinforcements riding in to save the day.|You and I are not the same.|You're a commoner, and I'm Frelia's heir.|We of noble birth do not shirk the duties to which we are born.
speak;Innes;What are you waiting for?|You may go.
speak;Gerik;Well played, milord.|I've always loved the melodrama of martyrdom...|There's no way I can abandon you after that fine performance.|I'm staying with you.|To the end.
speak;Innes;To the-|What are you saying?|You dare ignore the orders of the one who's paying your wages?!
speak;Gerik;Tethys, I want you to go and surrender.|Give my regards to Ewan and Marisa.
speak;Tethys;Don't be ridiculous.|I'm not going anywhere.|Now would the two of you kindly stop acting like such...men?|And you!|You've already fired us.|You can't order us to leave now.
speak;Innes;Unbelievable...|And you people call yourselves mercenaries?|I thought you fought for money, not for duty.

speak;Gerik;Yeah, that's one of the rules.|Guess we're lousy mercenaries, eh?|Now let's get thinking.|We still need a plan to get us all out of here alive.|You're supposed to be a good tactician, so I figure I won't die easily.|Tell us what to do, Prince.|We'll follow your orders.
speak;Innes;......Hm.|Very well.|I'll see what I can do to avoid getting us filled with arrows.
speak;Tethys;Ah... Say, Prince.|If, by some miracle, aid were to come, from what direction would it arrive?
speak;Innes;...From the north.|But there's little or no hope of that.|Even if Frelia were to send us aid, they would not arrive until...
speak;Tethys;This may be good news...|Then again, it may be more bad news.|There. On that northern mountain path...|Someone's coming.
speak;Seth;Princess Eirika, the prince is surrounded by the mercenary armies of Carcino.|He looks vastly outnumbered.|I doubt he can hold out much longer.

speak;Innes;I'll show Ephraim I can get out of situations like this.|My <red>Bow</> is tuned up just for this!|My father even trained me in this <red>Sword</> if needs be.|A <red>Lance</> too if things get desperate...
speak;Gerik;This may be our last battle...|I still got my <red>Sword</> and can use an <red>Axe</>.|I've got plenty of fight in me!|Maybe can even find a <red>Lance</> to use!|Ha ha ha!

name: En_Turn1
_source: speak;Pablo;Heh heh...|My plan to get rid of Klimt has yielded some unexpected fruit.|The head of Frelia's Prince Innes will make a fine gift to Grado.
speak;SoldierRed;Lord Pablo, Prince Innes and his men have taken refuge in a mountain stronghold.|Do we have your permission to finish them off?
speak;Pablo;Yes.|Flush the prince out and cut him down.|We'll find Klimt later and roast his old bones as well.|Heh heh heh...
speak;Villager Man;Lord Klimt, Pablo's troops are moving toward the stronghold.|It looks like they're planning on chasing down Prince Innes and his men.

speak;Klimt;Pablo, you mad, reckless imbecile...|If Prince Innes dies here, the bond between Carcino and Frelia is sundered forever.|Carcino will be nothing more than a vassal paying tribute to Grado...|We must find some way to aid Prince Innes.
speak;Villager Man;Wait, my lord Klimt!|Pablo is after you as well.|If you reveal yourself here...
speak;Klimt;Ahh...|May fortune keep you safe, Prince Innes...

name: En_Turn3
_source: speak;SoldierRed;Hey!|You're up!|You're getting paid a lot more than us common soldiers.|Time you earned your gold!
speak;Marisa;I hear you.|Where do I start killing?
speak;SoldierRed;Th-that way!|The Frelian troops!|Don't point that blade in our direction!
speak;Marisa;I'll do what I can.|No promises.|Good day.
speak;SoldierRed;Whew...|So that's Marisa, the Crimson Flash of Gerik's Mercenaries...|She's a beauty, but I'll keep my distance...and keep my head.

name: GameOver_10A
condition: game.check_dead("Eirika") or game.check_dead("Innes") or game.check_dead("Gerik") or game.check_dead("Tethys")

name: InnesTalkTana
_source: speak;Innes;Tana?!?|What?|How did...|What are you doing here?
speak;Tana;I came with Eirika.|Wait here, Brother.|It's my turn to protect you.
speak;Innes;Stop playing the soldier, Tana.|You will return to the palace at once.
speak;Tana;I will not!|Eirika, Ephraim, and you are all risking so much...|I can't sit at home and watch!|I have to do something to help.
speak;Innes;Tana...|...We'll talk about this later.|For now, we join forces with Eirika.

name: GerikTalkInnes
_source: speak;Gerik;Lucky us, eh?|Good thing we held out as long as we did.
speak;Gerik;Don't let your guard down now, Prince.|There are still enemies to fight, and it'd be such a shame to die now.

name: TethysTalkGerik
_source: speak;Gerik;Hey, Tethys.|Looks like help is on the way.
speak;Tethys;Really?|Perhaps faith is a good thing.|I've never had much before, but perhaps good things do happen to good people.
speak;Gerik;Good things?|I like the sound of that.|What do you suppose might come my way?

name: TethysTalkInnes
_source: speak;Tethys;Really?|Perhaps faith is a good thing.|I've never had much before, but perhaps good things do happen to good people.
speak;Innes;Faith had nothing to do with this.|Let's go.|We must join them.

name: GerikTalkTethys
_source: speak;Tethys;Say, Chief.|I've got good news, and I've got better news.
speak;Tethys;Within our band of mercenaries...|There are two women enamored of you.
speak;Gerik;Huh?|What're you talking about?|You a fortune-teller now?|And what's the better news?
speak;Tethys;Help has arrived.|Looks like we may survive after all.

name: MarisaTalkGerik
_source: speak;Gerik;What a mess...|Looks like the guild bungled.|They're usually diligent about making sure this sort of thing doesn't happen.|But here we are, two people of the same troop, working for opposite sides.

speak;Gerik;Aye, well, that's a good question...|As a mercenary, your loyalty should always lie with the person paying your wages.|You decide.|We can cross blade if you want, but I'd rather you retreat.|'Course, if you betray your employer, you'll soil your sterling name.
speak;Marisa;C'mon, Chief.|What would YOU like me to do?
speak;Gerik;Well, that's easy.|I'd like you to come over and join my side.
speak;Gerik;Ho-hold on...|Is that it?|Just like that?|You know what this will do to your reputation, right?

name: House_1
_source: speak;Man1;You know we have no king in the Republic of Carcino.|We're governed instead by a council of elders.|It's a lot better than any stuffy, old monarchy, I can tell you that.|You see, anyone can be a leader in Carcino if he's old enough.|Of course, maybe that's why the country's in such a mess right now.

name: House_2
_source: speak;Woman2;Elder Pablo used his fortune to build his own private army.|Now he's using it to wrest control of Carcino from the council's hands...|Please...help Lord Klimt, so that he can help us.

name: House_3
_source: speak;Villager Man;I've heard that Prince Innes of Frelia is a fantastic tactician.|Grado took Renais with no trouble, but Frelia still has yet to fall.|They say it's because Prince Innes has spies reporting every move the empire makes.|At the same time, all enemy spies in Frelia are exposed and executed swiftly.|That means that none of Frelia's secrets are ever reported back to the empire.|I've never met Prince Innes, but he doesn't sound like a man you'd want as an enemy.

name: FightPablo
_source: speak;Pablo;No one can withstand the might of Grado...|Logic dictates we join now or be subjugated later.|I made the rational decision.|The only decision!

name: DeathPablo
_source: speak;Pablo;Urrgh...|N-no.|I cannot die when there is such wealth to be had...|Re-retreat!|Mercenaries, to me!

name: FightPabloInnes
_source: speak;Innes;You're one of Carcino's councilmen.|Trying to trap me is a mistake.|Failing, an expensive one.|I think it's time for you to learn how expensive.

name: Outro
_source: speak;Valter;...I've found you, Eirika.|Seems you're as skilled as reports say.|This is going to be fun.|Yes, yes, yes.|I do so love strong women.
speak;Valter;No, we'll pass on dessert for now.|Allow them to escape.|We're leaving.
speak;Klimt;Oh, Prince Innes!|Thank goodness, you're unharmed!
speak;Klimt;Oh, where are my manners?|I am a member of Carcino's Council of Elders.|My name is Klimt.
speak;Innes;So you're one of the traitors who ordered-
speak;Klimt;P-please, please!|I have no intention of opposing you or quarreling with you.|I, too, have been marked for death by Pablo...
speak;Klimt;It's a shameful tale...|Carcino is a nation divided.|As you know, Carcino has no king but is ruled by a council.|But now the council has broken apart into factions mired in discord...
speak;Eirika;Factions...|You're saying that the whole of Carcino has not betrayed Frelia?

speak;Klimt;Correct.|The moderate factions prefer to preserve our alliance with Frelia.|Pablo's faction wishes to endear us to Grado, to surrender us to their armies.|Once Pablo realized he couldn't ply us with brides, he began to have us assassinated.|Those of us who remain have taken refuge underground.|We oppose him where we can.|If you hadn't shown up, I'm not certain I would still be breathing...
speak;Innes;I do recall enemy troops combing this area when I arrived...|They were searching for you, is that it?

speak;Klimt;Pablo has usurped rule of the council.|We had no choice but to hide.|Not all of Carcino's council has gone over to Grado's side, though...|You must believe me-the whole of Carcino does not believe as Pablo does.
speak;Eirika;Lord Klimt...|I understand the hardships you've endured.|I am pleased to hear all of Carcino is not our foe.

speak;Klimt;I will depart at once for Frelia to explain our circumstance to the king.|I think it is best if you return to Frelia as well.|Pablo has considerable wealth, and he commands a vast mercenary force.|I'm sure he'll send more of them this way as soon as he is able.
speak;Gerik;Prince Innes.|Tethys and I are staying with you.|Is that gonna work?

speak;Innes;Yes, I would appreciate the help.|Starting now, you've got a new contract, though-the pay's double.|If the two of you hadn't stayed with me back there, I would not have survived.|Gerik, Tethys...|Thank you. You have my gratitude.
speak;Tethys;Tell me something, Prince.|Did you get...er...hit on the head during that last skirmish?
speak;Innes;...That's unkind.|My neck is not so stiff that I cannot show gratitude.|I would ask for your continued support in the days ahead.
speak;Eirika;We both ask for your help.
speak;Gerik;We've got a deal.|Let's keep each other alive.
speak;Tethys;Ewan!|How is it...|What are you doing here?|I told you to wait in the inn and behave yourself, didn't I?
speak;Ewan;Yeah, but you always run off and disappear.|It's not fair.|I want to have adventures, too.
speak;Tethys;You are such an imp...|I am not out here running about having fun, you know?
speak;Ewan;I know.|That's why I came to see you.|I can help.|My teacher finally got around to teaching me some magic.|Check this out.
speak;Tethys;H-hey!|Knock it off!|You shouldn't be using magic here!
speak;Ewan;Well, I just thought maybe I could help you work is all.|I can protect you now, sis.|Come on, take me with you.|I don't wanna stay in that inn anymore.
speak;Tethys;Oh...all right.|I'll go speak and speak to the Chief and Princess Eirika.|Don't wander off while I'm gone.
speak;Seth;Princess Eirika, Prince Innes.|I think we should follow the advice we've been given and return to Frelia.|Continuing on through Carcino like this is too great a risk to your safety.
speak;Innes;The peril is self-evident.|However, I have to reach Jehanna, and the only way is through Carcino.|If I don't hurry, nations will fall, one after another, to Grado's hunger.
speak;Eirika;Innes is right.|And the road to Rausten leads me through both Carcino and Jehanna.|However, pressing on will only invite more mercenary attacks.
speak;Ewan;Hey, I've got an answer.|I know a way that leads over the mountains straight to Jehanna!|Want me to guide you?
speak;Tethys;Ewan!|Shush!|You know better than to interrupt people when they're talking.|I'm so sorry.|Please let me take my brother out of the way.|Come on, Ewan. Let's go.
speak;Eirika;No, no-wait, please.|Do you really know a route through the mountains?
speak;Ewan;That's what I said.|At the top of that mountain, there's a village named Caer Pelyn.|That's where my teacher lives.|I'm sure he'll lead you through if you ask him nicely.

speak;Innes;Saleh...|I've heard that name on the lips of Frelia's spy network lately.|He's a powerful wielder of magic who has been fighting bandits and monsters.|The spies mentioned something about a Caer Pelyn, if I remember.
speak;Innes;Hm.|If my spies are accurate, this Saleh is someone we can trust.
speak;Eirika;Very well, Ewan.|Will you take us to meet your teacher?
speak;Tethys;Are you sure you can do this, Ewan?
speak;Ewan;Not a problem!|All right, everyone.|See if you can keep up!

name: OnLevelSelect_10B
_source: speak;Narrator;A former lance instructor to Ephraim, Grado's General Duessel often came to Renais as an emissary of his empire.
speak;Narrator;Despite their stations, the two men share similar dispositions and a warm relationship.
speak;Narrator;Why has Grado Started this war?|What is the miasma of evil emanating from the country?|Ephraim believes that Duessel can answer these questions.
speak;Narrator;It is this belief that propels Ephraim forward into Grado territory.

name: Intro
_source: speak;Messenger;Please wait, Prince Ephraim.|I have a message from Frelia.|There's been an uprising in Carcino.|Pablo is leading a force of renegade Grado supporters in rebellion.
speak;Ephraim;In Carcino...|Any word of Eirika?|Is my sister safe?
speak;Messenger;The last word we received had Princess Eirika heading to assist Prince Innes.|We've not heard from her since.
speak;Ephraim;...Blast.|I sent Eirika to Rausten thinking it would be the safest mission.|If I could, I'd pull out of here now and go look for her but...
speak;Ephraim;...I know, I know.|I mustn't let my emotions dictate my actions.|If Carcino has allied itself with Grado, then defeating Grado is out best bet.|We proceed as planned.|Tell them that.
speak;Ephraim;...What?!|Was that an earthquake?|I think it's passed.
speak;Ephraim;I'm fine.|There's nothing to worry about.|I was surprised, that's all.|You're not shaken in the slightest, are you?
speak;Seth;Actually, it surprised me as well.|I've heard that tremors such as those were commonplace in Grado.|Apparently, they are usually weak and cause little, if any, damage.

speak;Ephraim;Now that you mention it, I remember a while back, when I was first in Grado.|Eirika and I were startled by a tremor just like that one.|Lyon said he had grown used to them, and he just laughed.
speak;Ephraim;We don't have any time to tend to injuries just now.|We must press forward.|We must see to the capital.
music;48- Solve the Riddle Orchestral Cover;500
speak;Duessel;I do not understand...|Why this course of action?|What is the emperor thinking...
speak;Duessel;...Is that you, Selena?|Are you to be assisting me in this...duty?
speak;Selena;Yes...|Frelia's army will be coming soon from the north.|We're just waiting for the order to engage them.
speak;Duessel;Hm...|Prince Ephraim leads the enemy forces, doesn't he?
speak;Selena;That is correct.|Prince Ephraim of Renais.
speak;Selena;Renais is our enemy.|General, please give the order to attack.
speak;Duessel;No.|Order all units to hold.|Do not initiate the attack.|I want to speak with Ephraim first.
speak;Selena;So it's true.|You plan to betray the empire and ally yourself with the enemy.

speak;Selena;General Duessel, you stand accused of treason of the highest order.|Lay down your weapons, and follow my commands.|If you fail to do so, if you resist in any way, I will execute you on the spot.
speak;Duessel;This is nonsense!|Who is behind this madness!
speak;Selena;These are His Majesty's orders.|The emperor has anticipated your treachery.|Prepare yourself.
speak;Selena;Cormag, you and I will bring that traitor down.|Go around that fort to the southeast and drive into them from the sea.
speak;Cormag;We're fighting General Duessel?|But he's one of the cornerstones of the empire.|How could-|He's been like a father to you and to my brother.|Do you truly mean to kill him?
speak;Selena;If that is what my emperor commands, then yes.|Without hesitation.|Cormag, if you are a true knight of Grado, you will do the same.
speak;Seth;Prince Ephraim, the Imperial Grado army is before us.
speak;Ephraim;I know, but something's odd.|They're chasing someone down.|Is that a deserter?|Wait!|That's... Duessel?
speak;Duessel;I will not fall here!|If I have a <red>Axe</>, <red>Sword</>, or <red>Lance</>, I will endure!

name: Village_1
_source: speak;OldMan1;This area of the ocean is often blanketed in a thick fog.|I toiled under it myself for many hard years when I was still sailing.|We always made sure we had torches and the like ready...|Oh, yes...|And there's this.|This torch staff shines just as bright as any normal torch.|Of course, if nobody you know can use it, it's just so much extra baggage.|Will you take it?|Oh, go ahead.|I'm planning on resting my old bones here for good.|My sailing days are done.

name: Village_2
_source: speak;Marisa;I found it.|I can't use it yet.|Good-bye.

name: House_1
_source: speak;Villager Man;A strange man passed through here sometime back.|He said something about looking for a girl with indigo hair...|I asked if she was his girl, but he said she wasn't.|I hope he's found her by now.

name: House_2
_source: speak;Villager Girl;Do you know what I'm going to be when I get older?|I'm going to be a splendid knight, just like General Selena.|They call General Selena the Fluorspar, you know?|She's really beautiful and really, really strong.

name: CormagTalkTana
_source: speak;Tana;Wait.|Please stop fighting.|I'm sure we can reach an agreement if we just talk.
speak;Tana;My name is Tana.|You're from Grado, aren't you?|Why are you fighting against General Duessel?
speak;Cormag;...Do I hate him?|This isn't some petty schoolyard squabble, girl.|I'm a soldier of the empire, and I have my orders.|I've been sent to punish a traitor, and that's what I aim to do.
speak;Tana;Are you telling me that General Duessel's a traitor?|Don't you know him?|Do you think that's really true?
speak;Cormag;What I think isn't at question.|Faith does not dictate my actions.|I have my orders.
speak;Tana;Ephraim trusts your General Duessel.|He's given him the benefit of the doubt.|Have you chosen not to believe the reasons for his actions?
speak;Cormag;Get out of my way!|I'll waste no more time with this duel of words!
speak;Tana;Wait! Please...|Protect General Duessel.|It would be tragic if he died before his motives became clear.
speak;Cormag;Move, please.|If you won't get out of the way, I'll have to move you by force.
speak;Tana;Very well.|If you must.|But in exchange, I'm asking you to believe General Duessel.
speak;Cormag;...You're an odd bird.|To think I'd lose a fight not to a man's sword but to a woman's words...
speak;Cormag;You win.|I will protect General Duessel.|But I plan on sorting this whole mess out with the general himself.
speak;Cormag;I don't know if this is the right thing to do or not.|But I think this is what my brother would have done.

name: CormagTalkDuessel
_source: speak;Cormag;Sir Duessel...|You have abandoned your country and your lord.|I must take your life.
speak;Duessel;I know.|I'm ready now.|I have no duty anymore.|But you, Cormag.|You're a soldier of the empire.|Follow your orders and fulfill your mission.|I'm ready.

speak;Cormag;To be honest, I'm confused.|Must you truly die?|Is your crime really deserving of death?|I know my brother could have settled this, but...|I've come here to stop you, and yet I find that I cannot.
