speak;Cormag;You see, I couldn't believe you would ever truly turn traitor.|And now I stand here, looking at you, Duessel of the Imperial Three.|And you do not have the eyes of a traitor.
speak;Cormag;No.|I cannot turn my lance on you, the empire's faithful son.|General Duessel...|Until this matter is sorted, you travel under my protection.

name: DuesselTalkEphraim
_source: speak;Ephraim;Why were those Grado men after you?|What's going on?|Wait, we can talk later.|Let's get you to safety first.|Come with us, Duessel.

speak;Duessel;I am General Duessel, the Obsidian, of the Imperial Three...|This name and my service to His Majesty have been my life's blood.|As of this moment it is all gone.|I've no reason to continue...
speak;Ephraim;Duessel...|Enough of this rubbish!|You are my mentor!|I will not let you die!
speak;Ephraim;I know about the emperor's madness.|How will your death serve Grado?|Who will it help?|What of your country?|Its people?|Its future!?

speak;Ephraim;You will live, Duessel.|As a traitor...|In disgrace...|I know that for a man such as you this is more agonizing than death.|But you will live nonetheless.|You will live for something more important.
speak;Duessel;I understand.|This old fool's life is yours.

name: FightBeran
_source: speak;Beran;Prince Ephraim of Renais...|The Obsidian Duessel...|Two incredible trophies.|Who could ask for more?

name: BossRetreat
_source: speak;Beran;Grrr...|They're held on for too long.|If this continues, General Valter will have me-|...Prepare a ship.|We must flee.|Quickly!
speak;SoldierRed;B-but General Valter...|He'll be so angry...

speak;Beran;We're doomed either way.|General Valter will never forgive our failure here...|And if we stay, we'll be devoured like those other fools...|Our best bet is to give up and escape with our lives.

name: SelenaChangeScene
_source: speak;Valter;What's this?|They've only just begun?|What a disappointment.|I so wanted to witness the comedy of two generals hacking away at each other.
speak;Valter;Ah, Selena.|You're to return to the capital immediately.|Duessel is no longer your concern.|His Majesty has declared you untrustworthy.|I've been sent here to relieve you of command.
speak;Valter;You've proven yourself incapable of dealing with a single old man...|I tell you, having to clean up your mess makes things difficult for me, Selena.|Now then, Beran.
speak;Valter;I'm leaving.|I can't leave poor Eirika sad and lonely in Carcino.|You're in command here for the duration of this conflict.
speak;Selena;What do you think you're doing?!|I am here at His Majesty's bidding, and...

speak;Valter;Did you not hear me?|His Majesty's bidding has CHANGED.|You, Selena, are not to be trusted.|These are His Majesty's words.|You share the same sentiments as Duessel.|You could turn traitor, just as he has.|You should feel honored.|He could have ordered me to kill you where you stand.
speak;Selena;Th-that's absurd!|His Majesty, he...|He knows I am trustworthy.
speak;Valter;Then return to the capital and sort it out.|Go and ask your beloved master whether I speak the truth.
speak;Valter;What are you going to do, Selena?
speak;Selena;I will return to the capital.|I know better than to trust your word.|I will speak with the emperor myself.

speak;Valter;Heh heh...|Stupid woman.|If Grado wins too easily, there'll be no more bloodshed.|We must do what we can to extend the fun...|I believe it's time for me to return to my darling Eirika.|It wouldn't do for Glen to arrive before me, would it?|Take care of things here before I return to you.|Understood?

name: CormagTalkTurn3
_source: speak;Cormag;Tell me, Brother, what should I do?

name: CormagTalkTurn4
_source: speak;Cormag;I know what I must do.|I'm a sworn knight of Grado, and I have a duty to fulfill.|Let's start by putting an end to that Frelian army.|Move out!

name: Outro
_source: speak;Duessel;Prince Ephraim...|You've grown to be quite the impressive commander.|I remember what a stubborn young lad you were when I taught you.
speak;Ephraim;Any skill I have, I owe to you, Duessel.|I'm curious, why are you being pursued by your own troops?
speak;Ephraim;Speak to me, Duessel.|I want to put an end to this war.|I'm sure you feel the same way.
speak;Duessel;...As you know, the emperor was once a man of compassion.|He loathed war, and he worked to build peace across all nations.|Then...one day that all changed.
speak;Ephraim;But why?|Why did he change?|What happened?

speak;Duessel;I wish I knew.|But if you're looking for a likely cause, I have one.|This all seems to have begun when Prince Lyon and the mages created a strange gemstone they referred to as the Dark Stone.

speak;Duessel;That's what the clerics and the prince called it, at any rate.|Now, I'm just a soldier.|I don't know anything about these magic things.|But they said the Dark Stone is more powerful even than the Sacred Stones.
speak;Ephraim;And the Sacred Stones had the power to defeat the Demon King.|If the Dark Stone is stronger than they are...
speak;Myrrh;The wave of evil I felt surging from the capital...|It hungers...|It consumes. It envelops and transforms.|This power can tarnish the purest of souls with its corruption.
speak;Ephraim;Are you saying this Dark Stone is responsible for the change in Vigarde?|The timing fits, doesn't it?|The stone is created, and then-|Duessel, where is the Dark Stone now?
speak;Duessel;It's in the capital, with Prince Lyon.|He's been carrying it with him ever since the day it was created.
speak;Ephraim;Understood.|Duessel, I'm going to the capital.|I must talk to Lyon.|Maybe we can restore the emperor together.
speak;Ephraim;But we'll be fighting Grado's army-your own men.

speak;Duessel;I appreciate your concern, but I've already been branded a traitor.|Prince Ephraim, if you mean to save my lord the emperor...|If you hope to restore him to his former self...|then I will pledge my loyalty to you until your cause is won.
speak;Duessel;Men, I owe each of you an apology.|You've served me well, and I have betrayed you.
speak;SoldierGreen;You speak nonsense, General!|We are your men, no matter what happens!|If you must leave Grado to fight with Frelia's men, then our place is at your side.|Your road is our road!
speak;Duessel;My brave men...|Sniff... Bah, I'm getting old.|I'm a sentimental old fool.

speak;SoldierGreen;We ask to be allowed to join the Frelian army.|Prince Ephraim has many soldiers.|He doesn't need us with him.|Please, send us older soldiers off to fight with Frelia.|And may the gods of war smile upon you, General Duessel.
speak;Seth;Prince Ephraim, we must now take to the seas.|The Frelian army is readying a ship for us now.|We have some time to rest until it's ready to set sail.
speak;Ephraim;Right.|We'll take a break, then.|Tell the men.|The road ahead is bound or be a rough one.
speak;Larachel;Well, hello there!|Tell me, are you all waiting to board a ship?
speak;Larachel;I recommend that you abandon your plans, my friends.|The locals are too frightened to set sail upon these seas.
speak;Ephraim;Is there a storm coming in?
speak;Larachel;No, no storm-demons.|Some sort of phantom ship commands these seas now.
speak;Larachel;Yes.|But you needn't worry for long, my friends.|I plan on purging the seas of that pesky ghost ship.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Well said, Princess L'Arachel!
speak;Larachel;I, L'Arachel, am destined to become the protector of the seas!|Fare thee well, strangers.|Come, Dozla, we must find a ship.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Sounds fun!|Come on, Rennac!
speak;Rennac;Honestly, L'Arachel, do you even think before you set these plans?|Oh, please...|Someone end my misery!
speak;Seth;Prince Ephraim, our ship has arrived.|Let us prepare to board.|...Something troubling you?

name: DeathTana
_source: speak;Tana;I’ve long been prepared for this day...|Too long...
speak;Tana;This cannot be!|I better head back or Innes is gonna give me an earful!

name: DeathAmelia
_source: speak;Amelia;Oww...|I tripped a little too hard there...|A little rest will fix this up though.

name: DeathInnes
_source: speak;Innes;I won’t give up...|Not here...|Not in this place...|I’ll keep going, even if I have to crawl...
speak;Innes;I hope no one saw that...

name: DeathGerik
_source: speak;Gerik;If you live on the battlefield, you know this day will come...
speak;Gerik;Huh...|I must be losing my touch...Better rest up...

name: DeathTethys
_source: speak;Tethys;The dark rider I foresaw...|He was coming for me...
speak;Tethys;I can't risk letting my body getting any scars.|I'll just take a little trip away from here.

name: DeathL'arachel
_source: speak;Larachel;This will never do!|I find it hard to say, but I must beg your leave...
speak;Larachel;I cannot fall here!|I will return to fight evil when I'm at full strength!

name: DeathDozla
_source: speak;Dozla;Ha ha ha!|I couldn’t have asked for a better ending!
speak;Dozla;Bwa ha ha!|They really put a wallop on me!|I better take a nap before I lose my head ha ha!

name: DeathSaleh
_source: speak;Saleh;I cannot fall here.|I have a duty to fufill.

name: DeathEwan
_source: speak;Ewan;Woah!|That stings!|I'm gonna head back and get this patched up!

name: DeathCormag
_source: speak;Cormag;Blast!|My brother would never have gone out like this...
speak;Cormag;Brother...|He would want me to go back before things get worse...

name: DeathRennac
_source: speak;Rennac;Great.|This is just what I needed...
speak;Rennac;This is way above my pay grade!|I'm out of here!

name: DeathDuessel
_source: speak;Duessel;This old dog doesn't quite have its bite anymore, does it?...

name: DeathKnoll
_source: speak;Knoll;In this darkness, I will find peace.
speak;Knoll;Hmm...|I better find a spell that can get me out of this...

name: DeathMyrrh
_source: speak;MyrrhD;I’m so sorry...|I can’t help you any longer.

name: DeathSyrene
_source: speak;Syrene;Better head back before this gets worse.|Hurts just a bit...

name: SupportEirikaAndEphraim
_source: speak;Ephraim;I'm right here, so please call me if you need anything.|I'll always be nearby.
speak;Eirika;Yes, thank you.|But you do understand that I am here to fight, don't you?|I cannot ask you to watch me constantly.|I am your sister, not your ward.
speak;Ephraim;You looked a little upset...|I thought I would stroke your face like I used to...
speak;Eirika;Please stop it.|You're treating me like a child...
speak;Ephraim;Oh, I'm sorry.|It's just an old habit...|Besides, you were always the one who pestered me to do it when we were little.|Don't you remember?

speak;Eirika;N-no, I don't remember!|That was such a long time ago...|Ahh...|Dear brother, please try to remember where we are right now.|What would our companions say if they saw us in such a personal moment?
speak;Ephraim;Yes, that would be embarrassing...|Forgive me, I did not mean to do anything you would find unpleasant.
speak;Ephraim;So, you really do want me to stroke your face?
speak;Ephraim;Ha ha, you always did blush so easily!|You haven't changed at all!
speak;Eirika;E-enough!|Brother...you are starting to anger me!

speak;Ephraim;Eirika, try taking a deeper step forward when you lunge.|Otherwise, you might find it hard to dodge the counterthrust of a foe.|That's why you always want to end a duel with a single blow.|Don't give your opponent the chance to return the attack.
speak;Eirika;Ah, Brother!|Thank you for the instruction!|I suppose I still have a lot to learn.
speak;Ephraim;No, not at all!|Rather, I am surprised at your rapid progress after such a short time!|I think you would give me an excellent match were we to spar.
speak;Eirika;You really think so?|And yet, I feel...|Sigh...|If only we lived in a world where such skills were not even necessary.
speak;Ephraim;I see...|You're a peaceful soul.|All of this fighting...|It must be hard on you.
speak;Eirika;It is...|I just pray that this fighting will end as swiftly as possible.|No one desires this war.|So why must it continue?

speak;Ephraim;...Indeed.|And yet there is fighting in every generation.|In ancient times, our ancestors fought all manner of evil beast.|But once the beasts were subdued, man then fought against fellow man...|So we learned from Lyon.
speak;Eirika;I know...|But if men understand the futility of fighting, why do they do it?|We could gain so much more by cooperation than by conquest.
speak;Ephraim;You may be right...|...But I think...|I understand why.

speak;Ephraim;I pray for peace to return to our fair Renais.|I know that war brings only sorrow.|And yet, somewhere in my heart...|There is a lust for battle that cannot be stilled.|It screams within me when I clutch this spear...

speak;Ephraim;Perhaps it is because I am a man.|Perhaps it is because I was raised to fight.|I enjoy the practice of my art.|I find pleasure in the battle victorious.|And the stronger I become...|The more strongly the call to arms sounds within my ears.|I want to see how great is the skill that I have acquired.|It may be crass and low, but I cannot deny it.
speak;Ephraim;You would disdain me for this?
speak;Eirika;No, I could never...|But, Brother, listen.|No matter why you fight...|Please ensure that this fighting brings good to our people and to our kingdom.
speak;Ephraim;Of course.|I am not so far gone as that.|And I could not bear to see you cry for our people.|Besides, I would fear the judgment of your mighty sword!
speak;Ephraim;Yes, you may be right.|There may be an end to this fighting soon.|We may yet defeat the evil in this land and return it to the hands of men.|Then, Renais may enjoy its former glory.
speak;Eirika;Yes...|You will be crowned king of Renais, and I will help you rebuild our land.|We will make it a happy and prosperous country, free of conflict.|Just as we three used to dream about...
speak;Ephraim;We...three.|Lyon was here with us, wasn't he?|We three had so many grand ideas for the futures of our lands.
speak;Eirika;Yes...|We talked about a lot.|But Lyon...
speak;Eirika;Brother...|Brother...please promise that you won't ever leave me alone.|Please...promise...
speak;Ephraim;Of course.|I would never leave you.|Why would you ever think I could do something like that?
speak;Ephraim;I know better than anyone how you feel, dear sister.|Ever since we were born...|No, even before...|We two have always been together.|And together... we will always stay.

name: SupportFranzAndGilliam
_source: speak;Franz;Say, Sir Gilliam, can I ask you a question?
speak;Franz;Are you disturbed about fighting with me?
speak;Gilliam;Why would you say something like that?
speak;Franz;You and I are from different lands.|We have different backgrounds...|I thought that might've made you feel uncomfortable.
speak;Gilliam;Blast.|I don't need to answer that.

speak;Gilliam;Listen.|I'm here by my king's order, and by his order alone.|I'm well aware that we have diverse backgrounds and experiences.|I don't care who I pair up with.|You can't always have your own way.|That's just how it works in Frelia.|It's luck of the draw, you follow?|Do they let you swap partners until you find that special someone back in Renais?
speak;Franz;Oh, no!|No, no, no...|That's not what I meant.|It's just... I was worried that I might be slowing you down with my lesser skills.
speak;Gilliam;Franz, you're wasting your time worrying when there are better things to be done.
speak;Gilliam;Like training, of course.|Quit your worrying and show me how good a Knight of Renais can be.
speak;Franz;I could ask for nothing better.|Please!
speak;Gilliam;Franz, I can see your training has paid off.
speak;Franz;Yes, and I have to say, I'm surprised.|I feel the energy flowing through me.|I think it's because of my resistance training, actually.
speak;Gilliam;Frelia's resistance training, you mean.|You mean to tell me that you have no training like that in Renais?
speak;Franz;We do have a system to strengthen our chest, arms, shoulders, and legs.|However, that's where we stop.|We don't train each individual finger...
speak;Gilliam;Every muscle acts in relation to each other muscle.|How can you neglect the fingers?|That's how we Frelians think.
speak;Franz;Fascinating how our countries can have such distinct training systems, isn't it?
speak;Gilliam;And you've been training with our system every day without a single complaint!|I'm impressed.
speak;Franz;Oh, that's because, each night before I go to sleep...|I do our traditional relaxation exercises.
speak;Franz;Before going to bed, flex each muscle you used, and you'll wake up feeling refreshed.
speak;Gilliam;What, no fatigue the following day?
speak;Franz;I can teach you if you like.
speak;Gilliam;Well, Franz, it looks like there's a lot I can learn from Renais.
speak;Franz;Why the change of heart, Sir Gilliam?
speak;Gilliam;I've been doing your exercises every night, and I feel fantastic.
speak;Gilliam;I appreciate Renais much more, thanks to you.
speak;Franz;Really?|I'm glad.|I'm thrilled that the great Sir Gilliam approves of the training in Renais.

speak;Franz;No, honestly!|I am thrilled.|It's a small thing, I know...|But when someone recognizes the fine qualities of Renais, I get a thrill.|Renais is a small country, but it contains much that is good.
speak;Gilliam;I don't know Renais, but I do know how you feel as a fellow knight.|The more we are away, the more we think back on our beloved homeland.
speak;Franz;I'm glad that I'm not alone in this.
speak;Gilliam;Chin up, lad.|Be proud of your country, Franz, Knight of Renais.|As your friend from neighboring Frelia, I'm glad you're proud of your home.
speak;Franz;Yes, Sir Gilliam!|Thank you very much!

name: SupportGarciaAndGilliam
_source: speak;Garcia;Your armor suits you.|Must have taken a lot of training to fight in it, eh?|And it probably takes a lot of strength to wear, too.
speak;Gilliam;I don't want to brag, but...|None of Frelia's knights can match me for strength.
speak;Garcia;Oh, is that so?|You know, in my day, they said I was without equal.|Hm...|What do you say, Gilliam?|Let's arm-wrestle!
speak;Garcia;Oh, why not!|It won't take more than a minute.
speak;Garcia;Excellent!|I'd expect no less from a true knight!|Let's go.
speak;Gilliam;You beat me.|Well, I've got to hand it to you, Garcia.
speak;Garcia;Ha ha!|Don't feel bad.|You almost had me for a minute there.|I'm impressed!
speak;Garcia;About that match the other day...
speak;Gilliam;What, you mean when we arm-wrestled?|That was a GREAT match.
speak;Garcia;Yes, well...|I've been thinking.|Now, if I remember it correctly, I was using my sword arm...|But you're left-handed, aren't you?|You were using your off hand.
speak;Gilliam;Huh?|Oh, well...|I didn't want to say anything, but...
speak;Garcia;I knew it!|All right!|We have to have a rematch using our OTHER hands!
speak;Gilliam;Garcia, are you-|Fine, fine.|I accept your challenge.
speak;Garcia;Hm...|See, this time, you beat me.
speak;Gilliam;True, but it WAS your off hand this time, and it was still close.|Garcia, you really are amazing.
speak;Garcia;Ha ha ha!|You know, I feel good about this.|I lost, but...|I feel good.|With a great knight like you at our side, we've nothing to fear.
speak;Gilliam;Don't be silly, Garcia.|You're an amazing fighter.|With you in our midst, our forces are invincible!
speak;Garcia;Ha!|Let us fight together, then, and watch our enemies fall like leaves!
speak;Gilliam;Sorry to bother you.|You just seem to have something on your mind.
speak;Garcia;I do.|I was...|I was just thinking about my son, Ross.
speak;Garcia;It's...|a wonderful feeling to have a son, Gilliam.|I was so happy to learn I had a boy who could follow in my footsteps.|Do you have children?
speak;Gilliam;Oh, no...|You know what the life of a soldier is like.
speak;Garcia;Aye, I remember it well.|But I still found a wife.|Don't you have anyone?
speak;Gilliam;I-|Well, to be honest...|There is someone I've had my eye on, but what do soldiers know of love?|I don't know how to win a woman's heart.

speak;Garcia;Ha ha ha ha ha!|Oh, don't take it too hard.|These are tough times for romance.|As time passes, the world will change.|No, WE will change it.|Wait for your time.|When the world changes, people change.|Soldiers change.|Just wait.
speak;Gilliam;You're right.|When this war ends, I'll be ready to face a different type of battle.
speak;Garcia;Yes.|And when you do wed, you must be sure to invite me and my boy.|It will be a great celebration.

name: SupportJoshuaAndNatasha
_source: speak;Joshua;Hey, I've been hearing good things about you lately.|Everyone's real happy you've been helping to heal them.
speak;Natasha;Really?|That's nice to hear.|I do what little I can, but I'm glad if I've been helpful.
speak;Joshua;Oh, you have been, rest assured.|You don't just mend flesh.|Your smile eases all our pain.|So, I may have lost our bet...|but everything seems to have turned out for the best, right?
speak;Natasha;Joshua...|I just do what I can to help and to stay out of everyone's way.

speak;Joshua;I'm just saying, you've saved a lot of lives out there.|We've got other healers, I know, but you're more than that.|You're special.|I may be the most cynical of our lot, but even I can see that.
speak;Joshua;Don't be so humble.|You deserve the praise.
speak;Joshua;Well, I do.|So keep it up.
speak;Joshua;Watch out!|Nngh!!|An arrow!?|Did someone set up a trap for us?|Or is there someone here?|An archer?|Where is he?
speak;Natasha;Joshua!|You saved me.|Thank goodness you were near.
speak;Joshua;Yeah, well...|I just happened to be in the neighborhood is all.
speak;Natasha;You make light of it, but I truly appreciate that you were nearby.
speak;Natasha;I'm fine, thank you.|But it's only thanks to you, Joshua.|You saved me.|I'll try to be more attentive to my surroundings.

speak;Joshua;Yeah, well...It's not always easy, you know?|Especially when you're working.|You concentrate pretty hard when you're doing your healing thing.|Just focus on your work, and I'll keep an eye on you.|Sound fair?
speak;Natasha;Oh, no...|I couldn't ask you to spend all your time protecting me.
speak;Joshua;What, you don't want me to?
speak;Natasha;It's not that at all!|I rather like- |
speak;Joshua;Say, you want to make a bet?
speak;Natasha;Another...|bet?|Right here?|In the middle of this battlefield?|What did you intend to bet on this time?
speak;Joshua;That you're gonna fall for me, sooner or later.
speak;Natasha;Oh...|This isn't the time for jokes...|I-I just don't know.
speak;Joshua;Hey, don't go running off!|Sigh...|I wasn't even joking...
speak;Natasha;Joshua, are you all right?|Do you need medical atten-
speak;Joshua;Natasha, how did you get here so quickly?
speak;Natasha;I just...I happened to be in the neighborhood.|Are you hurt?
speak;Joshua;Ugh.|Yeah...|But it's only a scratch.|Still, if you could...|take care of it.IPlease?
speak;Joshua;Thanks......|Say, Natasha.|Want to make a bet?
speak;Natasha;On what?|If this is another of your little jokes, I-
speak;Joshua;Will I make you happy?|That's what we'll bet on.|Are you in, or what?
speak;Joshua;That's everything I've got.|I can't up the ante any more.|So how about it?|Are you in?
speak;Joshua;Look into my eyes, and decide for yourself.
speak;Joshua;“I serve the people,” is that it?|Listen, does it make any difference if you serve them in Grado or Renais?|You can come with me.|It'll work out, you'll see.|I'll make it work.
speak;Natasha;What I'm betting is my future.|My happiness.
speak;Joshua;Natasha......|I can't afford to lose this one.
speak;Natasha;You're right...|And I hope from the bottom of my heart that you win.
speak;Joshua;Don't worry.|In a pinch, I never lose.|Well, I mean, I lose sometimes.|But not this time!
speak;Natasha;At least...you won our last bet.
speak;Joshua;Hm?|Oh!|Oh, yeah...|That you'd fall for me.
speak;Joshua;That was easy.|This bet, this is going to be a tough one.|I'm gonna have to work at it.|But knowing that I've won one bet already, at least I've got that.
speak;Natasha;This war is terrible...|but at least it brought us together.

name: SupportFordeAndKyle
_source: speak;Kyle;What are you doing out here?|Are you-|Are you painting?
speak;Forde;No!|I-|Well, yes.|Actually, I'm not so much painting as sketching.|I use this piece of charcoal to draw and shade, like this.
speak;Kyle;You know we're in the middle of a battle, don't you?|What if someone attacks while you're distracted?
speak;Forde;Calm down, calm down.|I just like to keep a record of our battles with these pictures.
speak;Kyle;You're just rationalizing!|You're a cavalier-it's time to start acting like one.
speak;Forde;Fine, fine.|I'll stop.|As you command, Sir Kyle, commander of the Knights of Renais.
speak;Kyle;Oh, brother.|Do you have to make everything so difficult?
speak;Forde;If you don't want the hassle, stop telling me what to do!
speak;Kyle;Then stop fooling around on the battlefield.|Seriously, wasting my time on an idiot like you is just stupid.
speak;Kyle;Nothing!|If you have so much time to waste drawing, let's have a quick spar.
speak;Kyle;Yeah, that's right.|I don't waste time.|I take care of my weapons, my horse, and myself.|And not just that-I also make sure our morale is good and our men are safe.
speak;Forde;You really need to take yourself less seriously.
speak;Kyle;And you need to take your duty MORE seriously.
speak;Forde;Yaaaaaaawn...|Oh, why am I so sleepy?
speak;Kyle;Forde!|Are you falling asleep on the battlefield!?|What is wrong with you, man!?
speak;Forde;What are you so fired up about?|You're really ruining my nap.
speak;Kyle;You have no sense of self-preservation, do you?|What is wrong with you?|You lack even the common sense of an infant, you know that?
speak;Forde;Oh, you're one to talk.|When you were a baby, you were planning out strategies to take over the nursery.|You were stuck up then, and you're stuck up now.|And STILL the ladies liked you!
speak;Kyle;You leave them out of this!|Women have nothing to do with it.

speak;Forde;They don't?|Oh, come on!|Isn't it important to have an heir to carry your standard when you're gone?|Take your sister, Mia-she married into a nice Frelian family, didn't she?|I'm just curious who would ever settle for such an uptight knight as you.|You ever think about that?|You think you might meet her in this war?
speak;Kyle;That's not what I'm here for!

speak;Forde;Ha ha ha ha.|Of course not.|But I bet you're still a ladies' man, huh?|I know you-you're a perfect gentlemen, always nice to the ladies.|I remember when you were little, you were always the first to help when you saw a little girl crying.|You would go running up to lend a hand.|I still remember how impressed I was that you would do that. It was cool.
speak;Kyle;I just could never turn my back on someone in need.|It is what's expected of a knight.
speak;Forde;Yeah, but you weren't a knight yet!
speak;Kyle;Well, it's...|expected of someone who aspires to be a knight, too!
speak;Forde;You've got an answer for everything!|But, I have to admit, you've also got my respect.|You're a good guy.
speak;Forde;What's wrong, Kyle?|You're the one who looks tired this time.
speak;Kyle;Oh, Forde.|It's you.|I was just lost in thought for a moment.|I figured that I could use a little breathing room.|I guess that's why you paint your landscapes, isn't it?
speak;Forde;That's right.|You see it now?|Everyone needs a little space to think, even on the battlefield.

speak;Kyle;Well, I wouldn't go so far as to approve of painting during a battle.|What if the younger soldiers started to copy your example?|However, I see your point.|Everyone needs a way to clear one's head.|So...|How long have you been doing those drawings, anyway?
speak;Kyle;What's the matter?|Forgotten when you started?
speak;Forde;I started drawing and painting when my mother died.
speak;Forde;When I was young, I won a tournament for training swordsmen...
speak;Kyle;I remember that.|I took second place.

speak;Forde;She seemed far more pleased at a picture I'd drawn of her than at my victory.|She kept that picture near her always, and she looked at it often.|She rejoiced more in my skill with the brush than in my skill with the sword.|I never understood why...|Not until recently, at any rate.
speak;Kyle;Your mother was very kind.|I remember that about her.|I'm sorry that she fell ill while you were so young.
speak;Forde;I feel lucky-I have my memories of her, after all.|Franz, though...|He was too little to talk or even walk.|That's why I kept that picture of her hanging in our home.

speak;Kyle;So that's the story behind that picture in your house...|I didn't realize you drew it.|I remember watching you practice swordplay when we were little.|I wanted to be like you, and I was irritated that I didn't practice more.|I got so upset with myself when I lost the tournament to you.|That's why I work so hard to keep practicing and improving my skills.
speak;Forde;Oh, man.|It's not like me to get this introspective.|What is it about you that makes me talk so much?|Come on, let's go.
speak;Kyle;When this whole war is over, teach me how to paint.
speak;Forde;Yeah, all right.|Fine.|But we both have to get out of here alive first.

name: SupportEphraimAndKyle
_source: speak;Kyle;Prince Ephraim...|You charged at the enemy line after you were injured, didn't you?
speak;Ephraim;Oh, that?|That was nothing.|Don't worry about it.
speak;Kyle;It's not the injury I'm worried about.|You're not supposed to do things like that!
speak;Ephraim;If I retreat at the first scratch, command will fall apart.

speak;Kyle;My lord, you are the future of Renais, the commander of this army.|If something were to happen to you, morale would be shattered.|We would lose this war.|All because of your misplaced pride.
speak;Ephraim;Fine, Kyle.|I'll hang back and let you knights lead the charge.|But I don't have time to talk about this now.|I'm leaving.
speak;Kyle;He says he's going to stop being so reckless, but I know better.|I have to stop him before he gets himself killed...
speak;Kyle;Do you remember what we agreed to last time we talked, Prince Ephraim?
speak;Ephraim;Sigh.|High command must remain behind the vanguard and let the soldiers fight.|And if he tries to take the van, any unit, regardless of rank, may stop him.
speak;Kyle;Yes, exactly.|So you do remember it.

speak;Ephraim;And now, every time I try to lead the charge, my own men stop me!|They waste themselves worrying about my safety when their own is at risk.|Look, I agreed to your plan at the time, but this is just ridiculous.|I'm going to revoke the order.
speak;Kyle;No, Prince!|I know I've told you this before...|But you have to remember, you're the future of Renais-
speak;Ephraim;And if we fail because I do not join the battle, we have no future!|I do know I bear much responsibility, but I simply must revoke the command.
speak;Kyle;I'm sorry, Prince Ephraim, but I can't allow you to do that.|I'm going back to the fight. Make sure you hang back, sire.|Go on.

speak;Ephraim;Sigh...|That blasted Kyle.|I know that he's simply concerned about me.|Come to think of it, he's always been like that.|I can't recall a moment when he HASN'T been overly worried about me.|But that order really needs to go.
speak;Ephraim;Why is that, Kyle?|What do you need to apologize for?

speak;Kyle;The other day, I was injured on the battlefield.|You raced to my side without a moment's hesitation.|As I lost consciousness, I heard you say something I won't forget.|“Treat this man as you would my own brother.|Help him, regardless of cost.”
speak;Ephraim;And why must you apologize for that?

speak;Kyle;I ought to have been the one riding to your aid, my lord.|And that you would consider a low-born knight like myself a brother...|All these years, I've thought of myself as nothing but a loyal retainer.|I failed to understand that our bond runs deeper.

speak;Ephraim;Since I was a child, you've taught me how to be a warrior.|A prince is raised to be detached.|Distant.|To rule the people from above.|I could not afford to feel any real affection for anyone.|Just Seth, Forde...|And you, Kyle.|You were the only ones.|I realize that much separates us, but I still consider you family.|Although...|you do worry about me too much.|And you have to stop snapping at me.

speak;Kyle;Prince Ephraim, when I was injured the other day, I came to a realization.|I was wrong.|The decision I made you agree to the other day was wrong.|You belong on the front lines, like any of the noble warriors of Renais.|It will do the men's morale good to see you fighting at their side.|From now on, fight as you must!|I will be beside you, and I will protect you as you fight at our side.

speak;Ephraim;Thank you, Kyle.|I was so caught in my worry that I couldn't fight well.|And I will make a concession to you as well.|I will not be so reckless anymore.|I know I have an important position.|Are we in agreement, Kyle?
speak;Kyle;We are, my lord.|Let's ride on together!

name: SupportFordeAndEphraim
_source: speak;Forde;What are you talking about?|We are in the middle of a battle, you know.|Pay less attention to me and more to our enemies!
speak;Ephraim;No, no, Forde.|Give it up.|Come on-|let me see it.
speak;Ephraim;What is that?|Is that a painting?
speak;Forde;This?|No, no... No, it's a topographic map!|Yes. For strategy.|We need to plot out our strategy, don't we?|During battles, I like to look at this map and analyze enemy lines...

speak;Ephraim;This is impressive, Forde.|You're good with both a sword and a brush!|You know, when Eirika and I were young, we'd sneak out for long horse rides.|We used to watch the sunset sink behind the mountains while we talked for hours.|Your painting reminds me of those days.
speak;Ephraim;But...|during a battle probably isn't the right place to indulge your hobby.|What if something happened to you?
speak;Forde;I'm no fool, Prince Ephraim.|I always stay alert on the battlefield.|I'll cut down any enemy that crosses my path.|Well, Prince...|Good luck!
speak;Ephraim;So, Forde...|Not goofing around today, are you?
speak;Forde;Of course not!|I never fool around in a battle.
speak;Ephraim;Yes, but only in battle.|Next to Franz, you seem like you're always half asleep.
speak;Forde;You surely understand how difficult it is to be compared with one's siblings.|Next to you, the princess seems so kind and thoughtful.|And caring, too!
speak;Ephraim;I see your point.|Yes, it's rough being held to your sibling's standards.
speak;Forde;Isn't it, though?|So let's stop all this and get back to the fighting.
speak;Ephraim;Eirika has never been far from my side-in good times and bad. Without her...I'm not sure I could lead my people back from this disaster.

speak;Forde;I think I understand what you mean, Prince.|When we lost our parents, I was shattered.|Franz helped me get back on my feet.|If I didn't have his help then, I don't know where I'd be today...
speak;Ephraim;We are who we are now because they have always stood by us...|Let's end this war quickly, Forde.|For them.|Especially for them.
speak;Forde;Me?|Oh, I'm fine as long as I've got a sword in my hand.
speak;Ephraim;Oh, by the way, Forde.|When you have some time, would you show me your painting again?
speak;Forde;You'd like to see it?|Why the sudden interest, Prince?

speak;Ephraim;The scene you painted, it's the Renais we once knew...|Those magnificent fields and tranquil farming villages...|When I look at it, I can forget, for a second, that we're on a battlefield.|I want to restore the Renais you painted.|I want to restore these landscapes that fill me with joy looking at them.|I wanted to see the painting again so that I could carry it with me in my heart.
speak;Forde;If you like it, Prince Ephraim, I'd be honored if you would take it.
speak;Ephraim;Thank you, Forde!|It is truly beautiful...|Did you study painting?
speak;Forde;No. I just...|When we were young, I would paint for Franz.

speak;Forde;Our father spent much time away, and Franz wept every night, missing him.|But I was just a child, too.|I didn't know how to make him stop crying.|One day, I showed him a drawing that I'd made of our parents...|And Franz stopped crying.|I've been painting ever since...
speak;Forde;I've a thought...|In exchange for this painting, there's something you can do.
speak;Forde;Once you've achieved your goal, once you've restored Renais to the way it was...|Can I have a vacation?
speak;Ephraim;Is rest all you ever think about?|If you want that vacation, earn it!
speak;Forde;Right, right.|I'll just keep risking my life protecting you then, Ephraim.
speak;Ephraim;You do that.|I'm counting on you, Forde.

name: SupportFranzAndSeth
_source: speak;Franz;Fine.|I may be young, but I'm every bit a Knight of Renais.|I'll fight to the end to protect the princess, just like you, sir!
speak;Seth;Good, good!|That's the spirit!|You know, you're looking much improved from when we set out.
speak;Franz;Hm.|Do you really think so, General?
speak;Seth;Oh, definitely.|You seem much more sure of yourself.|All doubt has left your face.|By the time you reach my age, you'll be the finest spear and swordsman around.
speak;Franz;Honestly?|Sir, do you really believe that?
speak;Seth;...I do...|But we are in a battle right now, Franz.|Concentrate on the enemies before you, and don't get too cocky.
speak;Franz;Yes, sir!!!|You know I'd never let you down, sir!
speak;Seth;Don't be too eager for success.|Know your limits.
speak;Seth;Ah,Franz.|Every time I see you, you're getting better and better.|Your parry is a little stiff, but you are clearly improving.
speak;Franz;Are you serious?|Do you really think so, sir?
speak;Seth;...Why is it that, when I compliment you, you always ask me that?
speak;Franz;Oh, so sorry...|I appreciate your praise, sir.|I mean, you're General Seth, the Silver Knight.|You're my hero.

speak;Franz;Do you remember when Grado's forces overran Castle Renais?|Despite grave injuries, you outcharged the enemy, broke their lines, and escaped.|And then, you delivered the princess, on your own, to Frelia safely.|If I were you, I doubt I could have survived such a challenge...|You are the only person I know who can make impossible feats possible.

speak;Seth;What pressure you put on me!|How can I possibly fail now?|You would lose all faith in me!|Ah, but, Franz, you're still young.|You will grow into a remarkable warrior, I have no doubt.|Be confident. I'm counting on you.|Train your mind and hone your skills.
speak;Franz;Really?|Do you really think so, General?
speak;Seth;All right, back into the fray!|Let's go, Franz!
speak;Franz;Yes, General!|And remember, I've got your back!
speak;Franz;Oh, General!|How are you, sir?|I'm so honored that you came to talk to me.
speak;Seth;Must you always overreact?|...Honestly, Franz...|I'm the one who should feel honored.
speak;Franz;I beg your pardon?|What do you mean, sir?

speak;Seth;When I was just a squire, there was one knight whom I admired above all others.|His skill with sword and spear was legendary.|He was truly peerless.|We squires learned the meaning of chivalry watching him serve the king.|Ten years back, we received word that an infamous assassin was hiding in Renais.|This knight hunted him down in secrecy so as not to alert the assassin.|He hounded the villain and killed him, but he was mortally wounded...
speak;Franz;Ten years ago?|But that's when-!?|No, it couldn't be...
speak;Seth;...Yes, Franz.|It was the greatest knight in the history of Renais.|Your father.

speak;Franz;...I was so young when my father died.|And our mother passed away before he did.|Forde and I were almost always alone.|Oh, I remember how I used to cry like a babe about my father being gone so much.|Forde would always remind me, “He is serving the royal family to protect Renais.”|Forde was so proud of our father, but he was also a little bit sad.|I remember a deep scar he had on his shoulder, probably in battle.|My brother and I used to climb up his shoulders and vie for his attention.|I grew up hearing what a great knight he was, but I remember only his shoulder.

speak;Seth;...You probably have no idea how much you resemble your father.|Your swordplay, how you tilt the lance, your loyalty to Renais...|You've certainly inherited your father's spirit.|It is an honor to see the skill I once idolized developing in you, his son.

speak;Franz;I...I am so flattered to hear that.|Thank you very much, General.|Someday, I will become a knight even greater than my brother or my father.|To restore Renais, the kingdom to which I've sworn my blade, I will fight on!
speak;Seth;Thank you, Franz.|Let's do the best we can.|For Renais, and for your father.

name: SupportMoulderAndGilliam
_source: speak;Gilliam;No, Moulder.|I didn't hear a thing.
speak;Moulder;Was it just in my head?|Hm.|That can't be good.
speak;Gilliam;Moulder, you've been working yourself too hard.|You should rest.
speak;Moulder;No, I'm not tired in the slightest.|I'm fine.|I cannot believe you don't hear it!|Is something wrong with your ears?
speak;Gilliam;Moulder, please.|I know I've seen many battles, but I'm younger than you are.|My hearing is fine.
speak;Moulder;Then why can't you hear it?|I'm starting to worry about that noise.
speak;Gilliam;Your ears are playing tricks on you.
speak;Moulder;There it was again!|That sound I told you about.|Gilliam, did you hear it?
speak;Gilliam;Oh, not again.|No, Moulder.|I don't hear anything.
speak;Moulder;Is it really just me?|Am I the only one who can hear it?
speak;Gilliam;Maybe you should describe the sound to me.|Is it a dull noise?|A chirp?|If it's louder, I should be able to hear it.
speak;Moulder;No, it's nothing like that.|It's soft...a melody of some sort.
speak;Gilliam;A melody?|Are you saying someone is playing music during a battle?|What kind of music?|What sort of instrument is it?
speak;Gilliam;Heavenly?|You don't suppose it's some sort of...sign, do you?
speak;Moulder;Gilliam, I would be happy if you didn't say such things.
speak;Gilliam;Oh, sorry.|But, Moulder...|You're the one dedicated to spiritual matters.|I wouldn't be surprised if-
speak;Moulder;I said enough of that, Gilliam.|I must be imagining things.|That's all.
speak;Gilliam;A melody only you can hear.|Sounds mysterious to me.
speak;Moulder;I agree.|Especially because I can't explain the cause.|I must say, I'm worried.|Gilliam...|If something were to...|happen, well...|I'm counting on you.
speak;Gilliam;Moulder, we've been friends for a decade and a half.|I'll protect you.|Besides...|it's my duty as a Knight of Frelia.
speak;Moulder;I know I can count on you, Gilliam.|I know that better than any man.|You have my gratitude.
speak;Gilliam;How are your ears today, Moulder?|Can you still hear that melody?
speak;Moulder;No, I haven't heard it for a while.|I guess it was a hallucination after all.
speak;Gilliam;Regardless of the cause, I'm glad that you don't hear it anymore.
speak;Moulder;I'm relieved, too, but...|I also miss it somewhat.|The melody was haunting me, and I finally remember what it was.
speak;Moulder;That was the music played at King Hayden's coronation.
speak;Gilliam;Frelia's coronation hymn.|Ah, I remember it well...|It is a strong song, and Frelia's knightly choir performed it well.
speak;Moulder;I was the one who carried the crown to the throne.|I was so nervous that I might drop it!

speak;Gilliam;I remember that you were the one to bear that regal burden.|I was a mere recruit, stuck in the back with the other whelps.|You know, I remember now...|Your hands shook like you were frozen!
speak;Moulder;Yes, and then someone shouted, in a loud voice, "Get ahold of yourself, man!"|The crown slipped, and I fumbled to catch it!|I was so embarrassed.
speak;Gilliam;I'm so sorry.|I was young.|You know, I felt so bad that I have spent years making it up to you.|I acted before I thought.|I'm sorry for all the embarrassment I caused.
speak;Moulder;That's right!|I believe I met you the very next day.|Aha!|I've figured it out!
speak;Moulder;That melody-I could only hear it when I was with you.|That means...
speak;Moulder;It was a sign.|A sign from above that we must both return to the basics.
speak;Gilliam;Return to the basics?|What does- Ah. Of course.
speak;Moulder;Yes.|We must remember who we were and what drove us to join this cause.

name: SupportNeimiAndGilliam
_source: speak;Gilliam;Be quiet, Neimi!|Someone will hear you!
speak;Neimi;Oh...|I'm sorry.|I just wanted to tell you there's a scratch on the left side of your armor.

speak;Gilliam;Oh, that's nothing.|My armor's covered in scratches.|This one, I got defending Border Mulan in a siege years back.|And this one goes back to my very first fight as a knighted soldier.|Each of these is a story.|Each one is a mark of pride.
speak;Neimi;Yes, but I'm worried about this one near the glide clip.|I can repair it.|Just...|don't go anywhere!

speak;Gilliam;Neimi, don't go off by yourself!|We're in the middle of battle!|One false step, and our strategy could be ruined-|you might create an opening!|You put not only yourself but all of us in peril when you do that!
speak;Gilliam;Don't cry, Neimi.|Save your energy for fighting.
speak;Gilliam;Listen.|This is my armor.|I take good care of it myself.|Don't worry about other people's armor.|Worry about yourself.|Understood?
speak;Neimi;Yes, you're right.|I'm so sorry...|Sorry for...|for messing around.
speak;Gilliam;I...|do appreciate your concern.|If you see something, bring it to my attention, and I'll fix it.
speak;Gilliam;Neimi.|You seem to be adjusting to the rigors of combat well.|You're a skilled archer after all.
speak;Neimi;Oh...|I'm so glad to hear you say that!|I was so sad after we talked last.|I didn't know what to do, but then, I decided to focus on my archery.
speak;Gilliam;That's the spirit, Neimi.|So, have you been training by yourself?|I never mastered archery.|I'm sorry I can't help you train.
speak;Neimi;No, no...|Thank you, but I've been thinking about this a lot.|First, I need to sharpen my vision so I can target more easily.
speak;Gilliam;Sharpen your vision?|Good eyesight seems essential in a good archer, but...|How can you improve your vision?|I don't understand.

speak;Neimi;My grandfather taught me to stare into the distance and concentrate.|My grandfather taught me everything I know about the bow.|My grandfather was-|He was a great archer.|One time, a snake was attacking a bird nest on a tree in a mountain far away.|He aimed at the snake and shot it down.
speak;Gilliam;Incredible.|He was able to pick out and hit a snake from that distance?|Your grandfather must have been a great archer.

speak;Neimi;Yes, he was.|And that's why I've been staring into the distance.|I've been training constantly on the field, and my vision has improved.|See that tree in the distance?|I can spot the bugs crawling on its leaves.
speak;Gilliam;I'll be impressed when you can hit each of those bugs from here.
speak;Gilliam;There's no need to shoot bugs.|You only need to shoot our enemies...|Using your keen eyes and the skills your grandfather gave you.
speak;Neimi;Don't you worry!|You can count on me!
speak;Gilliam;Neimi, I wanted to ask about your vision-training regimen.
speak;Neimi;Ah, where I stare into the distance and concentrate?
speak;Gilliam;Yes. I've been trying it out myself, but...|I've had some problems.
speak;Gilliam;Whenever I'm training, people start to avoid me.|It's not just that.|Even animals run away from me when I'm at it.
speak;Neimi;And you're just...|You're just staring into the distance?
speak;Gilliam;Yes.|Standing perfectly still, staring into the distance.
speak;Neimi;Maybe it's...|because you look scary...|I used to get that a lot.|Cormag said I was frightening him.|He thought I was angry at him.

speak;Gilliam;I look...|scary?|Hm...|I have refined my stare to intimidate my foes in battle.|You may have a point.|No wonder people get scared when they see me glowering into the distance.|You know, I might almost consider it a compliment of my knightly prowess!
speak;Neimi;I have an idea...|Perhaps if you smile, it might not be so scary.
speak;Neimi;Uh...|Maybe it's because you're crossing your arms.|How about...|holding some flowers instead?|That might help.
speak;Gilliam;You want me to stare into the distance...|smiling...|and holding flowers?
speak;Neimi;I think that would look good...

speak;Gilliam;You're just being nice, Neimi.|Your keen vision is a gift, and your training may improve it...|But I know I can never imitate it.|It's yours and yours alone.|I place much faith in your sharp eyes and your steady hand.
speak;Neimi;Th-thank you, Gilliam!|I won't let you down!

name: SupportMoulderAndVanessa
_source: speak;Moulder;Vanessa, how are you holding up?
speak;Vanessa;Father Moulder.|We are struggling, but I'll pull through somehow.|Say, Father Moulder...
speak;Moulder;You want to know about Prince Innes, don't you?|He's doing well.|I was worried for a moment, but he'll be fine.
speak;Moulder;|Well...|You see, as a priest, I've met people from all walks of life.|Some of them-like you-well, I can read them like an open book.
speak;Moulder;No, no.|It's not like that.|I just mean you are a pure, straightforward girl.|That's a compliment worthy of a knight.
speak;Vanessa;Do you think so?|Thank you, Father.
speak;Moulder;Hm.|Say, would you like to hear a story from the prince's youth?
speak;Moulder;Hm...|Oh my!|You know, I think we'd better take care of our enemies, first.
speak;Vanessa;Look out!|Over there!|Stay here, Father.|I'll take care of this.
speak;Moulder;|Yes, I think that would be best.
speak;Vanessa;Tell me your story another time, though.|I'd like to hear it.
speak;Moulder;Well, do you have time for that story I promised?
speak;Moulder;It was over ten years ago, when the prince was just a child.|There was a ceremony at the castle, with a trick archer of sorts.

speak;Moulder;Yes.|He was a very famous and undeniably skilled archer from abroad.|He was to shoot a tiny target that had been placed in the distance.|However, in the middle of the show, someone stopped him from shooting.
speak;Moulder;Yes, it was young Prince Innes.|He said, “That's not far enough!|Move the target back farther!”|Then, he insisted on trying himself.
speak;Moulder; Isn't it?|King Hayden tried to stop him, but...|Well, you know how he is.|He doesn't listen to anyone.|And so, it became a contest between our prince and this foreign archer.

speak;Moulder;First, they established the ground rules.|Each person was to shoot at the target.|If both arrows hit, they increased the range.|They simply continued to move the target back until one person missed the mark.

speak;Moulder;Ah, but the two were evenly matched.|Every shot was a perfect bull's-eye.|The crowd cheered, and the target moved ever farther back...|But then it came to the turning point.|The foreign archer said, “This is no test. Let's move the target back more.”|It seemed like bravado, but the archer actually had a clever tactic in mind.

speak;Moulder;They had been shooting for some time, and the archer's arms had grown weary.|Precision archery is far more taxing than the battlefield, you see.|So even though he was a skilled archer, he was at the limits of his endurance.|He was still hitting the mark accurately, but his arm was quivering more and more.|Everyone knew that the prince was on the verge of victory.
speak;Vanessa;I don't understand.|They were shooting at the same target, shot for shot, right?|Why would moving the target make any difference?

speak;Moulder;Yes, they were still shooting at the same target.|However, the archer suggested that they move the target much farther away...|Much farther than any child Innes's age could hope to loose an arrow to.
speak;Moulder;Even the archer, with his trained arms, was firing at his maximum range.|In fact, he almost missed the target!|Then, it was the prince's turn.

speak;Moulder;It was clearly too far away for the young prince to hit the target.|But His Highness was undeterred.|He drew his string and fired up into the sky.|The arrow did not merely hit the target.|No, it was a perfect bull's-eye!|You see, the prince arced his shot to extend his range beyond its limits.|To hit a target this way requires incredible skill, but the prince did it.|And then he turned to the archer and said, “Shall we move the target back farther?”|The archer looked so crestfallen.|He admitted defeat, and it was settled.
speak;Vanessa;Thank you very much, Father Moulder!|That's incredible!|I'm even more-
speak;Moulder;I'm glad you liked the story.|Keep up the good work, Vanessa.
speak;Moulder;I'm glad to see you well, Vanessa.|You do your fellow pegasus knights proud.|We are blessed to have you fighting at our side.
speak;Vanessa;You credit us warriors too much, Father.|Without healers, we would all be lost.|Nothing I say can tell you how much I value your presence here.
speak;Moulder;We are all doing our part in this war.|No need to thank me.
speak;Vanessa;I'm serious!|Without your help, we would never survive these skirmishes!
speak;Vanessa;Father...|Thank you again for the other day.
speak;Moulder;Ah...|You know, you remind me of myself, twenty years back.
speak;Moulder;Good luck to you, Vanessa.|I don't know where this will lead, but I'm sure the prince knows your feelings.
speak;Vanessa;Father Moulder, I only aspire to be worthy of his greatness.|I expect nothing in return.

speak;Moulder;Well, do what you think is best for you.|We all carry many burdens...|To country, family, duty, honor...|However, we are all ultimately free to embrace or reject those burdens.|If you find yourself in need of spiritual guidance, speak to me.
speak;Vanessa;Father Moulder, you're so kind.|Thank you.|I'm so grateful to have you on the field with me.
speak;Moulder;Vanessa, we fight for the greater good.|We fight for our country, for our friends, and...for ourselves.
speak;Vanessa;You're right, Father.|In so many things.

name: SupportNeimiAndColm
_source: speak;Neimi;Oh, hi, Colm...|How are you doing?
speak;Colm;This is no time for pleasantries!|You need to concentrate in battle!
speak;Colm;I never thought I'd see you on the battlefield.
speak;Neimi;Well, I might not be the best, but when something needs to be done...|I do it.
speak;Colm;It's amazing how war affects people.|I mean, look at you.|You're a bumbling crybaby, but even you've pulled yourself together temporarily.
speak;Colm;When we were little, you followed me everywhere, tripping and crying...
speak;Neimi;Oh!|Sniff...|Why are you always so mean?|Waaa!
speak;Colm;And now look at you!|You're still following me everywhere, tripping and crying, but now you're doing it on the battlefield.|Will you PLEASE stop your boo-hooing?
speak;Colm;Man, you can't do anything without me, can you!|And stop crying!
speak;Neimi;You're the one who's...|making me cry.
speak;Neimi;Oh!|C-Colm...|I-I was just restringing my bow...
speak;Colm;Wow.|You really take after your grandfather.|The way you handle your bow is great!
speak;Neimi;Grandpa taught me how to shoot when I was little...
speak;Colm;Yeah.|Your grandfather was a really top-notch archer.|I still remember how he tried to shoot me.
speak;Neimi;W-well, Colm...|That's because you were stealing fruit from our tree.
speak;Colm;He really taught me how frightening an archer with a good shot can be.
speak;Neimi;But...|He never hurt you.|He just wanted to scare you.|He missed on purpose.
speak;Colm;No, he was aiming for me.|I was just too fast for him to hit me.
speak;Neimi;He never missed a target when we went hunting.
speak;Colm;Well, then, I guess I'm just faster than wild animals.
speak;Colm;Hey!|You're laughing at me, aren't you?
speak;Neimi;Hee hee!|That's not true...|It's just that...|You haven't changed much since then.
speak;Neimi;J-just that you still exaggerate a lot.|But now that I think about it, you've always been on my side.
speak;Colm;Not always!|And now especially, I can't always be there to protect you.|I have many responsibilities to this unit, you know.
speak;Colm;But I can't leave you alone, either.
speak;Colm;What's wrong?|Did someone attack you?|Are you hurt?
speak;Colm;Did someone say something mean to you?|Did someone steal your mirror again?
speak;Neimi;I j-just...|have something in my eye...
speak;Neimi;Uh...|I'm sorry for alarming you...|But...|I'm happy that-|I mean-|Thank you for caring for me...
speak;Colm;No need to get all mushy about it.|You shouldn't cry so much.
speak;Neimi;I know.|The other day, when I was in battle, I was remembering all the times you helped me when we were little.
speak;Neimi;Like that time I fell into the river and you came and rescued me.|Or the time I broke Grandpa's bow.|You helped me fix it.|And all the times bullies picked on me, you defended me.
speak;Colm;Seriously, Neimi.|You've always been such a crybaby.
speak;Neimi;Yes, but...|Because you were there with me, I was never sad...
speak;Neimi;When Grandpa died, you were by my side the whole time, holding my hand...
speak;Neimi;Thank you, Colm.|For then and now...
speak;Colm;Oh...|If anything is troubling you, come see me first, all right?|I'll take care of anyone who makes you cry.
speak;Colm;I think your haplessness is permanent.|But don't worry, I'll take care of you.
speak;Colm;Oh, no.|I made you cry again, didn't I.
speak;Neimi;Sniff...|Yes...|But for different reasons this time.
speak;Colm;Neimi...|I'm the only one who can make you cry.|For now and ever, got that?

name: SupportRossAndGarcia
_source: speak;Ross;Nothing...|Well, maybe just...|What was Mom like?
speak;Garcia;Your mother...|Well...|Where do I start?|In many ways, she was very similar to Princess Eirika.
speak;Garcia;Yes.|She was gentle, but also very strong.|She could share others' pain.
speak;Ross;I was just thinking...|When was the last time we visited her grave?|Not since we left the village and started this journey...|It's been so long.|She must be lonely...
speak;Ross;When the bandits attacked the village, we had to leave.|But Mom's grave is still there.
speak;Garcia;Ross.|Let's go home when the war is over.|To the village where Risa rests.
speak;Garcia;We can rebuild the village again, just the two of us.|After all, that's where we belong...|You, me, and...|your mother.
speak;Ross;Yes!|All right.|But I'll have to be a lot stronger to help with that.
speak;Ross;So we'd better start training, Dad!
speak;Garcia;If you insist.|Show me what you've got!
speak;Garcia;Ha ha ha!|You're finally getting the hang of it, boy!|Your stroke is heavier, and your swing has definitely improved.
speak;Ross;Yes.|I've been practicing all the time, even when I'm not in battle.|Maybe someday, I'll even surpass you!
speak;Garcia;You're getting stronger, no doubt about it.|But I'm not going to LET you win.|You'll have to get there yourself.
speak;Ross;Now you're talking!|The higher the hurdle, the bigger the reward.|All right, I'm gonna go practice my swing!|See you later, Dad!
speak;Garcia;Risa, you'd be so happy.|Ross has grown into a strong young man.
speak;Ross;What is it, Dad?!|Ow... Ow!|Ow! What are you doing?|That hurts!|You're crushing my shoulder!
speak;Garcia;Ross...|I'm going to be sentimental for a moment.|Bear with me.
speak;Garcia;You may be almost grown, but you're all I've got in this world.|It's true that your skills have improved, but don't act foolishly.
speak;Garcia;There's no greater tragedy than when a parent must bury his child.|Do you see where I'm going with this?
speak;Ross;Yes...|I understand.|It's just weird to hear you talking like this...|I guess I have been getting a big head.|No one is invincible.
speak;Garcia;Yes, that's right.|And when you start to think you are, that's when you're the most vulnerable.
speak;Ross;I was just all puffed up when you said I had improved.|I'll be careful from now on.|I haven't told this to anyone, but I guess dads can see these things.
speak;Garcia;No matter how old you get, you'll always be my son.
speak;Ross;Yes, and I'll always look up to you!

name: SupportEirikaAndSeth
_source: speak;Eirika;How fare you, Seth?|Ever since the castle fell you have been protecting me, despite your own injuries...
speak;Seth;Would that I could have served you better, my lady...|You were not meant to see such things.|But my wound has closed up, and it does not affect my lance arm...
speak;Eirika;Wait.|Show it to me.|Look.|The wound has closed, but it has not yet fully healed.
speak;Seth;What made you think of this, my lady?

speak;Eirika;Your fighting is as superb as ever, Seth.|But when you raise your lance, I see a flicker of pain on your face, as if you were merely enduring it...|But it only lasts a moment.|Perhaps it is all just my imagination...
speak;Seth;Your Highness, please put your mind at ease.|My wound has healed.|There is no reason to worry.
speak;Eirika;I would that were so, Seth.|Please do not overextend yourself.|I beg this of you.|Without you, I may not be able to continue this quest...
speak;Seth;You praise me too much, my lady...
alert;Seth's strength and growths have recovered a bit!
speak;Seth;Your sword arm is magnificent, my lady.|You have improved yet again.
speak;Eirika;Thank you.|It is only because I know my brother will scold me if I do not practice every day.|But I still am nowhere near your level of skill, Seth.

speak;Eirika;Perhaps next time, you could spar with me and help me learn some technique?|The basics I've learned from my brother all apply to skills with the spear.|If I could learn the sword techniques of the Knights of Renais, then perhaps I could be even stronger.|I would be of greater help to you on the battlefield.
speak;Seth;Yes, but...|Princess Eirika, I think you should stay away from the front lines.|You are of the royal family of Renais.|Please leave the fighting to me...
speak;Eirika;Still...|How can I just watch from afar while others risk their lives for me?|I cannot rely on you always.|I must learn to protect myself.|So please, continue to observe as I practice.
speak;Eirika;Seth, do you have a moment?|Could you help me practice a bit right now?
speak;Seth;...Princess Eirika.|Before I do, there is something I must say to you.

speak;Seth;Please forgive my rudeness...|Princess, I am merely your subject.|Recently, you have been too close to me.|It is not becoming of a noble of Renais to fraternize in this way with her subjects.
speak;Eirika;Oh...|But I...|it's just that your wound has not yet...|I was merely...

speak;Seth;It's true.|The wound I received the day our castle fell has not yet healed...|Perhaps it will afflict me to the end of my life.|But it would be a mistake to assume you owe me a debt for this wound.|This thought should not rest beneath the crown you soon must wear.
speak;Eirika;But still, you suffered for me...
speak;Seth;Lady Eirika.|You are a noble of Renais.|The nobility should not favor one subject over another.|How can they maintain their fealty if you treat one so differently?

speak;Seth;You may have to forego such attachments just to defend your country.|There will be times when victory in battle demands a sacrifice.|If you cannot send your men to die, then you are not fit to rule.
speak;Eirika;I understand...|Seth...|You are correct.|I had forgotten my place, and I had forgotten my duty.|Please forgive me.

speak;Eirika;That night...|We fled from the soldiers of Grado...|You held me tight, keeping me safe from the enemy's blades...|Perhaps...I did feel something more for you then.|But...it was improper for a queen of Renais.|And with my father dead, I suppose that is my station.|I am a queen, and you are a knight in my service.|If I do not keep this in mind, then I will never be able to rebuild our kingdom.
speak;Seth;I thank you for your understanding, my lady.|Now, if you will excuse me...
speak;Seth;Princess Eirika.|If you would allow me to say one more thing...

speak;Seth;...That night...|I felt what you felt.|When I held you in my arms as we rode into the night...|It was the first time since I was knighted that I forgot my duty.|I thought of you not as my queen, but rather as someone I wanted to protect from all harm.|I wanted to leave everything behind...|To take you far away to someplace where we could be together...|Those were my thoughts...

speak;Seth;Please forgive me.|I swear to you that I will never again forget my duty in that way.|Now, please excuse me.|When I see you next, it will be as a Knight of Renais...|And I will lay down my life to protect my queen.

name: SupportEirikaAndLarachel
_source: speak;Larachel;Good day to you, Princess.|What a funny thing that we should meet here!|It is providence, I tell you!
speak;Eirika;L'Arachel, it is NOT providence.|It is not even a coincidence.|We agreed to meet here when we planned out our battle strategy.|Wait...|Don't tell me that you don't remember that!
speak;Larachel;We planned this?|I suppose I simply don't usually worry about such trifling details.|And here we are, so I suppose that our plan must be working.
speak;Larachel;Still, divine providence or not, isn't it strange and wonderful?|A beautiful princess traveling with such a ragged bunch as this...|You could have told me much sooner, you know!
speak;Eirika;My apologies.|Necessity demanded that I conceal my identity at the time.

speak;Larachel;Oh, it is no longer any worry.|To be honest, I believe I had figured out your ruse from the very moment we met.|I said to myself, “This lovely woman could only be of my own superior breeding.”|After all, you could never truly fool a woman with my keen mind.

speak;Larachel;There is something about nobility that simply cannot be hidden from its kin!|Why, Eirika, certainly you must have felt the same thing upon seeing me?|You surely saw a refinement and grace of carriage surpassing that of common folk?
speak;Eirika;Err...|Aheh...|Yes, why...the very first time I met you, I could see that you...|You were very far from common.
speak;Larachel;Exactly.|Far from common.|I could not have put it better myself.|It's simply impossible to travel incognito these days.
speak;Larachel;And that and that and that!

speak;Larachel;I'm practicing!|I want to be prepared for when those fiends next show up.|You never can tell where or when they'll appear, after all.|And if they were to appear and I were unable to prepare a magical attack...|Well, I'd like to be ready to whack them with this staff of mine.
speak;Eirika;Ahhh...|Don't you think that's a bit, well, dangerous?|Perhaps you should stop.|If monsters appear when I am around, I promise I'll come to your aid.
speak;Larachel;That's simply no good, Eirika.|You know how those monsters can be.|I insist that I be able to hold my own, relying on nothing but my skills.
speak;Eirika;I've been curious about something, L'Arachel...|Why are you so obsessed with fighting monsters?

speak;Larachel;...My parents were kind people.|I would be like them if I am able.|My home of Rausten is so near to Darkling Woods.|We experienced many sudden raids.|My parents took it upon themselves to defend our people against the monsters.
speak;Larachel;Yes, but my parents are gone now.|I've been told that they passed away when I was but an infant.|They...gave their lives defending many helpless people.

speak;Larachel;Oh, you needn't be sad.|I would not want for that.|No, it's wonderful that they gave their lives battling that filth.|I was so young that I do not remember their faces, if I must be honest.|However, that does not diminish the pride I feel for what they've done.
speak;Eirika;Don't you feel lonely at the loss of your parents?
speak;Larachel;No!|Not at all!|What do you take me for?|Some kind of weakling?
speak;Eirika;No, I see that you are strong indeed, L'Arachel.

speak;Larachel;I should say so.|But...would you not say that you are strong, too, Eirika?|Your father stayed in his castle, fighting the forces of Grado.|He had a noble death, don't you think?|Your father was a great man.|You must be quite proud of him.

speak;Eirika;Well...yes.|He refused to take even one step in retreat from the advancing Grado soldiers.|But still...|I mean, I...I would have thought no less of him if he had fled.|Even if he were no longer a brave king...|Still...|I would be happier if he were still alive.

speak;Larachel;Eirika...|I do understand you.|Everyone would tell me of my parents' bravery, of their honor...|But I will never see them.|I will never know them for myself.|Oh, what I would give if I could have met them...just once.

speak;Larachel;About what we were discussing earlier...|I would not want you to get the wrong idea.|I was not saying I was lonely because my parents were dead.|I am not that weak, you know?|I have never even...cried...when thinking of my parents.
speak;Eirika;I know, L'Arachel.|You are a very strong person.|We are lucky to have you with us.
speak;Larachel;I hope you do not think this all too sudden, but...|Here.|Look at this.
speak;Larachel;This ruby has been in Rausten for generations.|It is a valuable gem.|I would be honored if...|I would like for you to have it.
speak;Eirika;What?|No, I couldn't!|It's far too precious to accept...
speak;Larachel;No, I mean it.|Please, accept this as a gift.|Here.|I won't allow you to refuse.
speak;Eirika;L'Arachel...|Thank you.|I will treasure it.|I so wish I had something to give you in return...
speak;Larachel;You needn't feel that way.|Here, I've an idea...|Once we've put an end to all the monstrosities in our lands...|Invite me to Renais.|Does this plan please you?
speak;Larachel;Then we are agreed!|Now, you had better not go dying in battle on me.|Not until then, at any rate.|Do I have your word?
speak;Eirika;Yes...let us both live long enough to look back on this time.|I am sure that, when we do look back, it will be as the best of friends.

name: SupportFranzAndAmelia
_source: speak;Franz;Oh, hello there.|You're...|Ah, it's Amelia, isn't it?
speak;Franz;That's right.|How are you?|Getting the hang of things?
speak;Amelia;Oh, yes.|Quite!|You know, everyone here is so much friendlier than the folks in Grado.|I'm glad there are so many people around my age traveling with us.
speak;Franz;Yeah.|I think I'm about the same age as you are, too.|You know what that means?|That means, from now on, you're my rival.
speak;Amelia;Um...|Well, does that mean...|I have to fight you?

speak;Franz;No, no.|It's nothing as complicated as all that.|We'll just work together.|See, I'll try to be better than you, and you try to be better than me!|Every day, try to be a better person than you are today.|It's easier to do when you've got someone to work with.

speak;Franz;Yes, well.|Um...|My brother's a knight, too, and he's had someone like that for a long time.|I've always been envious of the competitive relationship he has.|They compete, and they argue, and they bicker...|But I know they respect one another, and they grow together.|I envy that.
speak;Amelia;Um...|I'm not sure I can be like that.
speak;Franz;Ha ha ha...|Don't worry about it.|It doesn't matter who you are.|All that really matters is that we have someone like that in our lives.|Besides, you are a qualified soldier, are you not?
speak;Amelia;Er...|I'm not honestly sure I'm even qualified to be out here.
speak;Franz;Same here.|That's why I picked you.|Let's work together.
speak;Amelia;All right!|I'm not sure I can live up to your expectations...|But I'll do my best.
speak;Franz;Good.|It's nice to meet you, Amelia.
speak;Franz;We are rivals, right?|There's no need for the formality of titles.
speak;Franz;Ha ha ha...|You did it again.
speak;Amelia;Ha ha...|I'm not used to being so casual.
speak;Franz;Can I ask you, what do you think of this war?

speak;Franz;I still don't understand why Grado chose to invade Renais.|Grado and Renais were allies.|Their royal families were close friends.|Why, Prince Ephraim and Princess Eirika are friends with your Prince Lyon.|I detect something funny here.|I simply cannot believe a friendship so strong could end so abruptly.|How many lives have been destroyed by such a seemingly random turn of events?|Perhaps the prince and princess know more of the truth, but...
speak;Franz;Oh, I'm sorry.|I don't mean to besmirch your homeland's name.

speak;Amelia;No, it's all right.|I wonder what drives Grado's ambitions now, too.|I was born in a rural village and raised in Grado's countryside.|Ever since I was a little child, I took pride in my home's origins.|Grado, of course, is named after the legendary hero who saved all of Magvel.|I thought I lived in a country that believed in justice and peace.|But this war...|It's something different than all that.
speak;Franz;Amelia...|I'm sorry.|This war must be especially painful for you...

speak;Amelia;I'll be fine, Franz. But thank you, though.|It was wrong of Grado to invade Renais.|Nothing can justify it.|Grado has no right to destroy whole nations, ruin people's lives.|This is all so...so wrong!|I began this war as a soldier in Grado's armies.|But now...|I just want to believe...|I want to believe in justice!|I want to know I'm doing the right thing!

speak;Franz;Amelia...|I understand it all very well.|Your love of your homeland...|Your sense of justice, of honor...|If there's anything I can do to help you, please let me know.|We are rivals, but that doesn't mean we can't also be friends, right?
speak;Franz;Why did you become a soldier?
speak;Amelia;When I was little, I lived in a remote village with my mother.|One day...bandits raided our village and took my mother.
speak;Amelia;I had no father...|My mother was my only family.|She was so sick...|and so very weak...
speak;Amelia;When the bandits came...|I hid under the bed...
speak;Amelia;I wanted to protect her!|I...wanted to be strong!|Even if I couldn't win...|I wanted to fight!|To protect the only person dear to me...
speak;Franz;I see now...|Thank you for telling me your story.|I want you to know this, Amelia.|...My parents are gone, too.

speak;Franz;Yes...|Well, I do have a brother, though.|But I don't remember my mother.|But I swore that I would live my every moment to its fullest.|I swore to my parents that I would live a long life for them and be happy.|Amelia...|You're living the same way, embracing each passing moment.|You believe in yourself, and your faith burns in you, making you shine.|I don't know what it is you plan to do with your life, but as long as we travel the same path, would you let me walk beside you?|I have my own path to follow, I know, but...|I believe we're both walking toward the same goal.
speak;Amelia;Franz...|Thank you...|I'm really happy.|But...I want to protect you, too.|I am a soldier of sorts as well, you know.|So...let me be your shield to protect you...
speak;Franz;And I will be your sword and fight for you.|From now on.|You're not alone anymore, Amelia.

name: SupportNeimiAndGarcia
_source: speak;Garcia;Don't come near me right now, Neimi!
speak;Neimi;I-I'm sorry!|I was just...wondering what you were doing.
speak;Garcia;I'm preparing myself for the battle.|Please don't come near me right now.
speak;Neimi;Are you trying to get psyched?

speak;Garcia;Yes.|To prepare myself for battle, I visualize the enemy in front of me.|Then, during battle, I can focus all my attention on them.|If you want to survive this war, you must focus all your attention on the enemy.
speak;Garcia;I apologize for yelling at you.
speak;Neimi;That must be how he became such a brilliant warrior!|I must go focus now...
speak;Garcia;That gauntlet!|The one embroidered with the gold falcon...
speak;Neimi;Huh?|Oh, this?|My late grandfather gave it to me.|It was too big for me, so I resized it to fit my hand.|He was the one who taught me how to use a bow...|This is a keepsake he gave me.
speak;Neimi;How in the world...?|Did you know him?

speak;Garcia;Of course.|He was THE master archer.|He was known as “Single-Arrow Zethla.”|He had amazing accuracy and could shoot any target, moving or still, with one shot.|“No second arrow for Zethla” was what people would say.|Renais tried to recruit him many times...
speak;Neimi;Now that I think about it, when Grandpa went hunting, he would take only one arrow with him.|Me, I always took many arrows...
speak;Neimi;He never did join the army, even though recruiters did come by often.|He said that it wasn't in his nature...
speak;Garcia;I know.|In fact, I visited him once when I was young.|He was wearing the gauntlet that day, and it left an impression.
speak;Neimi;I see...|Renais is such a big country, I never would have thought that you knew him.|It's a small world.
speak;Garcia;Indeed.|I can't believe Single-Arrow Zethla's granddaughter is fighting in this war.|I'm encouraged by this fact.|I'm counting on you, Neimi.
speak;Neimi;Um...I'm...happy to hear that.|I-I'll do my best not to let you down!
speak;Garcia;Neimi, I'm sorry if I startled you yesterday.
speak;Neimi;Huh?|Oh, you mean when you were preparing yourself for the battle?|No...|I was just surprised by your...enthusiasm for this war.

speak;Garcia;I used to be like this all the time.|I was always preoccupied with battles, to the point of neglecting my family.|And now, here I am, back on the battlefield.|I'm sure my wife is somewhere sighing.
speak;Neimi;Oh, no, Sir Garcia.|I'm sure your wife understood how you felt.
speak;Garcia;I think it's hard to understand when you are not a soldier.
speak;Neimi;In times like this, you have to fight to stay alive.
speak;Garcia;You've lost family too, didn't you?
speak;Neimi;Yes.|But, I can't keep crying.|I have to be strong and keep going.
speak;Neimi;You quit the army and lived in a mountain village with Ross because Renais was not at war, didn't you?

speak;Neimi;You don't seem to be the type of person who enjoys fighting for its own sake.|I think you know the emptiness and pain of war more than anyone else.|I can see that just by looking at you!|Em...|I'm sorry if I'm being presumptuous.
speak;Garcia;No, Neimi.|Thank you.|You are very perceptive.|You'll make some lucky guy very happy someday.
speak;Garcia;Don't be embarrassed!|Oh, by the way, please take this.
speak;Neimi;What is it?|Oh, this haircomb is lovely!
speak;Garcia;I bought this for my wife when I was still in the Renais army.|But...I never had the chance to give it to her.

speak;Garcia;I buried her with some of the things I'd brought back.|I don't know why, but I couldn't bring myself to bury this, though.|I don't need it.|What would I do with it?|You'd make better use of it.|It will give you a reason to keep using that mirror of yours, too.
speak;Neimi;Sir Garcia!|This is too much!|Thank you!|I will take good care of it!

name: SupportLuteAndKnoll
_source: speak;Knoll;Er, excuse me...|If at all possible, uh...would you mind not stalking me like that?
speak;Knoll;What did you expect?|You've been at my back for days.|I can't help but notice!|What do you want from me?
speak;Lute;You dodged, huh?|I knew your presence would be dangerous to me.
speak;Lute;You did it again.|Hm.|This isn't good.|Nobody else has dodged me twice.
speak;Lute;You're quick at escaping, too.|You're dangerous.|I'm afraid I can't let you threaten my natural superiority.
speak;Lute;You must be Knoll.|I've been researching you.|I also plan to find out your Achilles' heel before too long.
speak;Knoll;...Why would you do something like that?
speak;Lute;Because there's no one better than me.
speak;Lute;I said there's no one better than me.|And if there is, I have to stop him.|I can't have you threatening my natural superiority here.
speak;Lute;I've seen you.|You use magic, and that makes you competition.|And you use dark magic, which makes you the enemy of light.
speak;Knoll;That's a common misconception, actually, about dark mages.|And besides, we're allies here.
speak;Lute;No, not until we make it clear who is superior.
speak;Lute;What, you think you're better than me?
speak;Knoll;I never said that!|Look, we're on the same side here.|Does it matter who's better?
