speak;Lute;Matter?|Of course it matters!|How could you possibly think it doesn't?|Personally, I think I'm clearly superior to you.|Don't you agree?
speak;Lute;That was close.|You were trying to trick me, huh?|That's dirty pool.
speak;Lute;It's not safe for me here.|I must retreat...for now.
speak;Lute;Can I-|I just wanted to say I'm...sorry.
speak;Lute;No, but I've been watching you, and I've noticed something when you fight.|Suffice it to say that I am now convinced that there's no one better than me.
speak;Lute;I must have miscalculated your abilities at first.|I don't know why I thought you could have been better.|Anyway, I'm sorry that I overestimated your skills.|Well, if you'll excuse me.
speak;Knoll;You know, I think you may have missed the point.
speak;Knoll;What seems to be the problem?
speak;Knoll;Why don't you stay and chat for a moment?|Now that I'm not a threat to you, we can relax and talk.|If you don't mind, of course...
speak;Lute;Hm... All right.|As long as we're in agreement about who's superior around here.

name: SupportKyleAndSyrene
_source: speak;Kyle;You're Selena, aren't you?|Commander of Frelia's pegasus knights?
speak;Syrene;I am.|And I know who you are.|You are Sir Kyle, cavalier of Renais.
speak;Kyle;I'm honored that you know my name.|I don't believe we've met, have we?
speak;Syrene;We met once, about ten years ago or so.|You may have forgotten.
speak;Kyle;Do I ever!|I didn't think I'd ever see you again.
speak;Syrene;Well, Sir Kyle, you certainly have turned out well.
speak;Kyle;Oh, please.|Let's do away with the honorifics, shall we?
speak;Syrene;Of course, Kyle.|Ah, you haven't changed at all.|It takes me back.
speak;Kyle;I barely recognized you, Syrene.|You look completely changed.|I had no idea you'd become a knight-a pegasus knight, no less!
speak;Syrene;That's nice of you to say.|So I've grown, have I?
speak;Kyle;You've grown a lot.|It's a shame we have to be reunited on a battlefield.
speak;Syrene;You're right about that.|We ought to sit down and talk soon.
speak;Kyle;I'd like that, too, Syrene.|But let's finish off this lot first, shall we?
speak;Syrene;All right, but don't try to be a hero like last time, all right?
speak;Syrene;Well, that's your homework.|See if you can't remember.
speak;Syrene;How are you holding up, Kyle?
speak;Kyle;The war is tough, but my sword arm is strong, and I am well.
speak;Kyle;Stuffy?|It's accurate.|Isn't that enough?|But that's beside the point.|I still can't figure out what you were talking about.

speak;Syrene;Oh, your homework?|You've been thinking about it all this time?|You're so serious!|I was right.|You haven't changed in the slightest.|You've always been this way.|Remember when I tried to show you around Frelia's castle town?|You said, “I'm here to do my duty.|Not to sightsee,”|and you went back inside.|You went home without even trying Frelia's fabulous seafood!|King Hayden thought I'd been remiss in showing you our fair city.
speak;Kyle;I'm sorry about that, Syrene.|I had no idea...|I was on a special mission to deliver a letter to King Hayden.|I didn't have any time for sightseeing, like I'd said.
speak;Syrene;Are you seriously apologizing for that?|It was so long ago!

speak;Kyle;Ha ha ha...|You're right, you're right.|...I know I was only there for three days, but that was a memorable trip.|I grew up in landlocked Renais.|I'd never seen the ocean.|Not before you showed it to me.
speak;Syrene;You didn't show any interest at all in local culture or cuisine.|But when I asked if you'd like to go to the sea, you got so excited!
speak;Kyle;It was intense.|I felt so small, standing there, staring at the sea.|Looking over the waves, I hoped that I could be that strong, that persistent.
speak;Syrene;I think that's the only time I've ever seen the real you.|I know we only spent a half day together, but it was such fun.
speak;Syrene;Maybe sometime, we can do that again.
speak;Kyle;I'd like that.|Let's use that hope to drive us on.|When we've restored peace, we'll go see the Frelian coast again.
speak;Syrene;No, I'm fine, but I'm worried about my pegasus...

speak;Kyle;Here, let me take a look.|Hm.|Looks like he's got a wound here that hasn't properly healed.|I can fix this up for you.|It's nothing serious, but you might want to get him some proper care later.
speak;Syrene;Thanks, Kyle.|You're a lifesaver.|It was careless of me not to have noticed the injury.
speak;Kyle;Your pegasus is smart.|He may have hidden it from you so as not to worry you.|It's not your fault, Syrene.|You shouldn't worry about it.
speak;Syrene;No, I'm just not fit to be a pegasus knight.|I'm so pitiful.|If you hadn't seen that injury, I could have put us both in danger.|I could have cost us both our lives.
speak;Kyle;You're being too hard on yourself.|If you were in danger, I would have been at your side in an instant.|I'm sure you would do the same, wouldn't you?
speak;Kyle;We just have to help one another out if something happens.|You and I have been friends for over ten years, after all.
speak;Kyle;That's right, Syrene.|You did the same for me back then.

speak;Kyle;It was on the day I left Frelia.|Near the border, I came upon some bandits harassing a poor merchant.|I tried to help him, but I was outnumbered.|Badly.|When they saw I was a knight, they wasted no time surrounding me.|I thought that was it for me, but then, out of nowhere, you show up.|You and I drove off those bandits, and you saved my life that day.
speak;Syrene;I see you've finished your homework.
speak;Kyle;Oh, so that's what you wanted me to remember!|“Don't be a hero” indeed!

speak;Syrene;You'd left Frelia before I could give you a going-away present.|I went out, hoping to catch up to you, when I saw you surrounded by bandits.|You were fighting all those bandits on your own to save that merchant...|I'd never seen a knight so dedicated to the protection of the innocent.
speak;Kyle;Going-away present...|You're talking about this, aren't you?
speak;Syrene;The wooden pegasus I carved for you!|...You still have it?

speak;Kyle;Of course I do!|After we dealt with those bandits, you said to me, “Keep this, and remember Frelia.”|How could I possibly misplace it?|I carry it with me as a reminder.|As long as I have this, I feel like I'll always have someone watching over me.|Actually, I started collecting wooden figurines since you gave me this.|But I always carry this one on me.
speak;Syrene;I'm glad to hear it's meant so much to you.
speak;Syrene;...Kyle...|When we're all at peace again, won't you visit Frelia once more?

speak;Kyle;You know...|I was thinking about that, too.|I think I really missed out by not having Frelian seafood.|This time around, I won't miss it.|And I should see some sights, too.|Will you show me around, Syrene?
speak;Syrene;Yes, I'd love to.|I've been told I can fry up a mean fish, too!

name: SupportTethysAndRennac
_source: speak;Rennac;Are you Tethys, the dancer who captivates all audiences?
speak;Rennac;Oh, you don't know me?|That's so disappointing.|I am Rennac of Carcino.|I beg your indulgence...
speak;Tethys;It's a pleasure to meet you, Rennac.|However, I'm a bit busy at the moment.|Perhaps we could talk another time.
speak;Rennac;Is that so?|Very well then.|Another day.
speak;Rennac;And perhaps I could have you dance for me and me alone.
speak;Tethys;Hm?|I will of course dance if you ask, but...|For you and you alone?|Are you perhaps attempting to woo me?|If that's the case, you should stop.|I've...
speak;Rennac;No, no, that's not what I was intending at all.|Yet many women who say they're not interested end up in my arms all the same.
speak;Tethys;Well, if that's the case, maybe I'll keep my eye on you.|If you turn out to be such a catch, I may rethink my stance.
speak;Rennac;It's a deal then.|I ask that you observe my conduct closely.|Good day.
speak;Tethys;Oh, dear...|I think he took me seriously.|I hope he doesn't get his hopes up too high.
speak;Rennac;Ah, the beauteous Tethys.|It's a pleasure to see you again.|Well?|Have I made an impression on you yet?
speak;Tethys;Well...|You seem to be...unobjectionable.|Yet you've a long way to go, I think.
speak;Rennac;That's a bit severe, isn't it?|Is there something specific you desire?
speak;Tethys;Oh, well...perhaps you could bring me something?
speak;Rennac;Bring you something?|A gift, is that it?|Very well.|What shall it be?
speak;Rennac;Tethys.|I've been looking for you.|You haven't been avoiding me, have you?
speak;Rennac;The object you spoke of the other day?|I have it here.|Please take a look.
speak;Rennac;You forgot what you asked for, didn't you?
speak;Rennac;OK, then take a look.|Here it is.
speak;Rennac;It's as big as a fist.|Notice how the red, white, and blue colors play across the surface of the gems.
speak;Rennac;Well, I brought it to you as promised.|So this proves that I'm worthy, does it not?
speak;Tethys;Yes.|I now realize that despite your appearance, you're a very hard worker.|Does that make you a good catch?|Hmm...I'm still not convinced.
speak;Rennac;Really?|How disappointing.|Is there something else you desire?

name: SupportTanaAndSyrene
_source: speak;Syrene;Princess Tana!|You've put the whole court in an uproar, you know?|Running off to fight with this troop without a word to your father?
speak;Tana;I'm sorry for all the trouble I've caused, but I'm fine.
speak;Syrene;I was ordered to watch over you and ensure your safe return.|I intend to stay by your side and serve as your bodyguard, Princess.
speak;Tana;I'm happy to have you at my side, Syrene.|Honestly, I was starting to get a little fed up.
speak;Tana;I saw that letter my father had sent.|“Defend Tana to the death”!?|Is he serious?|The soldiers think so-they won't leave me alone!|I appreciate the concern, but I'd like a LITTLE privacy!
speak;Syrene;Ha ha ha...|That does sound like King Hayden.|He looked so sad when you left.|It was more than I could bear.
speak;Tana;...I know.|I feel bad...|Hey, Syrene.|Doesn't this remind you of when we were children?|When we were together, it was like I finally had an older sister.

speak;Syrene;That was my first assignment after graduating from the academy.|I'd been asked to watch over you.|It was a huge job for a young knight.|But I enjoyed my work.|You were always so kind.|I miss those days.

speak;Tana;I was so lonely when you got promoted to the pegasus knights.|But now, I'm glad to see you've risen so high.|It means that, even out here in the battlefield, we can spend time together.|I want to talk about the old days, about Frelia and my father.
speak;Tana;All right, but don't forget about tonight!
speak;Tana;Hello, Syrene!|I'm so glad we talked the other night.|I had so much fun.
speak;Syrene;I did, too, my lady.|I was quite surprised, in fact.|The young Princess Tana I once knew has grown so much.
speak;Tana;Y-you think so?|Tell me, how have I changed?
speak;Syrene;You're so serious now.|This war has made you serious.|You're not the same princess I remember from my youth.

speak;Tana;I know that I've lived a sheltered life being the princess.|I know that I've taken my family's wealth for granted.|When I saw what the war had done to the people of Renais and Frelia, I knew that I needed to do something to change things.|And you know what?|You taught me something I never forgot.
speak;Tana;Yes, that's right. Your strength and pride as a pegasus knight.|Your graciousness and kindness as a human being.|Your example is a lesson that has stuck with me, Syrene.
speak;Syrene;I'm honored to hear that I've had such an impact on you.|You truly are a kind lady.|Serving the Frelian royal house has been my greatest joy.
speak;Tana;There's...another lesson I was hoping you could teach me.
speak;Syrene;If I can help, I would be glad to.
speak;Tana;I'd like you to teach me...cooking.
speak;Syrene;I can make some traditional Frelian dishes, but I'm no gourmet chef...|But if you don't mind, then I'd be happy to teach you what I know.
speak;Tana;Thank you!|When I return home to Frelia after this war is over, I hope to cook my parents a proper meal to apologize for running off.
speak;Syrene;I'm sure they'll be surprised to see how much you've grown out here.|Surprised and pleased.|They'll certainly forgive you for going off on your own.
speak;Tana;Sometimes, I wonder...|I do hope that they forgive me.
speak;Syrene;Of course they will.|They're angry because they're concerned.|If you return safely, they will be relieved, not upset.
speak;Tana;You're right...|Thank you, Syrene.|But it can't hurt to ease their anger with some good food!
speak;Syrene;Right you are, milady.|I'll teach you everything I know about food.
speak;Syrene;That food you made the other night was fabulous.|The soldiers told me about it.
speak;Tana;Really?|They were talking about my food?|I was so nervous.
speak;Syrene;You've learned the basics well.|That's a solid foundation for all Frelian food.|Take care of yourself, milady.|I look forward to hearing how your parents respond to your cooking.
speak;Tana;You take care of yourself, too, Syrene.|It's your duty to protect me, right?|Then I want you to fulfill your duty and promise to go home with me!
speak;Syrene;I shall do what I can.|But the battlefield can be a dangerous place, milady.|If something happens to me, see to it that you return home safely.

speak;Tana;You're like a real sister to me.|I've always admired you.|You've taught me so much already, and there's so much more that I can learn from you...|So you can't die.|You have to come back home to Frelia with me.|No matter what.

speak;Syrene;I shall never leave your side, milady.|But if something should happen to me...|If, perchance, I were to...to die, I would die happy knowing you were safe.|Please, don't waste my sacrifice.|Make it home, safe, alive, and well.
speak;Tana;I will.|I promise.|But you have to promise me...|Promise that you will do everything in your power to return home with me.
speak;Syrene;I will, Princess Tana.|We will return to Frelia together.|I promise.

name: SupportEirikaAndTana
_source: speak;Tana;Ah, Eirika. |Shall we ride together for a while?
speak;Eirika;Tana, you seem well.|And yes, I'd appreciate the company.
speak;Tana;I feel I should apologize.|I'm afraid I haven't been very much help to you,
speak;Eirika;To be honest, I'm still in training, and not quite battle-ready.|Perhaps you'd fare better if I were not traveling with you...
speak;Eirika;Tana, that's not true at all.|You've been a great help to us.|I have seen you in action.|I know what I'm talking about.
speak;Tana;Thank you, Eirika.|Heh...|I feel so foolish now.
speak;Tana;I look on you as a sister, Eirika.|And yet, even though we're the same age, you seem so much more mature.
speak;Tana;It is you who even gave me the courage to leave the castle.|I wanted to be out on my own, like you, to pattern my life after yours.|I'm simply glad that we are friends.
speak;Eirika;Me too, Tana. I'm glad you came.|You help to remind me of better times.
speak;Tana;Oh, Brother...|I'm going to get you for this, Brother...
speak;Eirika;What's wrong, Tana?|Has something happened to Innes?
speak;Tana;My brother is so cruel!|Listen to what he said to me!|He told me that I was just in everyone's way...|He said I should just go back home to Frelia...
speak;Tana;I'm so depressed.|He's always like that, too.|He just makes fun of me and insults me and teases me.|I hate him so much!
speak;Eirika;Tana, your brother has a strange way of showing his concern...|But he IS concerned about you.|You can see that, can't you?
speak;Eirika;Even my brother gets angry at me when I put myself at risk, even for a good cause.|Your brother is harsh and rough of speech, but he doesn't want you to get hurt.
speak;Eirika;Why don't we go speak with him later?|I'll be right beside you.
speak;Tana;Ah...all right.|But, Eirika...|I still envy you.
speak;Tana;You and Ephraim are so close...|You understand one another.|It must be...so nice...|I wish my brother and I shared that kind of connection.
speak;Eirika;Well, we are twins, you know.|I think that makes us slightly different from normal siblings.
speak;Tana;But you two never fight or anything, do you?|How do you two maintain such a close relationship?
speak;Eirika;I am, thank you, Tana.|I always feel better when you're around.
speak;Tana;I've been wondering...|Eirika, do you think I've grown stronger?|I mean, stronger than when I was cooped up in the castle at least?
speak;Eirika;Tana, you should have more confidence in your abilities.|If I had to rely on my own blade alone, I would not survive.|But with you around, I know I can keep fighting.
speak;Tana;You think?|I guess I'm still not sure.|Still, it is nice to hear you say that.|Eirika, we'll get through this, the two of us.|And when we do, let's sit together and just relax.
speak;Eirika;Sure, Tana.|But first, we'll have to apologize to King Hayden.
speak;Tana;Oh...|Father...|I wonder if he's still mad.
speak;Eirika;Of course...|I understand.|You and I will speak to him together.|Don't you worry.

name: SupportEirikaAndInnes
_source: speak;Innes;Eirika.|I know this might seem sudden, but...|I've decided I must protect you for a while.
speak;Eirika;What?|What do you mean by that?
speak;Innes;I was in a difficult situation at Carcino.|I...must admit that I owe you much for your help that day.
speak;Innes;So now, I've decided to protect you in battle.|I don't know how to say this, but...|It is unacceptable that I remain indebted to you.
speak;Eirika;Oh, you and your foolish pride-
speak;Innes;Regardless, you can count on me.|No arrow can reach all enemies, but I guarantee your safety.|Will you accept my oath?
speak;Eirika;Uh, wait a moment, Innes.|You're an archer...|Wouldn't it make more sense if you stayed behind me?
speak;Innes;...I told you I was going to protect you.
speak;Innes;And yet, whenever an enemy shows himself, you rush in and attack!|...Everyone's going to think you're the one protecting me.
speak;Eirika;Well, I can't help you with your image problems, Innes.|You're an archer, while I have to fight up close.
speak;Innes;That is unacceptable.|I said that I would protect you, and I was being quite sincere.
speak;Eirika;And I appreciate that.|It's nice to know that, when I cross swords with the enemy, you're never far from me, with your bow close at hand.
speak;Innes;Eirika...|You are so kind...|You're so different from that...|brother of yours.
speak;Eirika;No, not as much as you think.|Maybe you only see him as a warrior, as competition, but he is a fine and gentle man, capable of great compassion.
speak;Innes;...If you say so.|I suppose I cannot doubt it if it comes from your lips.
speak;Eirika;Prince Innes, please, try to befriend my brother.|I know he would want this as well.|I don't know why you dislike him.|When I am alone with him, he is so kind.
speak;Innes;Forgive me, but I can bear no more of this talk.|When I see you look that way, I feel only jealousy for this Ephraim.
speak;Innes;He is...a hard man to forgive.|Perhaps there is only one way to settle this.
speak;Innes;Eirika.|Forgive the intrusion, but I must speak to you at once.
speak;Innes;First, just listen to me|Is there...anyone who lays claim to your heart?
speak;Innes;I see.|Then let me speak frankly.|Eirika, it seems I have fallen in love with you.
speak;Eirika;Wh-what!?|This is no place for jokes, Innes!|Why would you say something like that?

speak;Innes;This is no joke.|I am absolutely serious.|These feelings surprise me as well.|I don't know what to do.|Fighting at your side all this time, the emotion just exploded within me.|I love you.|I could not bear to see you in the arms of another.
speak;Innes;No, Eirika.|Do not answer now.|I have not yet bested Ephraim.|I have not earned the right to woo you.
speak;Eirika;Wha-?|Why are you bringing my brother into this?

speak;Innes;With a man like him around, I can see why you show no interest in suitors.|If I prove myself his superior, you will surely accept my hand.|If I fail, I release any claim to your affection.|But I swear it on the depth of my love that I will destroy that man.|Eirika, I will expect your answer then.|That's all I have to say.
speak;Eirika;Innes!|What an...infuriating man!|Why does he have to be so...

name: SupportEirikaAndForde
_source: speak;Eirika;Forde, you're looking in rare form today.
speak;Forde;Ah, Princess!|Yes, I'm trying not to overextend myself today.|I see you're looking well, too.|Except for...
speak;Forde;Well...|I was just thinking about something...|Princess, do you find that your armor leaves a bit too much...exposed?
speak;Forde;You know, too exposed.|Especially around the...er...midriff, if you will.|Aren't you worried that, in the heat of battle, it might, eh...
speak;Forde;Augh!|Oh...|Uh...|You were...just joking.|Wow.|Don't scare me like that!

speak;Eirika;Oh, I'm sorry.|That must have seemed rather unladylike.|Honestly, though, I do rather like this armor.|It's very easy to move around in.|I think that freedom of movement is far more important to me in combat.
speak;Forde;Well, sure.|I guess everyone has his own preference.|I've gotten many long years of use from my armor.
speak;Eirika;I can imagine.|Now that I look at it, I can see all the scars from all your fights.

speak;Forde;A knight's greatest pride are the scars his armor bears for him.|This battered shell of mine is the only true badge of valor...|...The only real sign that I've weathered blade and arrow for king and country.

speak;Forde;Oh, and...|Well, in my case...|Some of these dents are from me falling off my horse.|Heh...|Oh, and some come from falling asleep in my armor and rolling onto my weapons.|Kind of a lot of them, actually.|Heh...
speak;Eirika;You stood by my brother when he and I were separated, didn't you?|I never got a chance to thank you.
speak;Forde;Oh, it was nothing.|Really.|To be fair, Ephraim probably saved my hide more often than I his.
speak;Eirika;I doubt that.|My brother rushes into battle without thought for consequence.|I think, if nothing else, you restrained his natural recklessness.|I owe you a debt.|Both you and Kyle.
speak;Eirika;Forde, Renais thank you.|May you always stand beside us.
speak;Eirika;Ah, Forde.|Yes, it's good to have you fighting at my side again.|It's only because of your skill that I'm fighting here today.
speak;Forde;Well, we all seem to be deep in this fight, milady...
speak;Eirika;Yes, there's no pulling back now.
speak;Forde;So it would seem.|My lady, leave the fighting to us soldiers.|Even if there be an unholy hail of arrows, we would ride into them for your sake.
speak;Eirika;Ha ha...|Why, thank you, sir knight!|...Say, Forde.
speak;Eirika;What will you do when all this fighting is over?
speak;Forde;When the fighting is over?|Hm...|Good question.|Well...|I suppose I'll return to Renais...|and take a very, very long nap.
speak;Eirika;That does sound like you.|And then?
speak;Forde;Then?|I would like to return to my painting, I think.
speak;Forde;Yes, milady.|I paint.|In the past, I've tried to be quiet about this little hobby of mine.|However, quite a few of our group have unearthed my hidden secret.
speak;Eirika;Is that so?|Well, I'd love to view your work sometime.
speak;Forde;Ah, I'd be honored.|It's hardly worthy of such an audience, but I'd be glad to show it to you.
speak;Eirika;Would you ever consider...|doing a portrait of me?
speak;Forde;No!|No...|It's just that I so rarely do portraits.
speak;Eirika;So, it would be a bother?
speak;Forde;Not at all!|A bother?|Really.|This request comes from my princess.|I'd be more than happy to.
speak;Forde;You asked me earlier what I would do when all this fighting ended...
speak;Forde;Well, I should have asked you, too.|What will you do when this fighting ends?
speak;Eirika;I...|...I'd like to restore Renais and bring happiness back to her people.
speak;Eirika;It is not enough that this war end...that we go home again.|It's not enough that my brother become king.|These things aren't enough to make a good country.
speak;Eirika;People deserve happiness.|They are the reason that we rule.|Without the people, there can be no Renais.
speak;Forde;To live happily, to be proud of our nation...|To restore the happiness of her people...
speak;Eirika;Yes, that is my dream now.|It is an abstract goal, and perhaps a little vague, but...
speak;Forde;I mean, rebuilding a country, now THAT is an abstract goal.|But what you've described, that is a wonderful ambition.|I've never been so proud to serve the kingdom of Renais.

speak;Forde;I've come to a decision!|I know I've already sworn an oath, but...|I want to renew that vow.|Please, let me help make your dream come true!|I'll do anything I can to help you...as long as it doesn't require heavy lifting.

speak;Eirika;Thank you...|I'm very grateful to you, Forde.|It feels like this war might never end, and our people give in to despair quickly.|But thanks to people like you, who smile in the face of sorrow, they can be saved.

speak;Forde;Oh, no.|You make too much of it. I'm nothing special.|I simply cannot allow myself to worry when there's fighting to be done.|You're the special one.|You have such a profound effect on us all.
speak;Forde;It is because of you that we can go on.|You and the prince are here, risking your lives for the cause.|Your guidance, your leadership...|It gives us a reason to live as well.
speak;Forde;Yes...|To restore that radiant smile to your own lovely face.
speak;Forde;I fight to see you smile again, to drive the worry from your face.|If I can do that, then I will be more than happy to paint your portrait.
speak;Forde;We'll do it together.|Every day is another step closer to the end of war.|One step closer to making your dream come true.

name: SupportEirikaAndSaleh
_source: speak;Eirika;What is it?|Is it something to do with Caer Pelyn's cultural history?
speak;Saleh;Yes, in a sense.|Think of it as a kind of wish.|A very pure wish.|It is a wish that expands far beyond individual desire.
speak;Eirika;I see.|I don't claim to understand, but it sounds very interesting.|If you don't mind, I'd like to hear more about it later.

speak;Eirika;What you were telling me about Valega was most enlightening.|It sounds as though you align your desires with the world around you.|By knowing the vastness of creation around you, you come to know yourself.|And then, by transcending your selfish needs, you wish for a better world.|What you told me, it helped me rediscover the importance of that unselfish wish.|It's the reason for the war we fight now...|The dream of a better world.|Because of your Valega, my own conviction was renewed.
speak;Saleh;Ahhh.|I'm glad to hear that.|... Princess Eirika, you remind me of the warrior princess, Nada Kuya.
speak;Saleh;She's one of Caer Pelyn's ancient heroes.
speak;Eirika;I'd like to hear about her.
speak;Saleh;I've been told she was a strong woman, beautiful and proud.|She spoke with the voice of nature, and she lived at one with the earth.
speak;Eirika;But you called her a battle princess...?
speak;Saleh;Well, in ancient times, Caer Pelyn was invaded by a foreign nation.

speak;Saleh;And leading the charge against the invaders was Nada Kuya.|She carried a narrow sword made from a fang gifted to her by the dragonkin.|With her dragon blade in her hand, she drove Caer Pelyn's enemies away.
speak;Eirika;Wow...|Quite a story.|And you think I-
speak;Eirika;No, no...|When Grado invaded Renais, I was paralyzed.|I couldn't do anything.|It is only because of the sacrifices of others that I could even escape.
speak;Saleh;But now, you are here.|With your strength, courage, and dignity.
speak;Saleh;If you achieve victory, the legend will become reality.|You will become the Nada Kuya of this age.

speak;Eirika;I see...|Yes, I see!|I have a reason to fight.|I have things to protect.|I fight for the future.|The future of Renais, the future of my people.|Thank you, Master Saleh.|Your stories always give me the courage to fight on.
speak;Eirika;I pray your wisdom guides us through this war.
speak;Saleh;I will do what I can.
speak;Eirika;Oh, Master Saleh.|No, nothing.|My mind was somewhere else...|Oh, and in the middle of a battle...|I'm sorry.
speak;Saleh;Don't be sorry.|I am not going to judge you for how you think or act.
speak;Eirika;I was just remembering my home.|I was thinking about the last time Renais was at peace.

speak;Eirika;There were the most beautiful mountains, the clearest rivers...|The scent of wildflowers filled the air.|The sky was clear and bright.|This was before war scarred the hills and scorched the skies.|It was a wonderful place.|Every day was filled with hope and possibility.|My brother and I would go hunting with Prince Lyon.|...I would make lunches for us.|Ephraim would tease, but Lyon was happy.|I...|I miss that time so very much.
speak;Saleh;Princess Eirika...|I give you my word that you will once again see the Renais you love restored.

speak;Eirika;Master Saleh...|I do hope so.|But first, you and I must concentrate on the battle at hand.|We must win.|Thank you, Master Saleh.|Your homeland, Caer Pelyn, was also a most beautiful place.
speak;Saleh;We had nothing special.|But, because of that, we had...everything.
speak;Eirika;I didn't understand that before.|Now, I think I know what you mean.
speak;Eirika;When we have to fight no more, please, let me visit you in Caer Pelyn.|I would like to know more about your home.|About Valega and Nada Kuya.
speak;Saleh;You are welcome anytime.|Caer Pelyn and I will welcome you with open arms.

name: SupportSethAndGarcia
_source: speak;Seth;Sir Garcia.|Your fighting form remains impeccable, despite your years of retirement.|Fantastic...|How I admire you.
speak;Garcia;No, General Seth, I still have a long way to go.|I've lost so much time.
speak;Garcia;No, no honorifics.|I gave up my title years ago so I could raise my son.|I'm old and rusty, General.|The man I am now is not fit for such fine company.
speak;Garcia;But listen, General.|I'm not finished yet!
speak;Garcia;I'm telling you...|I'm not yet done!|This is not the end of me!
speak;Seth;...He has a warrior's heart.|Is it pride that keeps him from accepting his limitations?|I'm afraid that we have awakened an incredible warrior.
speak;Seth;Garcia.|Did you come all this way to talk to me?|I'm grateful.|Thank you.
speak;Garcia;Don't make a fuss.|Might give me second thoughts before I do it again.
speak;Garcia;Heh...|You know, you remind me of myself as a young man.
speak;Seth;Back when you were in Renais?
speak;Garcia;That's right.|Oh, I was so ambitious then, focused on proving myself in battle.|His Majesty commended my valor many times, he did.

speak;Seth;His Majesty always watched over us.|Hardworking soldiers received words of praise to drive them to greater glories.|The lazy ones, he spurred to action, giving them a reason to improve...|He was a great king.|He earned the trust and respect of his people.
speak;Garcia;...What a loss we've all suffered.
speak;Seth;When Castle Renais fell, it was all I could do to save Princess Eirika.|I've never felt so powerless in all my time as a knight...|...I was mortified.

speak;Garcia;...I'm sorry.|I wasn't blaming you for King Fado's death.|I am the one who surrendered his duty to live a carefree life with his son.|I have no right to cast blame on anyone but myself...
speak;Seth;Garcia, you needn't feel that way.|You're fighting for Renais again, at the side of her crown prince and princess!|There's no shame in that.
speak;Seth;If you are still true to our late king, then let's win this war together.|And together, we shall visit His Majesty's tomb to report our victory!
speak;Seth;You seem much recovered from your poor spirits the other day.|In fact, you seem quite energetic!
speak;Garcia;I've finally accepted that I'm only ever truly alive when I'm fighting!
speak;Seth;Ah, now that is the great Garcia I remember from my youth!|Yes, all hesitation is gone from your face.|You're in rare form!
speak;Garcia;Yes, and that hesitation is gone for good, I dare say.|Except...
speak;Garcia;To tell you the truth...I am not ashamed of the life I've lived.|I'm not sorry that I abandoned my old life to raise my son.
speak;Garcia;That decision made me who I am now.|It's time I embraced both of these aspects of my past.
speak;Garcia; I can only say this in hindsight, but...|It is not so bad to have a family.
speak;Seth;Garcia, I can see it in your eyes.|You don't need to tell me.
speak;Garcia;Heh...|I see!|Well then, Seth.|There is only one solution for it!|You should marry!|It will do you good to have a family to go home to.
speak;Seth;Ah, Garcia...|You may be right, but I'm afraid it will take me some time to get there...

name: SupportSethAndNatasha
_source: speak;Natasha;Oh, General Seth, how do you do?

speak;Seth;...Sister Natasha, good day to you.|I appreciate the care you give our wounded, but be sure to care for yourself, too.|I heard about what happened the other day.|It could have turned out badly...
speak;Natasha;I'm sorry to have worried you.|When I see an injured person, I must help.|I seldom think of the consequences to myself.|I shall be more careful in the future.

speak;Seth;Grado doesn't know what they've lost, Natasha.|You're indispensable to us.|If you were injured, our entire strategy could be slowed or lost altogether.|Take care of yourself first, and worry about us later.

speak;Natasha;Seth, you are the one who is indispensable, far more than I am.|You race into danger, acting as a decoy or rescuing people alone.|You're the one who is reckless.|I wish you would watch yourself.
speak;Seth;I'm sorry.|I didn't realize I'd been causing you so much worry.|I promise to be less reckless.|But you, don't do anything I wouldn't do.
speak;Natasha;Yes, General.|May you be guided to safety.
speak;Seth;Sister Natasha?|Are you well?|I heard you collapsed last night.|Maybe you should rest more, instead of risking yourself on-

speak;Natasha;Oh, General Seth...|I'm sorry about that...|We had many wounded, and I drained myself healing them all.|However, I rested well last night, and I am fully recovered.|I'm sorry for giving you so much cause to worry once again.
speak;Seth;Oh, boy...|You and Eirika...|What am I going to do about you?|You seem hell-bent on throwing away your lives in this conflict.
speak;Natasha;...Oh, I see...|I always become a liability in battle.|All I do is cause you worry and concern.
speak;Seth;You're always the first to race into battle to heal an injured person.|Do you know what the others have started calling you?
speak;Seth;They've taken to calling you “the healing spirit.”
speak;Natasha;...A healing spirit?|Oh, no...|I'm far from it.|Why, I-

speak;Seth;...When you first joined us, I was not sure I could trust my life to you.|You're from Grado, and we've seen the treacheries of which they are capable.|But I've watched you, and I know now that I was wrong.
speak;Seth;I'm grateful for the kindness and compassion that you've shown us all.|My men are right.|You are a healing spirit, sent to rejuvenate us all.|We're fortunate to have you as our friend.
speak;Seth;More than a friend.|You are an irreplaceable asset to our cause.
speak;Natasha;Oh, my...|I'm sorry...|...Please, return to the battle.|And may you be guided to safety.
speak;Seth;...Sister Natasha...|If I am injured, I will not be reckless.|I will race to your side.|And I know that you will take care of me when that happens.
speak;Natasha;Y-yes, of course I will!|Oh, but...I hope that it doesn't.
speak;Seth;Yes, I'm fine.|But it's only because you've been beside me as I've fought.|You were always the one to heal my broken body.
speak;Natasha;You have that wrong, General.|You're the one constantly rescuing me.|When I'm surrounded by enemies, when I'm separated from the others...
speak;Seth;Sister Natasha...|Do you plan on returning to Grado someday?
speak;Natasha;...Yes.|I must return to the temple.|Our people need my services.
speak;Seth;Could anything sway you to stay in Renais instead?
speak;Seth;I'm sorry.|I'm-|I'll be more direct.|Sister Natasha...|When this war is over would you...come live with me?
speak;Natasha;Oh!|But, Seth...|I'm a cleric. I'm sworn never to...
speak;Seth;I know you're a cleric.|You've given your life over to a divine calling.|But would the Everlasting not smile upon the love shared by its creations?
speak;Seth;I vow upon the sacred oaths you have sworn that I will make you happy.
speak;Natasha;Seth...|I hope you keep that promise.|I'll wait for you until this war is finally at an end.
speak;Seth;I will keep my promise, Natasha.|I will.

name: SupportSethAndCormag
_source: speak;Cormag;You're pretty good with a spear.
speak;Seth;Thank you.|I don't think I've introduced myself.|I'm the leader of the Knights of Renais-
speak;Cormag;I know you.|Of course I know you.|You're General Seth, the Silver Knight.
speak;Seth;...Yes, that's right.|And you are Cormag, the renowned wyvern rider of Grado.
speak;Cormag;If the legendary Silver Knight knows my name, I can't be doing too bad, huh?

speak;Seth;You and your brother, Glen, are famous even among the Knights of Renais.|We have no wyvern riders in Renais, and your stories are favorites among the men.|I've been watching your combat style since you joined our forces.
speak;Cormag;Oh, is that so?|Well, tell me.|What do you think?
speak;Seth;I'd love a chance to spar with you.
speak;Cormag;Not a chance.|I could never beat you.
speak;Seth;So you say, but I can see in your eyes that you'll never accept failure.
speak;Cormag;Heh...|And all this time, I thought you were just another loyal dullard.|Guess I was wrong.|We should chat some more sometime.
speak;Seth;Yes, I think I'd like that.|Perhaps once things have eased up.|I'm looking forward to it, Cormag.
speak;Seth;Ah, Cormag.|Good timing.|I had something I wanted to ask you.|Your family, are they all soldiers?
speak;Seth;Your skill with the spear is amazing.|Have you trained since you were a child?

speak;Cormag;No, I come from a long line of dirt-poor farmers.|I wielded a plough, not a spear.|When we were kids, Glen and I had to chase birds and animals from our fields.|We used sticks and stones, and I think that helped with our aim, to be honest.
speak;Seth;Is that so...|So why did you join the army?

speak;Cormag;It's a funny story, really.|...The emperor's caravan passed through our village one day.|My brother and I watched the glorious procession from the top of a tree.|Then, a stray dog started to harry the horses pulling the emperor's carriage.|We threw rocks to drive off the mutt, but some soldiers decided to arrest us.
speak;Cormag;Yes, well.|We didn't just hit the dog.|We got a few of the soldiers as well.

speak;Cormag;Well, the emperor shows up in the room the soldiers had thrown us.|He looks around and, in this very calm but stern voice, says to the soldiers.|“What are you men doing, arresting mere children?|They were trying to help!”|Then, he invites us to dine at his table, and it was a luxurious feast, I tell you!|Now, we were just kids.|We lacked the basic courtesies.|We were just filthy.|And we kept droning on about the most idiotic things.|Chores, the village...|But he listened to us intently, and that fatherly smile never left his face.|And he said, “You lads are good at driving off dogs with stones...|Your skills are wasted in the fields.|Let's see how you fare with spears instead.”
speak;Seth;And that's how you were recruited.
speak;Cormag;Exactly.|It's difficult to ignore such a commanding presence.|But...the emperor changed.|I still can't believe what's happened.

speak;Seth;...I was born into a family of knights, so it was a given that I should be one, too.|I trained in spear and sword.|I studied chivalry and swore my oaths of fealty.|And because of my hard work, the late King Fado treated me like a second son.|...It's funny.|You and I are from different worlds, but we share the same loyalties.
speak;Cormag;True...|But King Fado is dead now.|And my emperor is the one who killed him...|My emperor is as good as dead to me.
speak;Seth;...I already serve a new lord.|Cormag, you will find a ruler worthy of your loyalties, too.
speak;Seth;Can I have a word with you, Cormag?
speak;Cormag;Oh, Seth.|Of course.|What can I do for you?
speak;Seth;I've been thinking about your story, and I've come to a decision.
speak;Seth;...Cormag, listen.|As general of the Knights of Renais, I'd like to offer you a post.
speak;Cormag;What?|You want me to join the Knights of Renais?

speak;Seth;Yes, exactly.|I've been watching you fight, and I've been thinking about this for some time.|Since we've been speaking, I've seen more than just your fighting prowess.|I've seen that you're a strong and noble person as well.|You are a man I would risk my life fighting beside.|Prince Ephraim will be a great king.|Would you fight for him with me?
speak;Cormag;I really appreciate it.|Thanks, Seth.|But...Grado is my home.|I can't trade loyalties to Renais just like that.
speak;Seth;...I knew you would say that.
speak;Cormag;Emperor Vigarde is my only lord.|My duty now is to correct the mistakes he has made.|That's why I'm here.|I hope you can understand.
speak;Seth;Yes, of course...|Still, I'm glad that I met you.
speak;Cormag;Same here, Seth.|Now, let's get this war over with, shall we?
speak;Seth;Yes, and when it's done, we'll get together and tell some stories.

name: SupportGilliamAndSyrene
_source: speak;Gilliam;Syrene.|...It's been a while.|You look great.
speak;Gilliam;What is it, Syrene?|Is there something on my face?
speak;Syrene;Oh, it's nothing.|Don't worry about it.|You're still one of the best-looking men in Frelia's army.
speak;Gilliam;You know I hate it when you tease me.|What is that smile about?|You're making me very nervous.
speak;Syrene;You were with me on my first mission as one of Frelia's pegasus knight elite.|Do you remember?
speak;Gilliam;Was I really?|I hardly remember.|I have a tough time picturing the famous Syrene as a green recruit.|That really was a long time ago.
speak;Syrene;Oh, really?|What do you mean by that?
speak;Gilliam;Oh, nothing.|Nothing.|Just that you've always been one of Frelia's finest warriors.
speak;Syrene;Gilliam...|This mission matters more to me than that first mission did.
speak;Gilliam;I understand.|Much more hangs in the balance if we fail.
speak;Syrene;We won't fail.|I won't allow it!
speak;Syrene;Thanks, Gilliam.|I'm grateful that you're here with me.
speak;Gilliam;Everything's fine for now, but-|Syrene?|You look pale.|Are you feeling unwell?
speak;Syrene;I'm fine, Gilliam.|Don't worry about me.
speak;Gilliam;...Syrene.|People come to you when they need advice, right?
speak;Syrene;They do, yes.|Why do you ask?|Don't tell me you need some advice from me.
speak;Gilliam;People come to talk to me, too.|Must be...the wisdom of age or something.|But I don't know what to say.|What do you do if you have no advice to give?

speak;Syrene;That happens all the time.|But I've learned something...|People feel better as soon as they let it out.|They just want you to listen.|We're fighting a war.|It's only natural that people get scared and need comfort.
speak;Syrene;...Gilliam.|Is this all just an attempt to probe me for my problems?
speak;Syrene;Don't worry.|If I ever have any problems, I'll be sure to come to you.
speak;Syrene;...Gilliam, you're always telling me to be careful...|You know full well I watch over everyone.|It's what I do.|But you...|You're the one who always watches over me.
speak;Syrene;You know why I stay close to you?|Just to hear you say that.
speak;Gilliam;Is that...all you want to hear me say?
speak;Gilliam;Don't answer now.|When this war is over...|When we get back to Frelia...|Wait until then, will you?|Wait until then to tell me.

speak;Syrene;Gilliam...|You needn't wait that long.|You already know my answer.|...But if that is what you want, Gilliam, then yes!|...I will wait until the war is over before I give my answer! |Gilliam...|Good luck.

name: SupportFranzAndNatasha
_source: speak;Franz;I'm doing fine, thank you.|Everything is fine.|And you look like you're doing well, too.|I'm relieved.
speak;Natasha;Yes, but it's all thanks to everyone's care and concern, really.|I'm grateful for all the attention everyone has paid to my safety.|That goes for you, too, Franz.
speak;Franz;Oh, pshaw, Sister Natasha.|I am just a pawn, really.|I don't do much...
speak;Natasha;You are too modest, Franz.|I'm telling you the truth.
speak;Natasha;By the way, that's a very interesting satchel you have.
speak;Natasha;It's not military issue, is it?|I haven't seen any of the other cavaliers carrying one like it.
speak;Franz;Oh, this old thing?|To tell you the truth, I made it myself.

speak;Franz;Yes.|This pouch holds a skin of water, and this pocket is for food.|There's also a pocket for herbs...|I can find everything very quickly.|Oh, and I've also fixed it so that it won't shake about while I'm riding.|It's easy to carry on one shoulder or sling over both.|And it goes with everything.
speak;Franz;Thank you.|It's...probably my only redeeming trait.|Uh...|Would you like one?|I can make one for you.
speak;Natasha;Really?|That would be wonderful.|But...are you sure?
speak;Natasha;Franz.|That satchel you made me is ingenious.|Really.
speak;Franz;Really?|Good...|I made yours more lightweight than the one I made myself.
speak;Natasha;Thank you so much.|I'll cherish it.|Oh, ouch!
speak;Franz;Hn!?|Sister Natasha, are you all right?|What's wrong?!
speak;Franz;Oh...|Your hair's gotten pinched in your clip.
speak;Franz;Oh, don't move.|Let me help you.
speak;Franz;But your hair's still...|Ah, I know.|Hold on a moment.|Let...me...see...
speak;Franz;Your hair is messed up.|Would you like me to fix it?
speak;Natasha;Yes, please.|But where did you get that comb...
speak;Franz;...This comb is a memento of my mother.

speak;Franz;Yes.|See, when I left home, I was afraid of something bad happening.|So I thought I'd take this comb with me as a good-luck charm.|I usually keep it in front of the portrait of my mother Forde painted.
speak;Natasha;Um......|It looks good.|Much better than when I do it myself...|Franz, you truly are a remarkably handy person.|When you're near me, I find myself comforted by your presence.
speak;Natasha;No, I mean it.|Thank you.|I hope that this marks the beginning of a long friendship.
speak;Franz;As do I, milady.|As do I.
speak;Franz;Oh, no, Sister Natasha.|I'm still such an amateur...
speak;Natasha;You're serious and focused, Franz.|You grow stronger every day, and you're sure to be a wonderful knight!
speak;Franz;Thank you...|But I've never excelled in either the spear or sword, and I'm a small man.|I'm not much when compared to the likes of our other men.
speak;Natasha;There are many types of knights.|Some are strong, some are swift, and others are intelligent.|You possess a wonderful talent that no other man can match.
speak;Natasha;Yes.|You have a pure heart.|It is stronger than any spear, and it possesses its own brand of power.|You should have more confidence.
speak;Franz;A...pure heart...|Thank you very much.|I'll take your words to heart and try to be more confident.
speak;Franz;Oh, by the way.|Here you go...
speak;Franz;Yes, it's my mother's comb.|I would like it if you chose to keep it with you.
speak;Franz;I've let myself believe that it protected me from harm.|Now, I would like to believe that it protects you, too...
speak;Natasha;Franz, I can't.|This is something you should keep.

speak;Natasha;You took this comb because you believed your mother was protecting you.|This comb embodies all your memories of and feelings for your mother.|It should remain in your hands.|That's where it belongs.
speak;Natasha;But I do thank you...|It is a remarkably tender gesture.|I'm very happy.
speak;Natasha;Franz...|The only reason I fight on with confidence is because you are with me.

speak;Natasha;No, I'm serious.|You see, for me, you are the person who makes me feel...|Well, strong.|Strong and confident.|Your presence is better than a good-luck charm or anything else.|I hope that you and I spend more time together, fighting for this just cause.
speak;Franz;Yes!|Thank you for all your kind words.|I certainly hope so, too.
speak;Natasha;Together, let's restore peace to all countries, not just Renais and Grado.
speak;Franz;Yes, Sister Natasha.|It is a noble cause, and we will bring victory!
speak;Natasha;Then let's fight.|For victory and for friendship.

name: SupportFranzAndForde
_source: speak;Franz;I'm glad to see you're still in one piece!|After that last battle, I was starting to get a little worried.
speak;Forde;I'm glad you're alright, too.|Good job out there, by the way.|Your fighting form is perfect.
speak;Franz;Thanks, Forde.|I keep thinking about this war...|What do you think will happen?
speak;Forde;Dunno.|I mean, whatever happens happens, right?
speak;Franz;Always quick with a joke...|But I'm serious this time.|What do you think?
speak;Forde;Hey, I was being serious.|We are the best and brightest of our age, but we face overwhelming numbers.|If you ask me, all I can say is that I hope we win.
speak;Franz;It takes more than just hoping for it.|We need to FIGHT for it.|We are Knights of Renais, and it's our duty to fight.
speak;Forde;Sigh...|You're so serious.|You're just like Kyle.|If you take the battle too seriously, you're sure to make a mistake.
speak;Forde;Of course!|It's good to be responsible, but you have more pressing concerns at times.
speak;Franz;All right, Brother.|I know what you're saying.
speak;Forde;Hm?|Yes, well...it's a hobby.|You fish, don't you?
speak;Forde;What do you like about fishing?
speak;Franz;Well...it's different than hunting for other animals.|More patient.|And yet, when I hold a fishing pole, I feel my spear arm is getting stronger.
speak;Forde;When you're off duty, you should stop thinking about spears and swords.
speak;Forde;...Hm.|Fishing sounds nice.|Lets you relax, purge your heart of the battlefield.
speak;Forde;And that is important, isn't it?|In battle or in daily life, you just have to stop and rest, right?|Hey, you should take a break sometime and go fishing around here!
speak;Franz;Ha!|In the middle of a war?|You can't be serious.|How could I possibly do that?
speak;Forde;Hey, I'm not saying you should go right in the middle of a battle.|Do it when you're off duty.|Maybe you can help replenish our food supplies.
speak;Forde;Sure, yeah.|You go catch us a big fish, and I'll eat it.|It's a deal!
speak;Forde;Now, I've something to look forward to.
speak;Franz;Hm...|Was this all just about you getting some fresh fish to eat?
speak;Forde;Franz, that was the best fish I ever tasted.|Thanks.
speak;Franz;I was feeling guilty a little while I was fishing though.|I was off duty, but still...we are in the middle of war.|I guess it's fine.|General Seth seemed to like it well enough, too.
speak;Forde;Yup.|And as long as everyone's happy, there's no harm done.
speak;Forde;Franz, what's with you?|All of a sudden, you-
speak;Franz;No, it's not sudden at all.|Come to think of it, I became a soldier so I could be like you.|And now, I'm going to work harder, so I can be a great knight like you.
speak;Forde;That...|That doesn't make any sense.|Have you seen how lazy I am?|Seriously.|There are MUCH better role models out there for you to hero-worship.
speak;Franz;No, no.|You like to act lazy.|It's part of your charm, isn't it?|But once the battle starts, everyone sees how sharp a warrior you are.
speak;Franz;Yes, it is.|And I also know that you like to play the part of the fool for no other reason than to give these weary soldiers a reason to smile.
speak;Franz;And your sword and spear skills surpass those of any knight in the service of Renais, Frelia, or any other kingdom.
speak;Forde;Wow.|Your flattery is far more than I deserve...
speak;Franz;The only reason you paint is to acquire a better understanding of geography, so that you can use that knowledge in battle...
speak;Forde;Nah...|It's just a hobby.|Don't give me too much credit.
speak;Franz;I'm not.|Think about it.|You only paint landscapes, isn't that true?
speak;Forde;...The last portrait I ever painted was of Mother...
speak;Forde;Never mind.|Not important.|Anyway, I'm shocked.|SHOCKED.|Yeah, if you need a role model, look to General Seth.
speak;Franz;Of course I admire General Seth.|But that's just admiration.|You're still my role model.
speak;Forde;Well, I can't tell you what to think.|I just hope you don't regret this later.
speak;Franz;Yes.|So, that's that.|Now, make sure you don't get yourself killed in a fight.|Bye.
speak;Forde;Franz...|I need you to survive this war.|You and I will go home together.|When this war is over, you and I will go home and rebuild our lives.

name: SupportMoulderAndColm
_source: speak;Moulder;Colm, you dolt!|Don't you see what you've done!?
speak;Colm;Hey!|That's no way to be!|I was trying to do you a favor here.|It's not my fault if I accidentally burned your package lighting my torch!
speak;Moulder;That's exactly what I'm talking about!|You're always so careless!|My spare robes were in that bundle!|Oh, and now look at them!|They've been charred black!
speak;Colm;Oops...|Those were your clothes?|Tch!|That IS a shame.|My mistake.|I apologize.
speak;Moulder;This isn't the first time this has happened, Colm!|And it was my robes of office then, too!|I'm starting to wonder if you have it in for my clothes!
speak;Colm;Oh, no, no.|Don't be silly!|And besides, only the bottom has been singed.|Just trim it off and wear it short.|See?|Why, I'm sure you'll set the world of fashion on fire with your new look!
speak;Moulder;That's what you said last time about the sleeves.
speak;Colm;Oh, er...|Really?|Ha ha ha!|Well, sorry.|I'm sorry.|No, really.|I deeply regret this.
speak;Moulder;You don't look particularly sorry.|You look rather pleased with yourself.
speak;Moulder;If that's the case, then you can just spend tonight reflecting upon what you've done.
speak;Moulder;I want you to take some time to reflect on the consequences of your actions.|Colm, I'm only doing this because I care.|I care about the condition of your soul.
speak;Colm;...You really know how to lay on a guilt trip, don't you?|Sigh. I'm in trouble now...|Shoot!
speak;Moulder;Colm.|Did you do what I asked of you?
speak;Colm;Of course, Father Moulder!|In fact, I've set aside a little time each night to reflect on my day's deeds!
speak;Moulder;Good.|I'm glad to hear you've taken my suggestion to heart.|Might I inquire as to what manner of thing you're reflecting on?
speak;Colm;Well, I reflected on how hungry I was, and so I packed some extra salted pork today.
speak;Colm;Yes.|See, on reflection, it had been a while since I'd had salted pork.
speak;Colm;Hm...|The day before...|Oh, yeah!|I was reflecting on how much walking we'd done, and I realized I needed new shoes.|I figured, next chance I get, I'd go out and steal me a new pair!
speak;Moulder;Colm...|I'm not sure you understand what it is I asked you to reflect upon.
speak;Colm;You told me to think about what I'd done during the day and to reflect on it.

speak;Moulder;I told you to think over the things you did and feel sorry for having done.|I wasn't talking about what you wanted to eat or whether you needed new shoes!|That is not the point of all this!
speak;Colm;Did it ever cross your mind that...|maybe I haven't done anything I'm sorry about?

speak;Moulder;Don't be foolish!|Think back on the things you've done during the day.|Then, think about the troubles you caused and vow not to repeat them!|Do you understand me now?|This is for your own sake!|I'll come back in a few days.|Keep thinking!
speak;Colm;...I thought that whole self-reflection thing was going a little too well.|Fine, Father.|I'll do it. I'll do it.
speak;Colm;Oh. Let me guess.|You want to hear what I've been reflecting on.
speak;Moulder;Exactly.|Although...I noticed that you look sleepy.|Are you well?
speak;Colm;I...was up late last night thinking about everything.|I couldn't sleep well.
speak;Moulder;That's unfortunate.|Did you have so much that you regretted doing?|Hm.|Well, let me hear it.|Tell me what's on your mind.
speak;Colm;How's that?|I'm doing good, aren't I?
speak;Moulder;I'd say so.|You're going over your every action, from waking to sleep.
speak;Colm;Well, that's what you told me to do.
speak;Moulder;Well done, my lad!|I've never heard so much thought go into what you've done before!|Compared with the salted pork, your transformation is impressive!|It's a little extreme, but......

speak;Colm;But the funny thing is...|I've started noticing all these things about me I didn't know before.|I keep saying, “That was wrong” and “I'll do better next time.”|So...I'm not repeating the same mistakes over and over.

speak;Moulder;I had noticed that your behavior has significantly improved of late.|You look sleepy now, but your face seems far more peaceful as well.|It seems that you're finally growing up, thanks to these quiet moments.
speak;Colm;Heh...|You know, I think that's the first nice thing you've said to me!
speak;Moulder;You're coming along just fine.|But...|go easy on yourself, all right?

speak;Moulder;If you stay up all night thinking about your day, you'll make yourself sick.|You've already mastered the art of learning from your own experiences.|I don't want you falling into old habits because of a little illness.|I have high expectations of you, my son.
speak;Colm;Thank you, Father Moulder.|I'm glad that you do.|It's only your expectations that have made me become a better man.

name: SupportMoulderAndSyrene
_source: speak;Syrene;Father Moulder, you look tired.|We've been asking so much of you lately...

speak;Moulder;Don't worry about me.|I'm rather more worried about you, Syrene.|You had only just been transferred to this unit when we left Frelia.|I'd imagine it must be odd not having any familiar faces around.
speak;Syrene;I've already learned everyone's name and field of specialization.|Don't worry about me.
speak;Syrene;To beat your enemy, know your allies.|Without knowing the skills of your own men, you can never win a war.|I don't want to die just because I didn't know what to expect from my troops.

speak;Moulder;I was worried about how well you were integrating into our group.|You seem to have matters well in hand, though.|I'm proud of you, Syrene.|If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask me anytime.
speak;Syrene;Thank you, Father Moulder.|I do appreciate your thoughtfulness.
speak;Moulder;Syrene, you said you'd already learned everything about our little band.|Did anyone in Frelia go over the details with you before you left?

speak;Syrene;No, Father.|Things were rather hectic in Frelia before we left, as you know.|Everything I have learned, I've learned on the job, so to speak.|People...confide in me, and I learn by observation.
speak;Moulder;Interesting.|So, even though you're new, they know they can confide in you?
speak;Syrene;Yes.|The ladies seem most comfortable speaking to me.

speak;Moulder;I understand.|Even a man of the cloth is still, at heart, a man.|It must reassure them to know that there is another woman to whom they can speak.|There are many women among us.|If I cannot be “father” to them, please, care for them as a mother.
speak;Syrene;With all respect, Father, I refuse to minister to their needs as a mother would.|I am still young and unworthy.|I prefer to speak to them as a sister.
speak;Moulder;Ha ha ha ha...|Yes, of course.|Please excuse me.|Help them, then, as a sister would.
speak;Syrene;Yes, Father!|Now, may I have a word with you?|As their sister?
speak;Moulder;I beg your pardon?|Me?|What?|Has someone...complained about me?
speak;Syrene;Well, I'll let you know the day after the next new moon.
speak;Moulder;Must I wait until then?|Is it so terrible that I needs must prepare myself for the news?
speak;Syrene;Rest easy, Father!|It's only a suggestion, not criticism.
speak;Moulder;So...|Last night was a new moon.|And that means today is the day.|I've been going mad wondering, Syrene.|What is your suggestion?
speak;Syrene;Ah, right you are, Father.|It is indeed the promised day.|Well, then.|On behalf of everyone, I have two words for you.|Father Moulder?
speak;Moulder;What?|Birthday?|Oh...|Oh, yes!|Why, today is my birthday, isn't it?|But-

speak;Syrene;It is a fine tradition to celebrate one's birthday, Father.|In a war, uncertainty surrounds us every moment of every day.|Instead of worrying about tomorrow, let us celebrate life today.|That should encourage us all to keep going, wouldn't you say?
speak;Moulder;Yes, indeed.|To share the joys of life is very important.|Thank you, Syrene.|In this chaos, I would have forgotten my own birthday.

speak;Syrene;You exhaust yourself caring for others, but you pay no attention to yourself.|We are all so grateful to you, Father.|So many different people came up to me to ask how we could show that gratitude.|You are a man of great virtue, and an inspiration to us all.
speak;Moulder;I am touched...|At my age, I thought all my happy birthdays were well behind me.|I'm a little embarrassed at that...
speak;Syrene;You must remember to take care of yourself, Father.|And thank you.

name: SupportVanessaAndSyrene
_source: speak;Syrene;Vanessa!|How are you?|I was worried about you!
speak;Vanessa;I'm fine, ma'am.|Thank you for your concern.|Glad to see you doing well too.
speak;Syrene;Vanessa, you know you don't need to talk like that when we're alone.
speak;Syrene;Let me put it this way, then.|This is an order from your captain!|When we're alone, you are to speak to me as if we are at home.
speak;Syrene;Vanessa.|*Sigh*.|Did you listen to a word I said?
speak;Syrene;Ha ha ha!|Yes, that's it!|Oh, by the way, I have something for you.
speak;Syrene;Here you go.|Father wanted me to give it to you.
speak;Vanessa;But this is...|The war god Fale's amulet!

speak;Syrene;Yes, this is a battle amulet.|I received one before I left home, too.|You were summoned so suddenly that Father didn't get a chance to give it to you.|And Mother wanted to tell you, “Never be apart from this amulet.”
speak;Syrene;She also wanted you to relax and do your best.|And to get a good night's sleep always.

speak;Syrene;Maybe others don't notice, but I know you too well, Vanessa. I know you don't get enough rest when you feel overwhelmed with responsibility.|But, to be at your best, you need to take care of yourself, OK?
speak;Syrene;I'll be right by your side tonight, so just relax.|You need a good night's sleep.
speak;Vanessa;Thanks, Sis.|I sleep better when you're around.
speak;Syrene;You look better, Vanessa.|Did you sleep well?
speak;Vanessa;Yes.|First time in a long time.|Thank you, Sis.
speak;Syrene;I've been meaning to ask you...
speak;Syrene;You don't seem to have much appetite lately.
speak;Syrene;I told you, Vanessa, I know you too well.|So, who's the lucky guy?
speak;Vanessa;What?!|That's just crazy!|I don't know what you're talking about!

speak;Syrene;You know I can tell when you're lying.|Plus, you not eating is a dead giveaway.|I mean, when's the last time you said no to a cookie?|It's not a criticism.|One of your most charming qualities is how you can outeat anyone.|It's because of someone special, isn't it?
speak;Syrene;But, Vanessa, first and foremost, you have to take care of yourself.|I'll support you no matter what, but no one is worth losing your health over.

speak;Vanessa;Thank you, I guess.|I'll do my best...|Sometimes I think that if I were more like you-|you know, a great knight, an attractive woman, and just all-around perfect-|I'd have a better chance with him.
speak;Vanessa;Hmmm.|That didn't sound as pathetic in my head as it did out loud.
speak;Syrene;Don't be silly, Vanessa.|You may not know it, but I'm sure that person likes you for who you are.

speak;Vanessa;Do you really think so?|I've always wanted to be like you.|You've always been my role model.|But, I feel like whenever I finally catch up to you, you're already gone.|You've already moved on.|I'll never catch up with you, no matter how hard I try.
speak;Syrene;I'm very proud of you, Vanessa.|And as your older sister, I recognize your talent more than anyone else.|You should be more confident.
speak;Vanessa;I feel better after opening up to you.|It's hard not to compare myself with you, but I have to get past that.
speak;Syrene;That's the spirit.|And remember, you have to take care of yourself.
speak;Vanessa;Yes, I know.|As always, thanks, Syrene.
speak;Vanessa;Hi, Syrene.|Thanks for talking the other day.
speak;Vanessa;Well...|It's not that easy, but I quit comparing myself with you.
speak;Syrene;You might not know this, but there's something about you I've always envied.
speak;Syrene;You have an inner fortitude that I will never be able to match.

speak;Syrene;Do you remember when Father collapsed?|Mother and I were so panicked that we didn't know what to do.|You were the youngest of us all, but you gathered nuts in your small hands and went to the village to sell them.|Then you came home with medicine for him.
speak;Vanessa;Well, I don't know what to say.

speak;Syrene;When you face a difficult circumstance, your true self emerges.|You were very young, but had the presence of mind and ingenuity to help Father.|You comforted me and Mother, and you rescued Father.|I've always respected your strength, and wished for some of it myself.
speak;Vanessa;But...you were the one who joined the Knights at such an early age, and it was you who supported our family.

speak;Syrene;I emulated your strength.|I wanted to support my family like you did.|It's always been my goal.|And I respect you more than anyone else.|I wish you could be as confident in yourself as I am of you.|No matter what, you'll always be all right.
speak;Vanessa;All right, then.|I have to tell you!|The person I love is-

speak;Syrene;Wait, Vanessa!|Wait until the war is over to tell me.|When everything is over, bring him home.|I'll go home a little ahead of you, and wait for you two with Father and Mother.|We'll make your favorite meal... |Is that enough to convince you?
speak;Vanessa;Yes.|I'll do my best...|For this war and also for him.
speak;Syrene;That's my girl.|Don't worry.|You'll be alright.

name: SupportVanessaAndLute
_source: speak;Vanessa;I'm Vanessa.|I'm captain of Frelia's pegasus knights.|And this here is Titania.|We're both pleased to meet you, Lute.

speak;Lute;Ah, the pegasus, the proud, winged horse.|You know, they only attach to someone they accept as their master.|And did you know that pegasi fly by kicking the air, not by flapping their wings.|It's a common misconception, but wings are mainly used for gliding.
speak;Vanessa;...Yes, as captain, I learned all this long ago.|Plus, if they flapped their wings constantly, no one would be able to ride them.

speak;Lute;In some countries, the word pegasus means “fountain” or “ocean.”|Different cultures have different stories about the creation of the pegasus.|In one legend, there was a monster who could turn anyone into stone.|When the monster died, its blood seeped into the ground.|There, a pegasus was born.
speak;Vanessa;...Well!|Thank you for the lesson.|I'm glad we're on the same team.|It was nice meeting you.
speak;Lute;Yes, nice to meet you, Titania.
speak;Vanessa;I'm happy to know that I've made such a strong impression on you, Lute.
speak;Vanessa;So, what can I do for you?

speak;Lute;It's common knowledge that pegasi have strong resistance to magic.|I developed a new counterattack to that power, but it still needs refining.|I guess what I'm saying is...|Can I try it out on Titania?
speak;Vanessa;Sigh.|You said it with such a straight face...|You definitely had me fooled.
speak;Lute;Thank you!|That's so sweet of you to say.
speak;Vanessa;It wasn't a compliment!|Besides, you really don't seem like someone who has much of a sense of humor.
speak;Vanessa;Yes...|And it seems like your magic is the real thing.|When you defeated the enemy the other day, I saw a sharp flash of magic from above.
speak;Lute;Gee, I wonder why that happened...
speak;Lute;Why, yes!|You are 100 percent correct!|For once.

speak;Vanessa;My point is, we don't have enough mages in Frelia, so we're counting on you.|When I was growing up, I always wanted to be a pegasus knight like my sister.|I was also interested in magic, but I just didn't have the talent.
speak;Lute;Well, you are a great pegasus knight, so it's worked out fine.|Besides, I am also interested in becoming a pegasus knight.
speak;Vanessa;Where are you in your training?
speak;Lute;I'm at 98 levels out of 158 levels total.
speak;Vanessa;That's very impressive...|Anyway, let's just do our best out there, shall we?
speak;Vanessa;Lute, did you know this?|The wings of a thousand pegasi are an incredibly potent aphrodisiac.
speak;Lute;I...I didn't know that...|OK, now I really need Titania's help.
speak;Vanessa;Wait!|Wait!|I was just kidding!|Hush, Titania!|Hush!|I was joking!
speak;Lute;I see...|I was, um, kidding, as well.|Heh heh?

speak;Vanessa;Hee hee!|Consider it payback.|But, Lute, I never thought you would try to steal the wings right off her back!|Guess the battlefield is a lonely place!|Ha ha ha ha!|You know, I'm often told that I need to loosen up and not be so serious.|I'd always tried to be like my sister.|She's very strong, as both a knight and a person.|Maybe I've tried too hard.|But it's so much easier to loosen up with people like you around.|Thanks!
speak;Vanessa;When I'm with you, I can relax and just be myself.
speak;Lute;Oh, I'm so sorry to hear that.
speak;Vanessa;That was a compliment!|Jeez.|You're a tough one...|When this war is over, would you like to come visit me in Frelia?|You could ride a pegasus if you'd like.
speak;Lute;That would be an illuminating experience.|But I have to start reading up on pegasi behavior now, so I won't get thrown off.|Do they like carrots?
speak;Vanessa;Well, I don't know about that.|I'll let you do your research.|I must go now.|See you later, Lute.

name: SupportVanessaAndForde
_source: speak;Vanessa;What's that down there?!|Whoa, Titania!|Whoa, girl!|Let's stop here!
speak;Vanessa;Are you hurt?!|Are you all right?!
speak;Vanessa;You have GOT to be kidding me!|Sleeping while a war is waging?|Bold warrior, it's time to wake up!|Hey!|Lazybones!|Get up!
speak;Vanessa;Oh, boy...|Let's go, Titania.|It's clear that Mr. Slug here needs his beauty rest.
speak;Vanessa;Oh, look who's actually awake today.
speak;Forde;You must be one of Frelia's pegasus knights.
speak;Forde;Yeah, that's right.|Vanessa.|I'm Forde.|Nice to meet you.|By the way, what do you mean by me being awake?

speak;Vanessa;Just the other day, I was flying by and saw you lying on the ground.|I thought you were hurt, but when I got closer, I saw that you were just sleeping!|I couldn't believe my eyes.|I was so disgusted that I just left you there.|But then I started to worry about enemies spotting you, so I went back.|By the time I got back to where you were, you were already gone.
speak;Forde;I catch them off guard that way and then attack.|That's my strategy.
speak;Forde;Ha ha ha!|But anyway, thanks for your concern.
speak;Vanessa;You really don't stress or plan much, do you?|So different from our prince...

speak;Forde;The prince of Frelia?|Ah, you mean Prince Innes.|I think he's almost 100 percent stress.|But I'm sure he's quite the ladies' man.|I bet you have a crush on him, too.|You're blushing, so I must have hit a nerve!

speak;Forde;A romance between a prince and his knight?|What scandal!|What intrigue!|It's all right, though.|You can love anyone you like.|You must have lots of competition, seeing how he is a prince.|It's much easier to date someone you can be yourself around.|Someone like, say, me would be ideal for you.|What do you say?
speak;Vanessa;Um...|Let's go, Titania.|We've wasted enough time here.
speak;Forde;You don't have to run away like that!|OK, see you!|Watch out for those archers!
speak;Vanessa;I guess so.|You've been working for me from behind-the-scenes, haven't you.
speak;Forde;Yes.|But don't worry.|I'm used to that sort of misunderstanding.
speak;Forde;Heh heh heh.|You're welcome, of course.|So, how about all that other stuff?
speak;Forde;Am I too far a cry from a prince?

speak;Forde;Everyone has a different type of energy.|Some energies can heal hearts, others spread courage.|When you first saw me sleeping, I was dreaming of running across a field.|I felt this warm energy engulfing me, blowing across my face like a summer wind.|It must have been your energy that made me feel that way.
speak;Forde;Would you like to feel my energy, too?
speak;Forde;Wonderful!|I'll be waiting for your answer, Vanessa.

name: SupportVanessaAndInnes
_source: speak;Vanessa;Prince Innes!|Yes, I’m fine.|I’m glad YOU are fine, sir.
speak;Innes;Good, Vanessa.|Your contributions to this war and also to Frelia as a whole have been very valuable.

speak;Vanessa;Thank you for your kind words, sir.|I was so worried when a messenger from Carcino told us you were in danger.|I worried for your safety.|Nothing is going to happen to me.|It’s still very strange to me that you are grown up and worry about me now.|When you first joined the knights, you were just a girl.
speak;Innes;You are a great knight now.|I’m counting on you, Vanessa.
speak;Vanessa;Yes.|I’ll protect you at any cost.
speak;Innes;Ha ha ha!|Vanessa, you don’t need to protect me.|It’s the other way around.|As the prince of Frelia, I have the duty to protect you.
speak;Vanessa;Oh, yes!|I didn’t mean to offend!
speak;Innes;Pshaw!|But remember, I am counting on you.
speak;Vanessa;Your skills are so polished now!|I bet you could shoot down a drop of rain!
speak;Innes;You flatter me, Vanessa, but my skills aren’t quite there yet.|But I’ve noticed that you have improved quite a bit since this war started.
speak;Innes;You make me confident in battle.
speak;Innes;Yes, you! With such a skilled knight at my side, I feel secure and can be my best in battle.
speak;Innes;I can always sense you trying to protect me at any cost.|Normally, I don’t need any help, but you are the exception.|I’m grateful for your help.
speak;Vanessa;Thank you very much!|It is my duty to protect you at any cost!
speak;Innes;Ha ha ha.|Your duty, huh.|That’s fine, Vanessa.|No need to worry about risking your life.|I’m pretty unstoppable with you beside me.
speak;Vanessa;You’ll have to use a spatula to peel me off your side!
speak;Vanessa;I’m sorry, Prince Innes!|Watching you shoot that arrow reminded me of something.

speak;Vanessa;The time you demonstrated your archery skills at the king’s birthday ceremony.|You shot three arrows simultaneously, and hit three different targets...|I was so impressed. I still remember that moment like it was yesterday.
speak;Innes;Well, even though there were three targets, they were only about an arm length apart.|It wasn’t like shooting three enemies in battle.|It’s only an exhibition trick.
speak;Vanessa;Even so, you couldn’t have done it without strong accuracy and concentration.|It made a very strong impression on me...|I’ve admired your skills ever since then.
speak;Innes;Vanessa...|Was it my skills you were admiring...|or was it me?
speak;Innes;Just kidding...|Kind of.|But I’m impressed you remembered it.|I had forgotten until just now.
speak;Vanessa;I have...always been watching you...|and always been admiring you...|I hope that doesn’t sound too creepy.

speak;Innes;I don’t know what to say...|I’ve always known you as a knight.|A great knight, in fact.|But when this war is over, I would like to get to know the other side of you.|The woman.|...Ahem.|Yes.|Let’s go, Vanessa.|Don’t ever leave my side from now on!
speak;Vanessa;Don’t worry, Prince Innes!|I would follow you anywhere!

name: SupportRossAndLute
_source: speak;Lute;I hope that maniac isn't talking to me.|I'll pretend I can't hear him.|La la la.
speak;Lute;Are you talking to me?|Firstly, my name isn't "Mage Woman," nor is it "You."|Why don't you lower your voice and act a little more civilized?|Who are you?
speak;Ross;I'm son of the warrior Garcia, Ross.

speak;Lute;So you're "Son-of-warrior-garcia-ross."|That's an unusual name.|I'm Lute, genius mage extraordinaire.|You've probably heard of me.|So, Sir Son-of-warrior-garcia-ross, how may I be of service to you?
speak;Ross;My name is ROSS!|You're kind of weird.|Hey, you can use magic, right?
speak;Lute;Yes, although to be more accurate, I don't just "use" magic.|I am a master of all magic.|Please don't make that mistake again.
speak;Lute;Well, maybe for you.|For me, I'm just that good.|It's normal.
speak;Ross;Isn't it hard to remember all those spells?
speak;Lute;Well, I think for the average person, it probably is a difficult task.|But for me, it is as simple as using a hint of fragrance when baking a cake.
speak;Ross;I...have no idea what you mean.|Wait a second!|Does that mean even I could learn magic?
speak;Ross;Hey!|At least pretend to ponder the question for a little bit before you answer.
speak;Ross;It's ROSS!|You left in the middle of the conversation!
speak;Lute;Thank you, but it's no big deal.
speak;Ross;That wasn't a compliment!|So, by the way...
speak;Ross;What the heck?|Hey, wait a minute!|I was telling you not to leave suddenly!
speak;Ross;Well, nothing in particular.|I just thought we could chat...or something.
speak;Lute;Well, THAT doesn't sound very productive nor strategically important, but...|If you want to, please go ahead.

speak;Ross;OK.|Um.|Let's see.|What to talk about.|You know, my mom used a little magic, too.|She passed away a while ago...|But, that's why I thought I might be able to use magic, too.|Last time, you said no right away, but you hadn't heard the whole story.
speak;Lute;Do you want to be a mage?
speak;Lute;Well, then you should keep following your own instinct instead.|Everyone has his or her own talent.|I figure the path you are taking now is appropriate for you.
speak;Ross;Yeah....|Maybe you're right.|Well, it's not like I was torn between the two or anything.|I kinda just wanted to talk with a female mage like you.|Thanks.
speak;Lute;Um, you're welcome, I guess.|I'm glad I could be of your service.
speak;Ross;Hey, you remembered my name finally!
speak;Lute;Are you here to insult me today?
speak;Ross;Where'd you get that from?!|You are as strange as ever.
speak;Ross;That wasn't a compliment!|Have you always been like this?
speak;Lute;You mean, have I always been brilliant?|Well, I've been me.|So, yes.|I've been surrounded by books for as long as I can remember.
speak;Ross;You studied magic since you were a kid?!|Did you do anything for fun?
speak;Ross;Huh?|Never mind.|How about your mother and father?
speak;Lute;I don't have any memory of my parents.|But according to my grandmother, they are traveling in distant lands.
speak;Ross;Oh...|So you have a grandmother.|What is she like?
speak;Lute;She's like an elegant goldfish that's been sun-dried with a wildflower.
speak;Ross;I have no idea what you're talking about.
speak;Ross;You may be a great mage, but you don't seem to be physically strong.|So, from now on...|Well...|I'll be at your side to protect you.
speak;Lute;Well, that's very kind.|But you know that the more likely scenario is that I'll be protecting you.
speak;Ross;That's not what you're supposed to say!|You're just supposed to say "Yes"!
speak;Ross;Man...|I might not seem that tough now, but someday I will grow up to be a man as strong as my dad.|You wait and see!
speak;Lute;OK.|I'll look forward to it.|But I won't get my hopes too high.|Disappointment is a cruel mistress.

name: SupportRossAndAmelia
_source: speak;Amelia;I'm so sorry!|I'm just very clumsy.|Are you all right?
speak;Ross;You!|You're from Grado, aren't you!|This was a sneak attack, wasn't it!|Then prepare yourself for battle!
speak;Amelia;Oh, no!|Please listen to me!|It's true that I am from Grado, but I am now on your side!
