speak;Artur;Th-thank you...|I mean it...|Sir Cormag, Genarog...|Wyvern stones are like dragonstones, only far more rare.|Mages covet them.|Having one focuses your powers, refines your magical control.|But nobody knows where they come from or how to craft them.|There are no more than a handful of wyvern stones in the world today.|I never thought I'd even see one, much less hold one in my hands.
speak;Cormag;So it's a big deal, eh?
speak;Artur;It most certainly is, Sir Cormag.|Genarog...|I can't thank you enough.|You've made one of my dreams come true.
speak;Cormag;I'm glad we were able to help you, Artur.
speak;Artur;I'll cherish this wyvern stone always.|...By the way, Sir Cormag, do you have a dream?
speak;Cormag;...My dream.|Hmph...|My only dream right now is to undo the damage Grado has done.|I want Grado to be a peaceful nation again, ruled by a gentle man.

speak;Artur;I'm sure you'll see your own dream realized, Sir Cormag.|After all, we're all fighting to make that dream come true.|You and Genarog have made my own dream a reality.|And you know that I'll do what I can to make yours real, too.
speak;Cormag;Genarog was right.|You are a good lad, Artur.|Tell you what.|If we do restore peace, you must visit my homeland.|And when you do, I think Genarog would like to take you flying.
speak;Artur;I'd love to, Sir Cormag.|I look forward to visiting Grado in better times.

name: SupportCormagAndTana
_source: speak;Cormag;Princess Tana!|That still sounds so odd to me.|You know, I had no idea you were a princess at first.|But please, just call me Cormag.|There's no need for honorifics with me.
speak;Tana;Cormag it is, then.|I had a favor to ask of you.
speak;Cormag;What would you have me do, Princess?
speak;Tana;I'm prone to attacks from archers when I'm on the battlefield...
speak;Cormag;That makes two of us.|It's a common problem for airborne soldiers.
speak;Tana;I thought perhaps we could keep watch for archers and warn one another.
speak;Cormag;Hm.|Yes, you've got a good idea there.|A “buddy system” of sorts.|But if you saw an ally in danger, you'd warn him regardless, wouldn't you?

speak;Tana;Well, of course!|But we're so high up that I was worried...|If I saw an archer, I didn't think my voice would carry to you in time.|Perhaps the neighing of a pegasus or the cries of a wyvern could carry far enough to warn the others.

speak;Cormag;Oh!|I see...|Yes, we might not be able to hear each other in the heat of battle.|But our steeds can be louder than either of us could.|And trust me, my wyvern's shriek can pierce your ear from two leagues away.|A brilliant idea, Your Highness.
speak;Cormag;Right, so if we see anything out there, we'll have our mounts call out, right?
speak;Tana;Cormag, thanks for warning me about that archer the other day.|Your wyvern startled me, but I think you may have saved my life!
speak;Cormag;Well, you should thank him, then.|I can't take credit for it.|I mean, he started shrieking out to you before I even saw that bowman.
speak;Cormag;The bond between a wyvern and rider is close, and this guy's a smart one.|I'm sure you and your pegasus are the same, wouldn't you say?

speak;Tana;Oh, yes.|It's the same with every knight and her pegasus.|It's so sad to see how war has changed the way we relate to our animal allies.|It's taking such a tremendous toll on these beautiful creatures.
speak;Cormag;I agree.|This whole war is ludicrous.|War itself is madness, even more so if it's for greed or the fantasy of power.
speak;Tana;I hope our efforts end this war quickly.|I don't want to see anyone else die.
speak;Cormag;Nor do I.|But you cannot race headlong into battle.|We'll need you to help rebuild our shattered nations, after all.|We soldiers are expendable, but you regal types aren't.
speak;Tana;Don't throw your life away.|Promise me, will you?
speak;Cormag;As you wish, Princess.|I'll be careful.
speak;Tana;What are you fighting for, Cormag?
speak;Tana;I saw you fighting earlier...|and for some reason, it made me sad.
speak;Cormag;I see.|I can think of many reasons why a man would fight.|Atonement, revenge, entertainment...|For power...|For fun...|But I don't know the reason I am fighting anymore.
speak;Cormag;What more would you expect from a man who's lost his faith?|A man whose emperor has gone mad, whose homeland is collapsing?
speak;Tana;What are you going to do when the war is over?
speak;Cormag;I'll help rebuild Grado, of course, but I'm not sure beyond that.|I doubt that I'll remain in Grado for long, though.|They've branded me a traitor.|I'll find no home awaiting me there.
speak;Tana;Then why don't you come to Frelia?|You can join us as an airborne knight!
speak;Cormag;And what makes you think a traitor like me would be welcomed in Frelia?

speak;Tana;You're no traitor, Cormag.|You've stayed true to your beliefs.|That sadness I saw in you comes from your own country's betrayal of those beliefs.|Your sadness runs as deep as your faith in Grado once ran.|I want your faith, your strength, and your passion to serve Frelia now.
speak;Cormag;I appreciate the offer, but I cannot reforge the oaths I've broken.|I'm sorry.
speak;Tana;It's all right.|I understand your feelings.|However, if you ever wish to serve your beliefs again, remember my offer.
speak;Cormag;I might just give up this soldiering nonsense and go into woodworking.
speak;Tana;Then I'll track you down in your woodshop and ask again.
speak;Cormag;You may not look it, but you're pretty strong willed for a princess.|I'll think about your offer.

name: SupportCormagAndDuessel
_source: speak;Cormag;I am as you see me.|Fine in every respect.
speak;Duessel;I'm not talking about your flesh.|It's your heart I'm worried for.

speak;Duessel;I'm here because I made the decision for myself to leave Grado.|Luckily for me, one of the leaders here is an old acquaintance of mine.|I'm not saying my heart is at ease, but I have found something to believe in.|Something to fight for.|And yet, you...
speak;Cormag;I, too, made a choice to be here.|There's no need for your concern.
speak;Cormag;I believe in myself.|Therefore it matters not where I am.|So no matter where I go or what I do, I'm sure my brother would understand.
speak;Cormag;And besides, General Duessel, you're here in this army with me.|There's no shame in fighting alongside the man once known as Obsidian.
speak;Duessel;Mm.|Cormag, let us emerge victorious from this war, for the things we both believe in.
speak;Duessel;Well met, Cormag.|I'm impressed by your skills.
speak;Cormag;They're still far below yours, General Duessel.|By the way, I have a favor I've been meaning to ask of you.
speak;Cormag;Your stories tell of a small lance you carry like a treasure.|May I see it?
speak;Duessel;Stories, you say?|Am I the subject of stories now?|Interesting.|Here is the lance you're talking about.|Examine it at your leisure.

speak;Duessel;Oh!|You've heard of Gavaleus, have you?|You must know quite a bit about the crafting of weapons.|This is one of Gavaleus's final works.|I have quite a collection of weapons, but this is among the most beautiful of them.|While it can be used in battle, I would never dull its shine with blood or dirt.|If I ever use this lance, I vow that it will be only in my own final hour.
speak;Cormag;It shines as though it could light up the soul of its wielder.|You're right.|I would hesitate to stain its beauty with blood, too.
speak;Duessel;Ah, so you grasp what I mean?|Cormag, you have a discerning eye.
speak;Cormag;Thank you.|And yet, I know that I will never be your equal, General Duessel.
speak;Duessel;Come, now.|You know, your brother asked to see this lance once as well.
speak;Duessel;Yes.|You two are so alike.|His comments mirror your own almost exactly.
speak;Duessel;For warriors, our weapons are our lives.|I'm glad to know you understand that.|Someday, you'll be a splendid wyvern knight to equal your brother.
speak;Duessel;Cormag...|I've something I want to show you.|Here it is.|This lance.|What do you think of it?
speak;Cormag;My!|It has such power!|It sends chills down my spine...|I am not nearly strong enough to wield a weapon such as this.

speak;Duessel;Hm, you think so?|Merely holding this lance makes me tremble with dread.|Not overly so, but enough to stop me from wielding it in combat.|This lance...|It can drive its wielder to madness.

speak;Duessel;Yes, Cormag.|It's a magic weapon of dark design that's been in my family for ages.|Legend states that the leader of our house must always carry it, but never use it.|We are prohibited from wielding it until such a time as madness itself rules the day.|It's part of my legacy, and yet...I...|I made a grave error...|I allowed Valter to use this lance.

speak;Duessel;Yes...|...We were in the middle of a battle.|Valter had broken his lance, and when I wasn't looking he somehow took this one.|From that moment, he was changed...|He killed everyone–even retreating men.|I took the lance from him when I realized what had happened, but it was too late.|Madness had awakened within Valter and was coursing through his body.|From then on, he hungered only for battle and for blood...|It's not as though Valter was a gentle lamb before, but now his appetite for violence increased many times over.|It's all because of this cursed lance.

speak;Cormag;That odd light playing around the point...|I thought it looked familiar.|It was Valter...|It's the same light Valter had in his eyes on the battlefield.|Valter's insane because of this lance.
speak;Cormag;Sir Duessel, if it please you, would you let me have this lance?
speak;Cormag;Are you worried that I will end up like Valter?

speak;Cormag;This lance–someone needs to master it.|It's just a feeling I have.|A weapon is only as good or evil as the man who wields it.|In the hands of someone just, it can be a righteous weapon.|In the hands of the wicked, it's a danger to all.|Believe me, I have not been seduced by this lance.|I merely want to see it used for the purpose for which it was forged.

speak;Duessel;I understand you, Cormag.|I'm going to let you have it.|I have no son.|I had not yet decided to whom I should pass on this legacy.|Now I see that leaving it to someone whom I trust and believe in is best.|As with me, your admiration of weapons is balanced by a healthy respect.|You also have a good eye, and you possess tremendous strength.|The day you are able to wield this lance may not be far off at all.|If the madness in this lance can be tamed, it may very well be a weapon without equal.|...I never had the courage to wield it, but I would love to see it used righteously.|...I am entrusting it to you.|I hope you will use it one day.

speak;Cormag;I accept your gift, Sir Duessel.|I would receive it once this battle is finished and our hearts are calmer.|If I were to take it in the heat of battle, I might become Valter the second.|It is a possibility that I cannot dismiss.
speak;Duessel;Yes, I see.|Cormag...|I'm counting on you.|I look forward to the day I can see this lance wielded correctly.
speak;Cormag;Understood.|Until that time comes, please try not to get yourself killed, General Duessel!

name: SupportEphraimAndMyrrh
_source: speak;Ephraim;Myrrh!|I'm happy to see you.|You're still so young.|Don't push yourself too hard today, all right?
speak;Myrrh;I won't...|I have a favor to ask.|Do you have time for me?
speak;Ephraim;Don't be nervous, Myrrh.|You can ask me anything.
speak;Myrrh;...I was watching you and Eirika together.|You looked so close.
speak;Ephraim;Of course we're close.|She is my sister, after all.
speak;Myrrh;I envy her.|I...wish that I had a brother like you.|That's why I ask...|Even if just for this journey...|Please be my brother.
speak;Ephraim;I don't know what to say...|I wasn't expecting you to ask anything like that...
speak;Myrrh;No...?|I'm sorry.|I should not have asked...
speak;Ephraim;Oh...|No, Myrrh...|Wait. I'm not saying no.
speak;Ephraim;Uhhh...|Sure.|Of course.|If it will make you happy.
speak;Myrrh;Yes...|It does.|I'll come speak with you again soon...Brother.
speak;Ephraim;Oh, my...|Eirika...|Myrrh...|How can I say no to that look?|I guess sisters are my weakness.
speak;Ephraim;Myrrh, don't you find that to be a little awkward?
speak;Ephraim;I mean...|You're a dragon, correct?|And if I'm right, you're also far older than I am...
speak;Myrrh;That's correct...|So, should I be your big sister?
speak;Ephraim;Well, that doesn't seem right, either.|You look so much younger than I do.|That would be odd...
speak;Ephraim;...Let's not dwell on this.|“Sister” will be fine.|Well.|Did you have something you wanted to ask me?
speak;Myrrh;I did...|You see, Brother, I have a favor to ask of you.
speak;Myrrh;In the forest...I was always with my father.|Even when I slept, he was there, watching over me.
speak;Myrrh;So...Brother.|Would you...stay with me at night and watch over me?
speak;Ephraim;No!|Myrrh, I understand your insecurity, but this simply is not acceptable.|Especially when we are on the march.

speak;Ephraim;Oh, don't look so sad.|When you see Eirika next, why don't you ask her?|I'm sure she will agree.|If you and I are brother and sister, then surely you and she are sisters, too.|How does that sound?
speak;Ephraim;Hey, Myrrh...|When this war is over...|What will you do?|Have you thought about where you will go?
speak;Myrrh;I've lived in Darkling Woods ever since I was a child.|I think that I shall spend the rest of my life there.
speak;Ephraim;On your own?|Do you have anyone waiting for you in the forest?
speak;Myrrh;I...|I am on my own now.|But you need not worry.|I am a dragon, after all.
speak;Ephraim;I've been thinking, Myrrh.|If you would like, you can live with us in Renais.
speak;Ephraim;When this war is over...|When we restore peace to Magvel...|Eirika and I will be going back to Renais to lead our people.|Would you like to live in the castle?|With us?
speak;Myrrh;Oh, but...|I would not want to inconvenience you.

speak;Ephraim;It's nothing you need worry about.|Castle Renais is a vast place.|I'm sure we could spare a room for a small girl like you.|And besides, you are my sister, right?|Family should stay together, don't you think?
speak;Myrrh;But...you must not forget that I am a dragon.|I must think about it.|I would love to, but...|perhaps I shouldn't, and so...|I must think about it.
speak;Myrrh;But...|Thank you for the offer.|It makes me very happy.|Thank you, Brother.

name: SupportEphraimAndLarachel
_source: speak;Larachel;Oh, Ephraim!|Why are you here?|Do you not have somewhere to be?
speak;Larachel;Why don't you go fight someone or break down a wall or something?
speak;Ephraim;We all have our roles to play in this battle.|I'm waiting for the right moment.
speak;Larachel;Are you speaking honestly with me?|Are you not simply making an excuse so that you have time to chat with me?
speak;Ephraim;...There's no glory in dragging out a war without good reason.
speak;Larachel;It does me good to hear that.|If you or any of your good men are injured, come to me at once.|I'll wait for you here, and I'll heal your wounds swiftly.
speak;Ephraim;Yes, well, that's why you're here, isn't it?|We're counting on you.|We fight with confidence only because we have your healing skills.
speak;Larachel;Naturally!|And today, I will serve you as well as I can, as always.|Watch for me!
speak;Ephraim;She seems so reliable...|and SO assertive!|Are women of Rausten all like that?

speak;Larachel;I've heard such interesting things about you from so many people.|I thought it best to ask directly.|You are a reckless man, are you not?|It seems an attitude unbefitting a commander, wouldn't you say?
speak;Ephraim;Don't speak to me that way.|If I can save a life by taking a risk myself, I'll do it.|This is war, and war is risky.|I have no problem with that.
speak;Larachel;...Oh, dear.|I'll bet your body is just covered with scars under that armor, isn't it?|I can heal them all for you.|Let me see them.
speak;Ephraim;I have to take my armor off if I'm going to show you the scar on my shoulder-
speak;Larachel;Cad!|Beast!|Pervert!|Devil!|I simply will NOT allow you to take advantage of me in my confused state!
speak;Ephraim;Conf- What!?|Wait, L'Arachel!|What about my scars...?
speak;Ephraim;L'Arachel...|You don't have to be so defensive.|Why don't you come talk to me?
speak;Larachel;...That depends.|You're not going to try to attack me again, are you?|You won't go ripping the armor from your...well-toned body, will you?
speak;Ephraim;L'Arachel...|That was all just a simple misunderstanding.|But I apologize if I offended your sensibilities in removing my armor.
speak;Larachel;Well, I suppose I can forgive you for this one indiscretion.|I wasn't prepared.|I've never seen a man's naked body before...
speak;Ephraim;Naked...|I was only showing you the scar on my shoulder, like you asked!
speak;Larachel;A naked shoulder is a big deal!|I was so shocked.|Why, I could hardly sleep at all that night!
speak;Ephraim;What's wrong, L'Arachel?|You seem different somehow.
speak;Larachel;N-no.|Everything is fine...|Please don't look at me in such a vulgar, leering way.|I find it very inappropriate.
speak;Ephraim;Oh, I'm sorry.|I had no idea.|I certainly would never-
speak;Larachel;What!?|Are you saying that you do not find me attractive?
speak;Ephraim;No!|I...|What do you want me to say?

speak;Larachel;How can you be so calm at a time like this?|Don't you see what you've done!?|Ahhhh!|I'm so frustrated!|Don't you ever forget this, Ephraim!|I hope that, someday, some girl comes along and gets YOU all rattled, too!
speak;Ephraim;...I just do NOT get her.|She is rather cute, though.

name: SupportEphraimAndDuessel
_source: speak;Duessel;Oh, Prince Ephraim.|Of course, my friend.
speak;Ephraim;I feel I should apologize for making you side against Grado in this.
speak;Duessel;Bah.|What nonsense!|Please, use me however you would to end this war.
speak;Ephraim;I want you to know how honored I am to fight at your side again.|Show me a little of your skill with the spear, like when you taught me.

speak;Duessel;Hmm...|Ephraim, your skills have grown significantly since then.|Why, the first time I met you, you could hardly hold a spear!|I couldn't even bring myself to lie and say you weren't THAT bad!
speak;Ephraim;...There's no need to be cruel!|I realized how helpless I was then.

speak;Duessel;Let me finish!|Even then, your strong will was most impressive.|On your first day wielding a spear, you chose to challenge ME!|I remember how enthusiastic your attack was.|You were determined to win.|But...you were destined to lose that day.|Still, I was quite shocked.|You weren't trying to learn my skill.|You were trying to steal it from me!|And I thought an apprentice was supposed to be obedient to his master.
speak;Ephraim;When you fight, you must respect your opponent, not obey him.|...Besides, you knocked me out so quickly, I hardly touched you.

speak;Duessel;I never dreamed of testing my skills against a prince of Renais.|After that match, though...|Oh, I changed my mind.|I knew it would be interesting to teach my skills to someone like you.
speak;Ephraim;Now, you're the one speaking nonsense!|Ah, I know...|Let's duel again after this battle!|I'm older now, better trained.|I'm sure I can beat you this time.
speak;Duessel;Hmmm...|Yes, fine.|I'd like to see if you've been keeping up with your training.
speak;Ephraim;Duessel, do you have a moment?
speak;Ephraim;...Were you thinking about Grado just now?|You looked distracted.|I wonder, was it the wrong decision to send you fighting against Grado?
speak;Duessel;...You've no need to worry.|My reasons for leaving Grado are my own.|It doesn't matter who I'm fighting.|My resolve won't be weakened.
speak;Ephraim;That is good to hear...|Actually, I'm here for a rematch.|I have no idea how you beat me last time, but this time, I can do it!

speak;Duessel;Hmm.|It looks like you haven't learned your lesson yet.|You know, they used to call me Obsidian.|I was one of the Imperial Three.|I'm not about to let a young punk like you best me at the spear!
speak;Duessel;Nicely done, Ephraim.|There's nothing left for me to teach you, it seems.

speak;Ephraim;That's utter nonsense.|I still have much to learn from you, Duessel.|I intend to be the greatest spearman Magvel has ever known.|I gave up on swords after seeing how they fare against spears.|Sword, axe, spear, bow...and even magic.|I've seen them all.|The spear always comes out on top.|And I want mine to be the best spear around.
speak;Duessel;Hm...|That's a bold statement.|But you may yet be the one who can prove it true, lad.
speak;Ephraim;...I thank you, Duessel.|It's only because of the skills you gave me that I'm alive and here now.|Our countries were friends, but you taught me like family...

speak;Duessel;I am a warrior.|All I can do is improve my skills and pass them on to a student.|And if you best me using the skills that I taught you, well...|That's just the nature of war.|The young surpass the old.|And I am glad to be fighting at the side of such a worthy student.
speak;Duessel;I know that I've been branded a traitor.|I'm prepared for that.|But I do have one regret...|I regret that I betrayed my emperor...

speak;Ephraim;You never betrayed him.|You remain as loyal to him now as when you swore your oaths.|No, it is Grado who has betrayed the ideals it once held dear.|And now, as then, you are my teacher.|Nothing has changed.|No, you are no traitor.|If anything, you are the last true man of Grado.

speak;Duessel;Ephraim...|Hm...|Yes.|A student should not inspire his teacher.|Ephraim.|Be strong.|Remain true.|Believe in yourself, and act in accordance with your beliefs.|...No matter what happens, be a strong king.

speak;Ephraim;Yes, you needn't worry about that.|Such has been my intention since the day I first held this spear.|No matter what the future holds...|I'm never going to change.|I will let my faith and my beliefs drive my every action as king.

name: SupportEphraimAndTana
_source: speak;Tana;Oh, Ephraim!|I'm so glad to see you.
speak;Ephraim;Tana, you should pull back to a safer location.|What would we do if you were attacked by archers?
speak;Tana;But...I want to go where you go.|I feel safer when I'm close to you, Ephraim.
speak;Ephraim;I'm sorry, but I won't be able to protect you if I get into a duel.|I have to focus on fighting our enemies.
speak;Tana;Oh, no...|Please, Ephraim, don't speak to me like that.|I've trained with Frelia's finest pegasus knights.|I can fight, too!
speak;Tana;I'm sorry if I've been following you too closely lately...|But I promise that I won't be a burden.|I'll work my hardest.|So, please!|Don't make me stay behind and wait for you.
speak;Ephraim;Tana...|All right.|If it's what you want.|We'll go together.
speak;Tana;Ephraim, do you remember when we first met?
speak;Ephraim;...Ah, of course!|It was at Castle Frelia, wasn't it?|Eirika and I had been invited to visit for your birthday celebration.
speak;Tana;Oh, I'm so glad you remembered!
speak;Ephraim;King Hayden seemed so delighted that we'd come to visit.|I think that was the first time I met Innes, too.
speak;Tana;So, Ephraim, what did you think of the dress I was wearing?

speak;Ephraim;I...|Hm...|I'm sorry, but I don't think I got a good look at it at the time.|Perhaps you don't remember, but as soon as I arrived, Innes challenged me.|We ended up having an archery match right when the party began.|I think Innes won that match.
speak;Tana;Do you remember my hair?|I was so happy with it!
speak;Ephraim;Your...hair?|Uh...|Well, right after our archery match, Innes challenged me to the spear.|I think I won that match!
speak;Tana;I'll bet you don't even remember what I said afterward!
speak;Ephraim;Er, Innes can be persistent.|After spears, we moved on to jousting.|That time, I think it was...
speak;Tana;Oh, you!|You only remember what happened with my brother!|You don't care about me at all, do you!?
speak;Ephraim;Oh, no, no!|That's not true.|It's just...
speak;Tana;Fine!|Why should I care about you when you can't even be bothered to care about me?|You just keep having fun with my brother and don't pay me any mind at all!
speak;Ephraim;Tana, wait a minute!|Hey!|Don't go off on your own!|...What is she so upset about?
speak;Tana;Hello, Ephraim.|Shall we take a break together?
speak;Ephraim;Well, you're in a better mood today!
speak;Ephraim;Oh, nothing.|Never mind.|So, uh, what can I do for you?
speak;Tana;Eirika helped me prepare lunch.|I haven't tried it yet, but I'm sure it's delicious.|Would you like to eat with me?
speak;Ephraim;...Tana.|This is a battlefield.|It's all right to take a break, but let's not let our guards down.
speak;Tana;You're always like that.|You're so stiff and formal and detached all the time.
speak;Ephraim;Tana...|What's the matter with you?|You've been acting so odd lately.
speak;Tana;Yes, I am acting funny.|And it's all your fault, Ephraim!|Whenever I try to talk to you, you always keep your distance!|No matter how hard I try, you never open up to me.
speak;Tana;It's just...|You never pay any attention to me.|You never have...|It makes me so sad.|All I want to do is be near you more and more.
speak;Ephraim;Tana, you're still just a child at heart, aren't you?
speak;Tana;Ephraim!|Don't talk about me like that...
speak;Ephraim;No, I meant it as a compliment.|Because you're so young, your words have such a simple, honest purity...|I do appreciate your affection.
speak;Tana;Ephraim...|Do you think you could make more time for me, so we can chat?
speak;Ephraim;Yes...of course.|But we don't have the luxury to stop and chat on the battlefield.|We have an obligation to end this war first.|Let's go.
speak;Tana;Yes, all right.|I'll see you later.|I'm looking forward to it.

name: SupportAmeliaAndEwan
_source: speak;Amelia;Hi, Ewan.|It's nice to meet you.|So, are you fighting with us?
speak;Amelia;Really?|You look like you're only about my age.|That's neat.
speak;Ewan;Ha ha!|Ah, I'm nothing special compared to my teacher.|You want to see some magic?
speak;Ewan;Oh, don't worry.|Magic isn't just for combat.|For example...|Voila!|It can do stuff like this!
speak;Amelia;Wow...|They're so pretty!|All those little lights, spinning around together...|Is this really magic?
speak;Ewan;This?|This is magic used to make girls happy.
speak;Ewan;You should show me how good you are with your lance sometime.
speak;Amelia;Huh?|Um, all right.|But...|I'm sure you'd be bored.
speak;Ewan;That's not true.|And even if it were, it's simply a matter of how you make it fun.
speak;Ewan;Uh-huh.|Like this war, for example.|Well, Amelia, I'll see you later!
speak;Amelia;Ewan sure moves at his own pace...|How you make it fun?|Hmm...|That seems like a good rule to live by, when you think about it.
speak;Amelia;Whew.|This looks like a good place to take a break.
speak;Amelia;Ah! Ewan?|Why did you do that?|I thought you were one of the enemy!
speak;Ewan;Ha ha ha.|We talked about this, remember?|How you make it fun?|I just wanted to make our meeting here a little more fun.
speak;Amelia;Well, it wasn't fun for me at all.
speak;Ewan;Ha ha ha.|Oh, yeah, Amelia?|Do you remember you promised to show me your lance work?
speak;Ewan;You're good, Amelia.|You're as good as any of the other knights.
speak;Amelia;Do you mean that?|Whew...|To be honest, I have been practicing even harder lately.|But it was all worth it to hear you say that.|Thanks.
speak;Ewan;Really?|No, thank you.|I like your outfit, too.
speak;Amelia;Huh?|Oh, I get it.|You're teasing me again, aren't you, Ewan?|What was it, again?|“Making things fun”?
speak;Ewan;Ha ha ha.|No, that's not at all what I was doing.
speak;Amelia;Hmm...|I'm not sure I should believe you.
speak;Ewan;Ha ha ha.|Princess Eirika has a similar outfit.|Is that a popular style?
speak;Amelia;Um...I don't know.|But it's easy to move in, so...
speak;Ewan;I see.|I think it's cute.|Especially that stain right there.
speak;Amelia;Travel?|Hm, let's see...|I went from Silva to the capital on my own once.|Now that I think about it, I'd never left Grado until now.
speak;Ewan;Oh, really?|My teacher-he's the great sage Saleh from Caer Pelyn-|took me out on a training journey for many months once.
speak;Ewan;Lots of different places across Magvel.|We went to Renais, Frelia, Rausten, and Jehanna.|Oh, and we went to Grado, too.
speak;Ewan;Yeah, it was a lot of fun!|There were so many new things to see.|Say, Amelia, I just had an idea...
speak;Ewan;When this war is over and we're all at peace, why don't you and I take a trip together?
speak;Ewan;Sure, why not?|Does the idea bother you?

speak;Ewan;There's so much I want to show you, Amelia.|How the dark green forests refract the morning sun into a million burning emeralds.|The melancholy spectacle of the sun sinking slowly beyond an endless horizon.|The wind gently coercing vast fields of wheat to dance, heroic mountain peaks...|Oh, and the gorgeous flower beds that fill your vision with brilliant colors!|There are so very many spectacular places in the world.|I want to see all of them again...but this time I want to see them with you.|When you see them, you'll really understand how wonderful it is to be alive.|The feeling will fill your heart and make you want to sing with joy!
speak;Amelia;But I understand what you're trying to say, and yes.|Let's go!|I want to see all of it and more!
speak;Ewan;Great!|Then it's settled.|You know what?|This gives us something to look forward to while this war goes on.|Just thinking about it makes my heart beat faster.
speak;Amelia;Ha ha.|You know, Ewan, being around you fills me with so much energy.
speak;Ewan;And I'm happy when you're around, too.
speak;Amelia;I'm looking forward to our trip.|It's one more reason for us to work quickly to put an end to this war.
speak;Ewan;Yeah, let's do what we can, because we're definitely taking that trip!

name: SupportAmeliaAndDuessel
_source: speak;Amelia;Yes!|Oh, but you're not injured at all, are you, General Duessel?|We've all been struggling so hard, and yet you don't seem tired at all.|You are an impressive man.|It's all I can do simply to stay alive out here, it feels like.
speak;Amelia;What is it?|General Duessel?|Is something wrong?
speak;Duessel;Oh, um, sorry.|Your...|From the first time I laid eyes upon you, your face...|I was sure I'd seen it before...
speak;Amelia;Huh?|Is that so?|You mean before now?|Or before I even joined Grado's army?
speak;Duessel;Yes, that's right, but I can't recall...|Getting to be my age has its price.
speak;Amelia;Don't be silly!|I happen to think you're still quite young, General Duessel!
speak;Duessel;Well, now you've got my attention!|What was it you wanted this old soldier for?
speak;Amelia;It's just that, even among the younger knights, there's no match for you.|And, uh...
speak;Duessel;Ha ha!|I'm not so old that you need to worry about propping up my ego, lass.
speak;Duessel;No, no.|There's no need to apologize.|I quite enjoy talking to you, in fact.

speak;Duessel;I'm sure I'm not the only one in this army who feels that way, either.|The fighting's fierce, Amelia.|You watch yourself!|When you're near me, I'll make sure I keep a good eye out for you, too.|I'll be there in a flash if you need me.|Go ahead and fight without worry.
speak;Amelia;Ah, y-yes, sir!|Thank you very much.|Fighting alongside you, General Duessel, is a great honor.|Well, I'll be moving on now.
speak;Duessel;It seems like you've grown quite comfortable with the spear.

speak;Duessel;You did well to choose the spear as your weapon.|It suits your height well.|It also extends your reach and enables you to strike with force.|More force, even, than a sword could bring to bear in a battle.|All weapons have their own unique characteristics.|You're familiar with the idea that some weapons are strong against others?
speak;Amelia;Isn't that what they call...|the weapon triangle?
speak;Duessel;Yes, it is.|And from the looks of things, your affinity for the spear is quite good.|If you continue to practice, you should continue to improve and grow stronger.
speak;Duessel;Mm.|To begin with, the spear is quite a deep weapon...|Yet the attacks comprise three surprisingly simple movements.|Right step, left step, and thrust.
speak;Amelia;Right step, left step, and thrust...|I'm following you.

speak;Duessel;Because they are so simple, they are easy to learn but tough to perfect.|They are the strongest and most pure of techniques.|When you practice them, practice perfecting each gesture.|And remember, the spear is a subtle and powerful weapon.

speak;Duessel;Now it goes without saying that other weapons have their good points, too.|Swords are easy-to-use, all-purpose weapons, and axes possess devastating strength.|You should learn to use each weapon type.|If you can master them all, you'll be an unstoppable force.|That is, of course, if you can overcome your own natural affinities.|To begin with, you should work on mastering one weapon type.|Then you can gradually change weapons until you can use them all.|That's what I have done, you understand.|That's called being multi-proficient.|I'd like to tell you more about different weapons, but that lecture must wait.
speak;Amelia;...Wow...|General Duessel, you know so much about weapons, don't you?|I didn't even realize how caught up I'd become.|All right!
speak;Duessel;What is it?|Where are you rushing off to?
speak;Amelia;I want to practice the things you've told me about.|The basics-right, left, thrust.|Right?
speak;Duessel;Mm, that's correct.|But...|I'm happy to see you so enthused, but do you have any reason to rush so?
speak;Amelia;Um, well...|There's someone-one of the Knights of Renais-to whom I do not want to lose.
speak;Amelia;It's not that we're going to fight, or that I want to defeat him or anything...|It's just that we're kind of keeping track of the other's progress, and...|It's just a thing we do.
speak;Duessel;I see.|I think that should prove to be a good source of motivation then.|Get to it.
speak;Amelia;Yes, sir!|Oh...I think I'll, um, go and practice over there...|I'd be nervous in front of you, so I'm going to practice on my own.|I'll be back to show you later.
speak;Duessel;Ha ha...|Such energy.|I feel energized just being around her.|She's just a girl now, but someday she'll be a woman of grace and beauty.|...Oh, that face...where have I...
speak;Duessel;Wait...could it be?|Yes!|I remember now!|That's definitely it.|Amelia!|Amelia!|Where could she-
speak;Duessel;I've been looking for you.|And now I've found you.
speak;Amelia;Um, wh-what's happened?|I've never seen you in such a rush.
speak;Duessel;There's something I'd like to ask-|No, something I'd like to tell you.
speak;Duessel;I remembered.|I told you that I thought I'd seen your face before, didn't I?
speak;Amelia;Oh, is that it?|Please don't keep me waiting, tell me.
speak;Amelia;When I was just a child, she was stolen away by bandits.|My father had already passed away, so I was totally...sniff...
speak;Amelia;I was left...|all on my own...
speak;Duessel;I was right...|You can rest easy, Amelia.|Your mother is alive and well.

speak;Duessel;It happened a few years back.|I was leading a patrol near the Grado border.|We unexpectedly rode up on a group of bandits, and a battle ensued.|When we had taken care of the bandits, we rescued a lone female captive.|We figured she had been taken from some village, but she was in shock.|In fact, her distress was so great, she had forgotten much about herself.|Her body was in such a weakened state that she could barely walk.|We felt such pity for her that we took her to a peaceful village we knew of.|There, we set up a home for her where she could recover and live quietly.|Some years later, she was restored to her former vitality.|Slowly, she began to recall the lost memories of her past.|Only recently did she remember that she had once had a daughter.|I took time off from my duties and visited the village where she had lived.|But the villagers told me her daughter had left the village some time ago.|With no clues as to the girl's whereabouts, I'd almost given up hope of finding her.|And then, in the strangest of places...
speak;Amelia;I-it can't be!|Th-that woman...|What is her name?
speak;Duessel;Her name is Melina...|Amelia, she's your mother.
speak;Duessel;Yes, I am.|I see Melina's face reflected in your own.|There's no mistake.|Isn't it wonderful, Amelia?
speak;Duessel;I, uh, I'm so happy for you, Amelia...|Sniff...|Oh, no.
speak;Duessel;Old age must have loosened these dry, old tear ducts...|Sniff...sniff...

name: SupportArturAndTethys
_source: speak;Tethys;Yes, that's right.|Come here for a moment.|I won't bite.
speak;Artur;How may I help you, my lady?
speak;Tethys;Would you spin yourself around right there?
speak;Tethys;Hm...|Not bad.|Not bad at all.|You have a graceful form.|And you're quite beautiful.|It'd be a waste to let you stay a simple clergyman.
speak;Tethys;Yes, you have a lovely face.|Say...|Would you like to dance with me?|I think you have the potential.|I could use a partner.|When this war ends, I think it should be you.
speak;Artur;I...don't know about that.|Dancing probably isn't my thing.
speak;Tethys;You never know until you try.|Anyway, from what I can see, I think you've got what it takes.|Trust me.|There's no future in this church business.|Be a dancer.
speak;Artur;I'm afraid I have to disagree.|I feel this is my calling, you see.|Er...|If that's all you wanted, would you excuse me?
speak;Tethys;Oh, oh.|Yes, fine.|Only...|What's your name, child?
speak;Tethys;That's right.|I'll see you later, child.|Think about what I told you about becoming a dancer, won't you?
speak;Artur;I really don't think it's for me...
speak;Tethys;Do you remember the dance steps I showed you the other day, child?|No?|I'll show them to you again.|Pay attention, as you'll be going next.
speak;Artur;Tethys, we're in the middle of a battle.|Can't this wait until later?
speak;Tethys;My, aren't we confident!|No, we can't have that.|We have to practice.|I refuse to have a partner who's too lazy to practice daily.
speak;Artur;No, you're not following me.|I'm not your partner.|I don't want to-|Would you please stop calling me “child” in front of everyone!
speak;Tethys;What's wrong with looking young?|After all, you have such lovely skin.|May I...touch your cheeks?
speak;Artur;Oh...|Ah, normally, people wait for an answer before they start...er...|well, touching me.|Um...|Would you please stop?
speak;Tethys;Amazing!|It's like velvet to the touch!|You have such smooth skin!
speak;Artur;I...|I don't have any secrets!|Oh...|You meant my skin.|Well, I just rub manon leaves on after I wash.

speak;Tethys;Manon leaves?|Those scratchy things?|I always thought they would just leave a rash.|Hm.|Maybe I should try...|I'll see you later, child.|I'll be checking up on your progress, so be sure to practice those steps.
speak;Artur;But I don't want to be a dancer...|I...|*Sigh*...
speak;Tethys;Well, look who's come to see me!|I'm glad to see you showing some initiative.|You must be practicing a lot, hm?|Well, show me what you've got!
speak;Artur;Please!|I have a name!|I am not a child!|My name is Artur!|And...I really must protest about becoming a dancer.|I have no interest in learning how to dance, do you understand?
speak;Tethys;I'm glad you're here, because I have something I wanted to tell you.
speak;Tethys;I scrubbed my face with manon leaves, just like you said, but look...|I got a rash, just like I thought I would.|Look here, on my cheek.
speak;Artur;I'm not sure this is the right time.|We're in the middle of a battle.
speak;Tethys;We'll be fine.|It'll only take a second.|We'll be done in a flash.
speak;Tethys;Come on, you're not looking right.|Get closer.|Closer...|More.|Look right around here...|See?|It's red, isn't it?
speak;Artur;...A little, but...it's not that bad.
speak;Artur;I-if you turn your head so suddenly like that...your face is...|It's so close to my...
speak;Tethys;Hm mm mm.|You're blushing.|Are you all right, child?
speak;Artur;I-I'm fine, but...|Every time you're around, my heart...
speak;Tethys;To tell you the truth, you look just like my first love.
speak;Tethys;But he moved, and I never saw him again.|Oh, it brings back such memories...|He and I couldn't have been much older than, say, ten.
speak;Artur;...Are you telling me I look like a ten-year-old child?
speak;Tethys;Yep.|Those sparkling eyes are totally him.
speak;Artur;I see...|I know someone who looks like you, too.
speak;Artur;...My mother.|She called me “child” when I was little, just like you do now.|I used to like that then, but now that I'm older...
speak;Tethys;...Oh...|A bit of a mama's boy, are you, Artur?
speak;Tethys;Tee-hee...|Very well. I shall mother you.|Call me “mom,” child.
speak;Artur;Er...|I...|I'm not sure about this.|Besides, I used to call her “mother,” not “mom,” so...

speak;Tethys;I'm only kidding.|I just love teasing you.|However, I am serious about you becoming a dancer.|Your good looks and graceful movement tell me you have the talent...|You would make a fine partner.|Just think about it, will you?
speak;Artur;Oh, I forgot-that's what I wanted to talk to you about.|I don't want to-
speak;Artur;...Er, excuse me.|Tethys, would you wait up for me!?

name: SupportArturAndJoshua
_source: speak;Artur;Yes.|I came from Renais.|My name is Artur.
speak;Joshua;I'm Joshua.|So, uh...|You want to make me a bet?
speak;Joshua;Sure!|Call it in the air.|Heads or tails?
speak;Joshua;What's the matter?|All you have to do is say heads or tails.|So what's your call?
speak;Artur;I have no idea what this is about, but I'll say heads for now.
speak;Joshua;Right, so I get tails.|Here, we'll flip now.|Annnnnnd...|Right!|Tails.|I win.
speak;Joshua;Well, now, you have to do whatever I tell you.
speak;Joshua;You lost, right?|Since you lost, you've got to do what I tell you.|So when this battle's over, I want you to train with me.
speak;Artur;Train?|What are you talking about?|Look, I only said heads because you pressed me to!|I don't remember you saying anything about what we were betting on.

speak;Joshua;You shouldn't worry so much about the tiny details!|You'll waste your life, worrying so much!|Now, about that training.|I always have a tough time fighting against people who use magic.|I think it's got something to do with getting the timing right...|I don't really need to polish my technique too much.|However, I've noticed that these battles just keep getting harder.|So, I figured I should train with someone who can use a little magic!
speak;Artur;I commend your attitude, but I really can't help you...|My evenings are pretty full as it is, so...
speak;Joshua;Hey, now!|A deal's a deal.|I'll be waiting, so don't be late!
speak;Artur;Fine...|But just for a little while!
speak;Joshua;Hey, Artur.|I wanted to thank you for training.|I learned a lot from it.|I hope you're not too exhausted for today's training session.
speak;Artur;Well, actually...|Could we not do this today?
speak;Joshua;Hey, now.|Show a little enthusiasm, why don't you?|An attitude like that ain't gonna win you any battles!

speak;Artur;You may be right, but I just can't keep up with you.|If you keep exhausting me in training, I'll be no good when the real fighting begins.|I'm trying not to let it show, but I'm really worn out today.
speak;Joshua;Then let's make a bet.|If I win, you do what I tell you.
speak;Artur;Joshua, I'm quite drained, and we still have much fighting to do.|You should just rest tonight.
speak;Joshua;Don't worry about me, Artur.|So, heads or tails?
speak;Joshua;Great!|You're heads, and I'm tails.|Here we go!|Incredible!|Tails!|I win again!
speak;Joshua;What for?|Are you suggesting that I would actually cheat?
speak;Joshua;So it's a deal.|I'll be waiting for you tonight.|Don't forget!
speak;Joshua;...You're hopeless.|Don't look so tired.|It gets me all worried, and I can't go back to the front being all worried.|Listen, just take a day off.|Get some rest, all right?
speak;Joshua;The deal was, if I win, you do what I tell you.|And what I'm telling you to do is take it easy.

speak;Artur;Joshua...|I appreciate it.|I've never done much fighting.|I think I'm just worn out.|It's exhausting, having to keep your guard up all the time.|But your kindness has rejuvenated my frazzled nerves a little.
speak;Joshua;Well, we're still fighting, so don't let your guard down.|Stick close to me today, and I'll watch over you.|But don't skip tomorrow's training!
speak;Joshua;Hey, Artur!|You're looking pretty pleased with yourself today.|Care to make a bet?|If I win, we'll hit the training again tonight.
speak;Artur;No need for bets, Joshua.|I'll be happy to train with you.
speak;Joshua;You're volunteering?|Are you feeling all right?|Did you take a blow to the head?
speak;Artur;No, no.|I'm fine.|I'm just offering to help you out.|It's easier than losing another bet to you.
speak;Joshua;What do you mean?|You've got even odds of winning.

speak;Artur;You must be joking!|Out of the past 21 coin flips, I've won two, and you've won 19!|Those are impossible odds to beat, so there's only one answer.|You must have some divine betting power or something.|If I can help you train, I will, but I don't want to lose anymore.
speak;Joshua;Hmph...|But that's no fun!|All right, you don't have to train with me if you don't want to bet.
speak;Joshua;I don't have any divine power.|You've won 11 out of 21 coin tosses so far.|We're about even.|I was...cheating.|Just a little, though.
speak;Artur;You cheated?|I felt so guilty when I accused you earlier.|I guess I just trusted-

speak;Joshua;Yep.|That's your problem.|I know trust and faith are important to you monkly types.|However, on the battlefield, you can never trust your foe.|If we were gambling for your life, and not for training, you'd be dead 19 times over.|Well, I mean, you can only die once, but you get my drift.
speak;Joshua;Ha ha ha.|Good thing I'm a reasonably fair man, huh?|No harm done, and you even learned a little something, didn't you?
speak;Joshua;So here's the deal.|I want you to keep being my partner.|But this time, I'll be teaching you a little bit about wagers.
speak;Artur;What's more important to you, Joshua?|Gambling or training?|I guess I don't even have to ask you that, huh?|But no more cheating!

name: SupportGerikAndJoshua
_source: speak;Joshua;You're Gerik, right?|Head of that band of mercenaries?
speak;Gerik;Where's your respect?|I've got a title.|Use it.
speak;Joshua;Oh...|My mistake.|Pardon me.|I'm Joshua.|I heard you once commanded a band of over a hundred mercenaries.|I've been wanting to talk to you.
speak;Gerik;Huh.|So that's what you've heard, is it?|You look a bit on the rough side.|Yeah, I can see it in your eyes.|You're no ordinary swordsman, are you?
speak;Joshua;...It's just like they said.|You're a natural leader.|Commanding and observant-it's a rare combination.
speak;Gerik;Ah, thanks.|So what brings you over here, anyway?|Didn't just come here to say hello, did you?
speak;Gerik;Not half as sharp as your sword, from what I've seen out there.

speak;Joshua;Actually, I'm here with an offer, but I didn't want to rush into it.|I'd hate to mess this one up.|I can't go into the details just now, but it's a big job.|I'm guessing it'll pay pretty well, too.
speak;Gerik;I see.|Well, you have me curious.|I'm looking forward to hearing your offer.
speak;Gerik;Is that you, Joshua?|So, I hear you like to gamble.
speak;Joshua;You hear right.|Care to try your luck?
speak;Gerik;Ha ha ha.|I'll pass.|But tell me, why do you like gambling so much?
speak;Joshua;I've got my reasons.|Mostly, I just like to believe in my own luck.

speak;Joshua;Oh, yeah...|See, you can have all the skill in the world and still have a bad day.|It doesn't take much for the most fortunate man around to have a fall.|A royal family at the height of their power gets betrayed, and that's the end.|It's life really, innit?

speak;Gerik;Hmm...|You've got a point there.|But you know, Joshua, you don't want to use luck as an excuse.|Don't blame luck if you lose a fight.|Blame yourself, but not luck.|Renais didn't fall because of bad fortune.|It was malice that did it.|You're right-there's good luck and bad, but it's no excuse for failure.
speak;Joshua;Well, that's a good point you've got there.|But I think I'll just keep believing in my luck for now.

speak;Gerik;Whatever works for you.|If you're an even match against someone, sure, luck is a factor.|But you're not counting on luck alone, are you?|You're a fine swordsman, and that isn't all luck's doing there.
speak;Joshua;You are far too observant.|We're lucky you're on our side.
speak;Gerik;That's the best compliment a mercenary can get.
speak;Joshua;Call it a hunch, but I think this is the start of a long friendship.
speak;Gerik;You think so, huh?|I wonder if that's just a lucky guess.
speak;Gerik;Hey, Joshua, I don't mind a little friendly gambling with my men, but would you mind not fleecing them too much?|It's demoralizing.

speak;Joshua;Hm?|Oh, you're talking about those guys?|Man!|They wore me out!|They just kept losing and losing and losing, and they still wouldn't give up!|If they'll risk so much on a bet, they might risk too much in a battle.|You're their commander.|You should have a word with them.
speak;Gerik;Ha ha ha...|Good point.|I'll talk to the boys.|But, Joshua...|I'm going to have to win back the money that you took from my men.
speak;Joshua;It's about time!|I've been waiting for you to put the challenge to me.
speak;Gerik;Oh, I'll do more than just challenge you.
speak;Joshua;So if you win, I'll cough up your men's money.|And if I win...
speak;Gerik;What's it going to be?|Come on, out with it.
speak;Joshua;I want you to join me when this war is over.

speak;Gerik;...That's all you want?|Well, it doesn't sound like your standard mercenary assignment, but you've piqued my interest.|This sounds like a big bet.|I'm not sure I get what you're after in all this, but...|Fine.|You've got a bet.
speak;Joshua;Great, then let's go...|How 'bout we flip a coin?
speak;Gerik;That's it?|I'm wagering my life on a coin toss?|Eh, why not?|Flip it.
speak;Joshua;Which leaves me with tails.|...Here it goes...|Hup!
speak;Joshua;...Ready to see what it is?
speak;Gerik;I won.|Now, let me have the men's money back.
speak;Gerik;I sure did.|But you cheated.|Open your left hand.|There-you palmed the coin and swapped in a fake one.
speak;Joshua;You ARE observant.|Not a lot of people can see through that.|You're right.|You win.|Here, I'll give you back the money.
speak;Gerik;Ha ha ha.|Thanks, Joshua.|I'll get this back to the men.
speak;Joshua;Mind if I ask how you found me out?|I like to think I've gotten pretty good at that trick.
speak;Gerik;Before I became a mercenary, gambling was my one true love in life.|I've had to learn how to see through a LOT of tricks in my day.
speak;Joshua;So, wait...|You just pretended not to be interested in gambling?|You're really something.|You pulled a fast one on me.|Today's not my-
speak;Gerik;Not your lucky day?|Don't say that, Joshua.|You were just out of your league is all.
speak;Joshua;I'm starting to think maybe I was.|But then again, maybe not...|Maybe today was just YOUR lucky day.
speak;Gerik;Ha ha ha...|I like your enthusiasm.|And I'm glad you appreciate my gambling prowess.
speak;Joshua;I haven't given up on you yet.|When this war is over, let's have us a quick duel.|If I win, you come work for me.
speak;Gerik;You're on.|Just make sure you stay alive until then.

name: SupportGerikAndTethys
_source: speak;Tethys;Oh, Chief.|Things are as fine as one could expect.|But I've been dancing so much I've worked up quite a sweat.|At this rate I may even lose a few inches off of my waistline.|Who knows, maybe my figure will be even more alluring than before.
speak;Gerik;Ha ha ha!|Well, I'm not sure that's even possible, but keep up the good work.|Your dancing has had quite a restorative effect on the troops.
speak;Tethys;Really?|I'm happy to hear it.|I must keep dancing then, mustn't I?|Oh, I almost forgot, Chief.|I have good news, and then I have better news.
speak;Tethys;I hear today's meal is one of your favorites, herbed stew.
speak;Gerik;Oh, that is good news!|It's been quite a while since I've had any.|And the even better news?
speak;Tethys;In this next battle, you'll get your hands on some sort of an incredible treasure.
speak;Tethys;Yes, that's right, some sort of treasure.
speak;Gerik;Ha ha ha!|I see.|I don't know what it might be, but I can't wait for it.|Nor for today's meal.
speak;Tethys;I'm going to continue dancing a bit longer so as to work up a healthy appetite.
speak;Gerik;So tell me, Tethys, when did you first start dancing?
speak;Tethys;Um, well...|Yes, it was long ago.|Back when Ewan was still young.
speak;Tethys;...I'm sorry, Chief.|I'll explain it another time.|Can we drop it for now?
speak;Tethys;Chief.|The truth is, Ewan and I?|We were abandoned by our parents.
speak;Tethys;Um...|I wandered about with little Ewan in tow.|He had no idea what was happening.|I was a child myself with no job.|We went to bed hungry every night, and our clothes were rags...

speak;Tethys;Then one day I said to myself, "We cannot go on like this!"|I watched a dancer on a street corner and memorized all of her moves.|I wasn't a very coordinated child and it was so difficult.|I didn't have real shoes, so my feet were a mess of blisters, and I fell so many times I was covered in cuts and bruises.|It was painful.|And miserable. And very, very difficult.|But I never cried.|Because if were to cry, he would cry.|And I loved seeing Ewan's smiling face.|I wanted him to smile all the time, so I worked hard so he could.

speak;Tethys;Tee hee hee.|What a sad and miserable tale.|I'm sorry.|I was reminded of it all just recently, and I was overcome with emotion...|But that's how I earned the dancing skills and physique I have now!|All of the hard work I did back then has made me the woman I am today.|What do you say to that?
speak;Gerik;I'm not sure what to say.|So before you met up with us, the two of you had a rough time of it, did you?

speak;Tethys;OK, that's enough.|The past is the past!|You mustn't tell anyone about this.|I don't share this story with others.|I only told you because you're the chief.|A story of toil and hardship doesn't quite fit my mysterious image, does it?|You know what I'd like?|For you to tell me more about you.
speak;Tethys;All right.|Let's see this thing through to the end.|If we do our best, good things will come of it.|And then better things after that.|Right, Chief?
speak;Tethys;Um, Chief, there's actually one thing I've been wanting to ask you.
speak;Tethys;Sorry if this brings up any bad memories, but how'd you get that scar on your face?

speak;Gerik;This?|I got this beauty when I had just started out as a mercenary.|I was still a novice, but I was feeling pretty good about my swordsmanship.|I got to a point where I was arrogant enough to believe no one could best me.|Then one day it happened...|It's something I've never been able to forget.

speak;Gerik;It was just another battle.|I'd been hired on as another sword and then I met him.|He was a knight from some country or another.|I had fought knights on several other occasions and had beaten them all.|Even though he was a bit tougher, I was sure I'd defeat him in the end.|That's what I thought.|But...|His strength was beyond me.|I may as well have been using a broomstick to fight.|I remember thinking, “What a tiny little world I've been living in.”|He crushed me effortlessly, and the wound he inflicted became this lovely scar.
speak;Gerik;I was truly frightened.|It was the first time I'd experienced fear as a mercenary.|So this knight saw how scared I was and said, “Go.”|He didn't kill me.|He let me escape.

speak;Gerik;I was humiliated and ashamed.|My eyes were finally opened to my own weakness.|It goes without saying I lost every shred of self-confidence.|I still dream about it sometimes.|It wakes me up every time.|I've never forgotten that knight.|He thought I was weak and pathetic.
speak;Gerik;I was young and stupid.|This scar is my punishment.
speak;Tethys;But that knight spared your life.|Because of that, good things and better things have happened?

speak;Tethys;First of all, Chief, you're alive.|If you had died, all the good times you've had since that day, and all the joy you're sure to have from this day onward, wouldn't exist.|And another thing, because you lived, you made many friends and you met me.|I also don't think that knight thought you were pathetic.|I think he saw a young man with his whole life ahead of him.|That's why he let you go.
speak;Tethys;Yep.|I'm sure that's it.|So try thinking about it in a more positive light.

speak;Gerik;Ha ha ha.|You're right.|I was a lot calmer after that.|And while I've had hard times, there've been far more good times.|I guess you could say I owe my success as a mercenary to that knight.

speak;Tethys;Yep.|You've got your knight, and I've got my dancer.|Thanks to the two of them, the two of us are here now.|Say, Chief, why don't we become like them?|I think we should work at being inspirations to other people.
speak;Gerik;Hm...good idea.|Thanks, Tethys.|I think I'll sleep soundly tonight.
speak;Tethys;Good.|You know, Chief, I'm really happy.
speak;Gerik;Yeah, me, too.|I've got a life I enjoy and good companions.|All that and a wonderful woman to love.|Everyone should be so lucky.
speak;Gerik;Hey now...|This is a battlefield.|This isn't the place for that...

name: SupportGerikAndMarisa
_source: speak;Gerik;How're you doing?|Your sword still sharp?
speak;Gerik;You're not seriously injured or ill, are you?
speak;Gerik;I see.|So you can continue on?
speak;Gerik;Oh.|I'm the commander, you know?|I'm supposed to check on you now and then.|Well, see you later.
speak;Marisa;I'd like you to keep talking.|I don't mind talking to you.

speak;Gerik;You know, we've known each other for a long time, so I understand you...|But listen, Marisa, it wouldn't hurt you to be a bit more sociable.|Not for me, mind you, but some of the others have a hard time working with you.

speak;Gerik;Speaking of which, when I first met you, you were always working alone.|I remember thinking how odd that was.|I figured a woman as beautiful and talented as you would have men all around her.
speak;Gerik;You see, that's what I'm talking about!|Your beauty belies your words.
speak;Gerik;Um...sure, I guess.|I mean, doesn't everyone?|If you go to an inn, aren't the sociable gals the most popular?
speak;Marisa;I understand.|OK.|I'll be more sociable.|This better?
speak;Gerik;Listen, you've been acting a bit odd lately.|You don't talk to me as much as you used to.
speak;Gerik;Oh...|Because it's you I'm going to assume that you're serious.|You know what I said before?|I wasn't really serious, so don't worry about it.
speak;Marisa;But.|I've practiced.|I'm a bit more sociable.
speak;Gerik;In what way?|You don't appear to have changed at all.
speak;Gerik;What?|You're going to be sociable?|This I've got to see.|Well, go ahead.
speak;Marisa;Here goes...|Hello, Gerik!|Wonderful day for a battle, isn't it!
speak;Gerik;C'mon, Marisa, don't be like that.
speak;Gerik;I'm sorry, I didn't mean to laugh.|Are you still mad?
speak;Gerik;Forgive me.|I really and truly apologize.|Still mad?
speak;Gerik;Sigh.|OK, I get it.|What do I have to do to get you to forgive me?|I don't have much gold, but I could get you a snack...
speak;Marisa;You're the chief.|You don't have to apologize.|Just give orders.
speak;Gerik;Well, I know, but I was wrong.|I was the bad guy.|My crime was not being sensitive to your feelings.|I tell you what, I'll buy you anything you want.
speak;Marisa;You're soft.|Leaders are normally harsher than you.|You're too nice.|Too nice to all of us.|That's why...
speak;Gerik;Well, I said too much and I'm sorry.|You're fine just the way you are.
speak;Marisa;Th-then...|If you would...|I wouldn't be mad anymore.
speak;Gerik;C'mon, it wasn't nothing.|If it'll put you in a better mood, I don't have a problem with...

name: SupportGerikAndSaleh
_source: speak;Gerik;Imagine!|You and me fighting together.|Life's full of surprises, isn't it?
speak;Gerik;So, what do you think of our commander?

speak;Gerik;Good point.|You know this job seems to have more meaning than any of my previous ones.|And it's not because it deals with the continent and all the nations and all that.|I simply want to accomplish my employer's goals.|That's my prime motivation.
speak;Saleh;I think it will all work out.|As long as you and I are here...
speak;Gerik;Ha ha ha!|Well said.|No one can touch us, is that it?|I do imagine with us in the field we'll win most battles, eh?|Can't get overconfident, though.
speak;Gerik;All right...|Well then, let's get going.|When there's a break in the fighting, we should get together for a meal.
speak;Saleh;Very well.|We'll eat to our mutual good fortune...
speak;Gerik;Tell me, Saleh, how fares the elder?

speak;Gerik;Is that so?|You know I was so surprised the first time I visited Caer Pelyn.|The elder's eyes...they were not the eyes of your average person.|They were filled with a lifetime's wisdom and seemed to look right through you.|Deep...and sharp.|And they were so clear.|I've looked into the eyes of many people, but no one had eyes like hers.|But the thing about the elder is that her eyes weren't harsh, or judgmental.|That's what I like about her.|Actually, when I first met her, she intimidated me.|But she treated me with such kindness.|She's why I grew to enjoy Caer Pelyn, even if it doesn't have any nightlife!|I want you to take good care of the elder, Saleh.
speak;Gerik;You say the right words, Saleh, but are you being sincerely considerate?
speak;Saleh;Considerate?|When I'm home, I look after her personal belongings.|I also take care of her meals and watch over her health...
speak;Gerik;That's only natural.|You have no idea what I'm talking about, do you?|That's just like you, though.
speak;Saleh;Is there...something else I should be doing?
speak;Gerik;Next time you go home, make sure you take her a gift.|Bring her some jewelry or something that's popular in town.
speak;Saleh;But...|I don't know what she likes...
speak;Gerik;Oh, please, Saleh.|That's not the issue.|Simply receiving that sort of present from her grandson will make her happy.
speak;Gerik;That's what I'm trying to tell you.
speak;Saleh;I understand.|I'll take it into consideration.
speak;Gerik;When we next pass through a city, I'll help you pick something out.
speak;Gerik;Studying magic is all well and good, but you should pay attention to these things, too.|And in your case, you need to work on understanding women's hearts.
speak;Gerik;Ha ha ha.|I'll help you out in that area, too.
speak;Gerik;Hm?|What is it, Saleh?|You look even more serious than usual.
speak;Saleh;Gerik...|You truly despise me, don't you?
speak;Gerik;Don't say it, Saleh!|That was an act of fate.|Right?|All you did was brush those sparks away from yourself.

speak;Gerik;Listen, we're mercenaries.|We end up working together with old foes, and crossing blades with former allies.|It's just part of the job.|My friend Zabba died by your act.|That much is true.|And at that moment, I could think of nothing but avenging him!|But after that, you saved my life...|We became friends.|That's the truth of it, isn't it?
speak;Gerik;I trust you now.|You are my friend.|I'm not lying to you.|I don't lie to my friends.|That's something I don't do.
speak;Saleh;And you are my friend.|Since that day, it's you who has saved me time and time again.
speak;Gerik;We're all human after all.|Helping our friends is part of our nature.
speak;Gerik;That's enough of that!|You keep that up and I'll be blushing like a schoolgirl.

speak;Gerik;Hey!|Ha ha ha!|I caught a rare glimpse of you smiling.|Listen, Saleh, I know we're risking our lives here, but this war's not our whole lives.|Let's not do anything stupid.|We're going to get past this.|Then you're going to haul your carcass back to Caer Pelyn and care for the elder!
speak;Gerik;Sure.|When things calm down I'll let you throw me a feast.|I can't wait to have Caer Pelyn's famous mutton stew again.
speak;Saleh;We'll be waiting for you, Gerik.

name: SupportTethysAndEwan
_source: speak;Tethys;Ewan!|How many times am I going to have to say it?|This isn't a field trip.|Please promise me you'll behave.
speak;Ewan;Oh, you don't have to worry about me.|But since I'm here, I'd like to be of use.|Otherwise I'm just in the way.|You gotta let me do something.
speak;Tethys;You have a point, but you're still too young.
speak;Ewan;Too young?|I'm not a child anymore!|I can look after myself!
speak;Tethys;What are you talking about?|You're not a full-fledged mage, are you?

speak;Ewan;Well, no, not yet.|But someday I'm gonna be one of the best mages ever!|These soldiers recognize my talent.|That's why I'm here on the battlefield.|Just watch me!|You wouldn't say that I'm too young or inexperienced if you saw me!
speak;Tethys;Wait!|Ewan, wait up!|Oh, he's gone...|Only a child would say something like, “Just watch me.”
speak;Ewan;Hey, Tethys.|You've been getting pretty chummy with that guy lately.
speak;Tethys;What do you mean, Ewan?|Who's “that guy”?
speak;Ewan;You know, THAT guy.|Look, he's right over there...|And that guy waving his sword around...|I'd say you've been a little too friendly with all of them!
speak;Tethys;Too friendly?|I wonder.|I think chatting now and again is normal.|Wait a minute...|Ewan, are you feeling jealous?
speak;Ewan;D-don't be stupid.|That's not it at all!

speak;Tethys;Hold on.|You know, that man told me he found a frog in his boots the other day.|And that man woke up to find half his moustache shaved off.|You wouldn't know anything about that, would you?
speak;Ewan;N-no.|This is the first I've heard of it.
speak;Tethys;Ooh!|It WAS you, wasn't it?|Ewan, you can't do things like that.|Even if it is kind of funny.
speak;Ewan;But they're morons!|All they do is get you to dance, and then they run around on the battlefield challenging each other to “contests of strength and valor”!
speak;Ewan;They're dumb braggarts, and I was just taking 'em down a peg.|But I'm not jealous!
speak;Tethys;All right, all right.|I'll keep your secret this time, but you must stop!
speak;Ewan;They're the troublemakers, you know?|Oh...OK.|I got it.|I'll leave 'em alone. But, Tethys?
speak;Ewan;I'll always be here to protect you.|I'm not too young for that!|So instead of always helping those guys, dance for me once in a while.|I know it'll make me stronger!
speak;Ewan;I'll see you later!|You gotta promise to dance for me!
speak;Ewan;It's not such a good idea for you to dance too close to the front lines.
speak;Tethys;Hee hee!|Thanks for worrying about me, Ewan.|But are you sure it's not just the jealousy talking?
speak;Ewan;Th-that's not it at all!|It's dangerous!|That's it!
speak;Tethys;I'm sorry, I'm sorry.|But you know, Ewan...|Since you joined up with the army, you really have gotten stronger.
speak;Ewan;I have, haven't I?|So I'm no longer a novice, right?
speak;Tethys;No, you've truly grown.|I'm glad, but also a little sad.
speak;Ewan;Hmm.|So when I'm a full-fledged mage, you're gonna be sad?
speak;Tethys;I guess so.|A little sad, anyways.|I'm so much older than you that I've always thought of you as a child.|That's why I always thought I had to protect you.
speak;Ewan;You know, at the beginning of all of this I really was treating it like a game.|Then I saw the dangers you faced to help everyone.|I knew I couldn't treat it like a game any longer.

speak;Ewan;Battles threaten people's lives and need to end quickly.|That's why I need to boost my powers.|I want to help you and the others.|I have to become a full-fledged mage to really do my part.|So, don't be sad.|I just want to protect you...
speak;Ewan;You've been looking after your little brother for so many years.|Now it's my turn to return the favor.|I mean, I am the man of the family.|So from now on, I'm gonna be helping you out.

speak;Tethys;Thank you, Ewan.|Hearing you say that makes me very happy.|It proves to me how much you've truly grown.|But that doesn't mean you need to rush off on your own or anything.|If I thought you didn't need me anymore, I would feel really sad.
speak;Ewan;There's no reason to get all weepy.|No matter how old I get, you'll always be my big sister.|My one and only.

name: SupportTethysAndMarisa
_source: speak;Tethys;Well, when you're carrying a sword, don't you always have it in your left hand?
speak;Marisa;No, I can use either hand...|But my left hand is stronger.
speak;Tethys;So that's like a warning sign.|Left hand equals danger.
speak;Tethys;So why is it you always sleep on your right side?|You know you never roll over in your sleep?|And even the slightest noise causes you to spring up.|Do you ever really sleep?
speak;Marisa;I have to do that.|Otherwise I wouldn't survive.
speak;Marisa;I sleep with my dominant arm up.|That way, if I'm attacked, my good arm is ready to go.
speak;Tethys;Huh...|Do all sword fighters sleep that way?
speak;Marisa;If your dominant arm is cut, you're at a disadvantage in battle.|That means death.
speak;Tethys;But doesn't your arm ever fall asleep?|Aren't there times when you can't use it?
speak;Marisa;No.|My father trained me when I was a child, so that doesn't happen.
speak;Tethys;When you were a child?|How?|Kids always roll around in their sleep.
speak;Marisa;My father placed blunt swords at my sides when I slept to keep me from moving.
speak;Tethys;Your father did that?|But that's so dangerous...
speak;Marisa;No, the blades were rounded and dull.|And it worked.|I don't roll over when sleeping.
speak;Tethys;Wow, sword fighters have some intense training methods, don't they?|I'm glad I was an average kid.|I mean, I was poor, but at least I slept freely.
speak;Tethys;Will wonders never cease?|You actually started a conversation.
speak;Marisa;When you dance, you often begin by putting your right foot forward.

speak;Tethys;Now I'm really amazed.|I can't believe you noticed.|But footwork in dancing has nothing to do with being right- or left-handed.|Dancing is a way of expressing feelings through body movement.|All of one's experiences are incorporated and displayed in the way one dances.
speak;Tethys;That, my dear, is my little secret.|Mine may be a bit unique, though.|My life's taken some odd turns, but it's because of them that I started dancing.|And when I'm dancing, I'm happy.
speak;Marisa;Hmmm.|Your dances give people courage.|Dancing suits you.
speak;Tethys;Doesn't it, though?|All the mercenaries tell me that, too.|Now that you understand my dancing, you're truly a member of Gerik's team.
speak;Tethys;Tell me, Marisa, have you ever thought about wanting to be reborn?
speak;Tethys;You know, coming back as someone else after you die?|If you were going to be reborn, what would you like to be?|Perhaps a beautiful dancer like me?
speak;Marisa;I'm fine with being me.|I can't imagine anything else.

speak;Tethys;I thought that's what you'd say.|Actually, I thought of lots of things, but really can't imagine any other life.|I guess that means that in spite of all the hardships we've faced, we're really happy.

speak;Tethys;Living in this age means that we face many bad things and then worse things.|Yet...|We're alive, so that means we also get good things and then better things, too.|In tough times, I sometimes think I'd like to be reborn in another time, but the important thing is to not give up and to live your life to the fullest.
speak;Marisa;When you die, life is over.|There's no such thing as being reborn.
speak;Marisa;We only get one chance.|So all I can do is keep fighting.
speak;Tethys;After all's said and done, you truly like who and what you are, right?|We have completely different lives, but we have that in common.|That and the same man, right?
speak;Tethys;You can't hide it from me.|I guess I should ask, do you think you're hiding it?
speak;Tethys;What an interesting reaction.|Youth is so cute.
speak;Tethys;Don't be embarrassed.|We're going to be around each other for a long time.|We should talk.
speak;Tethys;There's no need to run away.|We may be rivals, but we're still friends.

name: SupportMarisaAndTana
_source: speak;Tana;Oh!|You're one of Gerik's mercenaries, aren't you?
speak;Tana;Yes, that's right.|I'm Tana.|What's your name?
speak;Tana;Nice to meet you, Marisa!|I just wanted to tell you how much I appreciate you all.|Mercenaries, I mean.|It's because of you that we're doing so well.
speak;Marisa;It's my job, and I'm doing it.|No need to thank me.
speak;Tana;But I'd always heard mercenaries were renegades, cutthroats, and oath breakers.|You're nothing like that, though.|So that's why I wanted to thank you- for fighting so hard for us.
speak;Marisa;It's not out of loyalty to you or to any kingdom.|I'm happy as long as I have a chance to swing my sword.
speak;Tana;Oh...|Is that so...|But it doesn't matter to me!|You're helping us now, and I know you'd never betray us.
speak;Marisa;I don't care what you think.
speak;Tana;But-but...|Oh, wait!|Well...|She doesn't talk much, does she...
speak;Tana;What is it?|What's the matter?|Oh!|Have you never seen a pegasus?
speak;Tana;Is this your first time ever seeing a pegasus up close?
speak;Marisa;Yes.|I've fought beside pegasus knights, but I've never been this close before.
speak;Marisa;I thought they would have more delicate legs, because they fly so much.
speak;Tana;Oh, they can gallop quite quickly.|They don't always have to fly.
speak;Marisa;It is truly magnificent.|Powerful and beautiful.
speak;Tana;Would you like to touch him?|Pet his head.|Achaeus likes that.
speak;Marisa;Your pegasus is named...Achaeus...|That is a good name.|A strong name.

speak;Tana;Thanks.|Syrene named him.|She's a pegasus knight.|She's sort of my mentor.|Someday, I want to be as graceful and strong as Syrene.|And then, like Syrene, I'll pass my experiences on to the next generation.
speak;Marisa;I see.|I have no goal but to master my swordsmanship.
speak;Tana;Oh, but that's a fine dream!|Then let's keep working, shall we?
speak;Tana;Marisa, is it difficult to improve your swordsmanship?
speak;Marisa;It is.|I practice daily.|I've fought a thousand men and won each time.|And still, I have seen only the barest glimpse of what I could achieve.
speak;Tana;Really...|Maybe you shouldn't press yourself so hard.
speak;Tana;I can see how dedicated you are to becoming a better swordfighter.|But if you focus too much on a lofty goal, you might not notice when you reach it.|And I have no doubt you will reach it.
speak;Marisa;Why do you waste your time speaking with me, Princess?
speak;Tana;Oh, am I not supposed to do that?
speak;Marisa;It's not a matter of whether you should or should not.
speak;Tana;At first, I thought you were brusque and...maybe a little intimidating, too.|But you're not like that at all.|You're just shy-and a poor conversationalist.
speak;Marisa;A poor-|You know, many of my fellow swordsmen still fear me.

speak;Tana;I'm sure they do.|Your grace with the sword is something else.|But when you're not fighting, you're completely different.|More pensive.|You're so dedicated to your goal.|You have that far-off look in your eyes, like you're lost in thoughts of love or something like that.
speak;Marisa;You've already made up your mind, Princess, so there's no point in my arguing.
speak;Tana;Then we agree!|Oh, but there's one more thing.|Just call me Tana.|You don't have to keep calling me “Princess.”

speak;Tana;That's right!|So just call me Tana.|I don't want you to worry about royal titles and formality when we talk.|You say you've dedicated yourself to the sword, but...|that doesn't mean you can't have a friend or two, does it?
speak;Tana;Great! Boy, I don't know what I would have done if you'd said no.|But there it is.|We're friends now, right, Marisa?

name: SupportSalehAndMyrrh
_source: speak;Myrrh;Saleh, wherever we go, you're always at my side.|Don't you ever do anything YOU want to do?
speak;Saleh;I came from Caer Pelyn.|I have been entrusted with the honor of being your escort.|Protecting you, Great Dragon, gives my life meaning.
speak;Myrrh;Great Dragon?|Please, there's no need to call me that.|My father is the great one.|I've done nothing.|I'm not great at all.

speak;Saleh;It is true, Great Dragon, that your exalted father once saved mankind.|On that day so long ago, he shielded us from evil.|He is our true savior.|However, mankind has forgotten that most sacred debt we owe him.|I do, as we all must, what I can to atone for that crime of neglect.
speak;Saleh;Great Dragon, does my presence bother you?|If it does, please do not hesitate to tell me.|I would remove myself at once and not bother you again until needed.
speak;Myrrh;There's something I wanted to ask.|You're from Caer Pelyn.|Do you know if my father has ever visited your village?

speak;Saleh;He has.|I myself have never seen his noble personage.|However, I have heard that Dara met him once when she was young.|Some monsters had wandered into Caer Pelyn, and the Great Dragon saved us.
speak;Myrrh;Really?|I wonder why my father chose to help you.
speak;Saleh;That, I cannot guess.|We poor humans cannot hope to grasp the thinking of the Great Dragon.

speak;Myrrh;My father has dedicated his life to protecting humans.|For the longest time, I could not fathom why he would do this.|But now, after spending time with all of you...|I begin to understand how he felt.
speak;Myrrh;I'm sure that I-|that I will continue to fight, as he did, for all humanity.
speak;Saleh;I am truly grateful that you feel that way, Great Dragon.
speak;Saleh;Great Dragon...|I know I'm being rude, but I've a favor to ask.
speak;Saleh;Would you please come to our village?
speak;Saleh;Dara and the other villagers would be overjoyed to see you.|The village is quite spare, but we would do our best to entertain you.|You could stay for as long as you wanted...
speak;Myrrh;Saleh, you made that request on my behalf, didn't you?
speak;Saleh;No, not at all.|I apologize.|I have been disrespectful.
speak;Myrrh;No, I'm pleased.|However...|I doubt I should stay too long.
speak;Myrrh;It's because I'm a dragon.|My father explained it to me.|We are both human and monster.|And because we are both, we are also neither.

speak;Myrrh;We have the power of dragons.|Therefore, we cannot live together with humans...|We have the hearts of humans.|Therefore, we do not belong with monsters.|We are outcasts in this world, never a part of either community.|And so we live our lives alone, never to be understood by anyone.

speak;Saleh;But there are humans whose actions make them monsters in the eyes of others.|I do not think of you as such when there are many worse monsters among my own kind.|Regardless, I believe the villagers would be most pleased to have you visit.
speak;Myrrh;Saleh...|Thank you.|Your words have cheered me up a little.|Please wait for my answer.|When all of this is finished...|When peace returns, I'll give you my answer then.

speak;Myrrh;And when I do return to Darkling Woods, I will not be sad.|Because of the time I've spent with you, the memories you've given me, I shall not be lonely.|I shall never feel like an outcast again.

name: SupportSalehAndEwan
_source: speak;Ewan;You were practicing Valega, weren't you?|“To know the harmony of heaven and earth, body and spirit”...right?
speak;Ewan;Um...”To contemplate oneself”...|And...what was the rest?
speak;Saleh;“To contemplate the world and to envision all creation.|Thus, to be enlightened.”
speak;Ewan;Oh, that's right.|Doesn't it get to be a bother finding a quiet place like this, though?
speak;Saleh;Contemplation takes time, Ewan.|It doesn't matter where, so long as you do it.
speak;Ewan;Oh...|Well, if Valega is an important part of Caer Pelyn's culture and history, I think I might give it a try.
