speak;Saleh;Really?|And I wonder how many days you'll last at that.
speak;Ewan;Heh.|I guess you're right.|Knowing the harmony of the heavens sounds tough.|Do you have anything easier I could practice in the meantime?
speak;Saleh;Hm.|Let me think.|Your skill level is still quite low, but...
speak;Ewan;Thanks, Teacher.|I remember when you first decided to teach me some magic.|I was so excited that I went out and practiced over and over again.
speak;Saleh;You must pace yourself.|Using too much magic can drain both body and soul.
speak;Ewan;Yeah.|Boy, I know that.|After that time, I was so tired that I couldn't stay awake.|I was so tired that I slept for a full day.|I woke up in bed...
speak;Ewan;Oh, so that was you who carried me home?
speak;Ewan;Now that I think about it, no one else would have bothered!|Thank you.
speak;Saleh;Ewan, don't push yourself too hard.|Magic is no game.

speak;Ewan;Do you remember a few years ago when you went to visit Commander Gerik?|That was when I met you and followed you back to Caer Pelyn.|I never said thank you for taking me in, Teacher.|I've never regretted it.
speak;Saleh;I remember it clearly.|I kept thinking, “What have I gotten myself into”?
speak;Ewan;If that's the way you felt about it, why did you let me be your student?
speak;Saleh;You had a spark in your eyes.|I knew that I saw an exceptional talent for magic in those eyes.
speak;Ewan;Wow.|That's really something.|I would never have guessed.
speak;Saleh;I'm sure, as your training progresses, that you will feel your power grow.
speak;Ewan;I'll train even harder, then!|Back when I first started, I...|thought you were kinda scary.
speak;Ewan;Well, you don't really talk much.|I always thought you were angry with me, and I didn't know why.
speak;Saleh;All that because I was so silent all the time?
speak;Ewan;Yep.|But after a while, I figured out it was just the way you were.
speak;Saleh;Ewan, you can never find truth in words, spoken or unspoken.|Truth lives within the heart.
speak;Ewan;But other people can't see what's inside your heart, can they?
speak;Saleh;If you can trust one another, you can see.|And you will understand.

speak;Ewan;Oh!|Is that how it works?|I think I get it now.|But talking is so important in building friendships, isn't it?|We use words to communicate things like feelings and ideas.|But all that stuff, it's just on the surface.|Does that mean that if people use their hearts, they can communicate without using words?

speak;Ewan;You really are great, Teacher.|You teach me by making me teach myself, and I mean more than just magic...|...Remember how angry you were at me that one time?|Back when I took out that magic tome?
speak;Saleh;I wasn't angry that you took the tome out with you.|It's that you took it with you without asking and went for a stroll.|And then you stopped to play in the river...
speak;Ewan;That's right.|Then I dropped it and SPLASH!!|Right in it went...|It wasn't in the water long, but those pages were totally illegible...
speak;Saleh;That utter carelessness-|No, your lack of consideration.|That's what made me angry.
speak;Ewan;I'm s-sorry.|But I never took any books with me when I went to the river after that.
speak;Saleh;And there were other things, as well.
speak;Ewan;Oh, you don't mean...that?|Oh, yeah. Ha ha ha.
speak;Saleh;Unbelievable...|I've never had a student so troublesome as you.
speak;Ewan;But I promise to be much more careful in the future!
speak;Saleh;Is there even a shred of truth in those words?
speak;Saleh;Ewan...|If something happens to me, take all my scrolls and magical items, and...|keep them for your own.
speak;Saleh;This conflict has grown bitter.|I'm not sure I'll see it to its end.|And...if something does happen, I want you to care for Dara.|Watch over her and Caer Pelyn.
speak;Ewan;Oh, come on!|There is no way anything is going to happen to you, Teacher!|And besides, if you weren't around, I would have no clue what to do.
speak;Saleh;Ewan...|Don't underestimate yourself.|One day, you will surpass me.
speak;Saleh;It all hinges on your own efforts.
speak;Saleh;Only those who choose magic can handle it.|And you are special even among them...|Be confident.|You have a rare gift that others can never duplicate.
speak;Ewan;Teacher...|If you really mean that, then there's no way I'm going to let you die.
speak;Ewan;I'll be at your side protecting you.|If the two of us combine our power, we can get through anything that arises!
speak;Saleh;Whew...|Protect...me?|I had no idea until this moment how dependable you've become.
speak;Ewan;Right!|That's because I'm the great sage Saleh's number-one student!
speak;Saleh;Well spoken, Ewan.|Come on, follow me.|I'll use this war to teach you every last bit of the magic I know.|My dear, sweet student.

name: SupportEwanAndDozla
_source: speak;Ewan;I'm Ewan.|It's nice to meet you, Dozla, sir!
speak;Dozla;Aren't you a little bundle of energy?|I bet you're a regular troublemaker.|So, what were you so lost in thought over?|You having any problems?
speak;Ewan;Nope, nothing.|I don't have any problems.|I was thinking of something interesting.|You want to hear about it?
speak;Ewan;Well, I was thinking of how much fun it would be if I could do something...
speak;Ewan;Some battlegrounds are full of plants and stuff, but others are dreary and dead.
speak;Ewan;If a place like that were suddenly filled with beautiful colors, it'd be neat, right?|Like if it could suddenly become a flower garden?

speak;Dozla;Ho ho, a battleground becoming a lovely flower garden?|Aye, that would be nice.|It would help heal the hearts and minds of the soldiers.|But how would you do it?|Do you have some sort of magical powers or something?

speak;Ewan;Yeah, I do, but I've decided that wouldn't be the best way.|If I did that, people would be more impressed by the magic than by the flowers.|I think it would be better to make it something that anyone could do and enjoy.
speak;Dozla;Oh...|It's all too difficult for me to follow, but it sure sounds like a nice dream.|If you could pull it off, I'm sure people would really enjoy it.
speak;Ewan;Ha ha...|I haven't really thought much about how I would do it.|I was just thinking how nice it would be, that's all.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|That's fine.|That's what young people are supposed to do.|Many great things come from the daydreams of youth.
speak;Ewan;Really?|Do you think so?|All right!|I like you, mister.
speak;Ewan;Yep.|And I'm going to call you Uncle Dozla from now on!|It's about time for me to get going.|I'll talk to you later, Uncle Dozla!
speak;Dozla;So, you're in high spirits today?
speak;Ewan;Yep!|I'm always in high spirits.|How about you, Uncle?

speak;Dozla;Oh, I'm doing as well as can be expected.|I'm a bit tired, actually.|I'm a bit closer to the ground than everyone else, so my legs tire easily.|Gwah ha!|It would be nice if there were an easier way to move around, wouldn't it?
speak;Ewan;Oh, that reminds me.|I've been thinking of something.|Do you want to hear about it?
speak;Dozla;What's this?|Have you come up with yet another fabulous idea?
speak;Ewan;And we've got a coach in our convoy because it can carry people and supplies.

speak;Dozla;Yeah, they're useful enough.|They're nice if you're traveling far with wounded men, children, and whatnot.|But without roads, they're almost useless, and forget about dense forests.|Oh, and they can be quite vulnerable in a battle.|Not very useful at all, really.
speak;Ewan;Exactly!|So I was thinking about coaches that could travel in the air...
speak;Dozla;What's that?|Are you talking about using pegasus knights?

speak;Ewan;That's what I was thinking at first.|But you know, that probably wouldn't work.|I mean, a pegasus can get mighty picky about who it lets ride him, right?|I haven't really thought about how to actually make a flying coach, but...|But wouldn't it be amazing if one really existed?|It would be fast, and all that stuff like bad roads and forests wouldn't matter!
speak;Ewan;And even if people lived far apart, they could visit one another quickly!|What do you think?

speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|It's fantastic!|And it would be useful, that's for sure!|Sounds like fun, too.|I'd sure love to ride about in a flying coach.|Think about it-the land spread out below, glittering dawn skies...and the wind!|Ah, it all sounds like a dream.
speak;Ewan;I hope it becomes reality someday.
speak;Dozla;Me, too.|I like the way your mind works, laddie.|Let's talk more later.
speak;Ewan;Ah, Uncle Dozla.|Listen to this, will you?|I've been thinking about something new.
speak;Ewan;Imagine people far away from each other talking.
speak;Dozla;Far away?|You mean, like, if you and I were maybe...100 paces apart?
speak;Ewan;No, I'm not.|And even farther than that!|For example...|What if one person were in Frelia, and the other person were in Rausten?

speak;Ewan;That's right!|Anyone you could think of, you could talk to.|I read about magical devices that could do the same thing, but...|Wouldn't it be better if anyone could do it, and not just mages?
speak;Dozla;Impressive!|I think I see it...|People could send and receive important messages instantly, is that it?

speak;Ewan;No, even better than that!|I'm not talking about just sending messages back and forth.|I mean like if they could talk, just like you and I are now!|We wouldn't need messengers at all!|It would all happen instantly!
speak;Dozla;I just can't wrap my head around this one, laddie.|It's too much for me.
speak;Ewan;Great, isn't it?|You could contact your people in Rausten from anywhere, at any time!
speak;Dozla;My, oh my...|You've got quite an imagination, don't you?|The things you come up with always surprise me, laddie.
speak;Ewan;Ha ha ha.|I used to get in trouble for always thinking up these outlandish things.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|That's a shame, laddie.|After all, I'm sure a lot of the things we have now seemed outlandish once.|If nobody dreamed, nothing new would ever be created, would it?
speak;Ewan;Uncle Dozla...|You always have time to listen to my ideas, Uncle.|It makes me really happy.

speak;Dozla;It's always worth the time to listen to you youngsters and your ideas.|It's sad, but I know people who are so busy that they've no time to spare.|But me, I've got time.|As you know, I'm one of Princess L'Arachel's men.|I'm not the brightest fellow around, so she doesn't give me a lot to do.|But that gives me lots of free time, and I'm always happy to spend it with you.
speak;Ewan;Thank you.|I think you're the best, Uncle Dozla!
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|What a nice thing to say.|And I think you're the best, laddie.|I think when you're fully grown, you're going to be a great and interesting man.
speak;Dozla;I do.|It's that sparkle in your eyes that convinces me.
speak;Dozla;I'm looking forward to the day when I see one of your ideas made reality.
speak;Ewan;And that day will surely come.|It's weird...but there are times when I can almost picture a world like that.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Now that would be something.|I'll have to make sure I live long enough to see it.
speak;Ewan;Yep!|And you'll have to stay my friend, too!

name: SupportLarachelAndJoshua
_source: speak;Joshua;So, is today my lucky day?|Or...|Tails, hm?|Oh, well.|Luck's just not on my side today, I guess.
speak;Larachel;Oh, may I ask what you are doing?
speak;Joshua;Hm?|Oh, I was just checking my luck.|Looks like today is not set to be one of my better ones.
speak;Larachel;That's not good!|Perhaps if you gave up that coin for some good, honest prayer...|I have no need of luck, you see, for I benefit from divine grace!
speak;Joshua;That sounds nice.|I'd love to have a bit of that myself.|All right, let's have a quick bet to see which is better.|We'll test your divine grace against my good old luck.
speak;Larachel;Oh, I could never give in to such a vile sin.|Gambling is a pox, a boil upon the fair skin of mankind.
speak;Joshua;That's going a bit far, don't you think?

speak;Larachel;Gambling corrupts the masses, and I'll have none of it.|Which is the more noble?|To earn your keep or to swindle it?|And besides, this is a battlefield, not a gambling hall.|No, I simply will not indulge in such spiritual pollution here.
speak;Joshua;Oh, you're really making too much of a big deal out of it.|This is just a coin toss.|You can flip a coin just about anywhere.|Let's see...|Well, heads or tails?|What is it?
speak;Larachel;Since you refuse to resist the evils of temptation...|I shall have to teach you a lesson you won't soon forget.|Heads!
speak;Joshua;I knew you'd come around!|Right, so let's see here...|Hey!|It's heads!|You really are lucky!
speak;Larachel;Huh?|I won?|Well, of course I won!|I shouldn't be so surprised.|It was fate.|One as blessed as I could never lose at something so base as gambling.
speak;Joshua;Great, so let's keep going.|How about putting some money down this time?|100 gold coins?
speak;Larachel;That's fine.|Anything I win will, of course, fund only noble causes.
speak;Joshua;That's my girl...|Are you ready?|Heads or tails, what's your call?
speak;Joshua;Do you have a few minutes to spare?|I wanted to win back my money.|You were doing pretty well the other day.|I was overconfident.|But today, I'm feeling lucky.
speak;Larachel;I accept your proposal.|But remember, I think that gambling is an immoral, inexcusable pastime.|You can tell it is wicked, because of how good you feel when you win.
speak;Joshua;Can't disagree with you there.|Last time, I went easy on you because you were an amateur.|Don't think I'm gonna throw away my money like that today.
speak;Larachel;I would never ask you to go easy on me, Joshua.|After all, I have righteousness at my side, and I need no favors.
speak;Joshua;Righteousness?|Is that what you've got?|And to think, you were the one telling me gambling was wrong!
speak;Larachel;Oh, but it is wrong.|I meant to teach you a lesson, and your lesson continues.|When done for a just cause, surely gambling could not possibly be wrong.
speak;Joshua;Now, let's see the color of your money!
speak;Larachel;What do you mean, making such rude noises in front of a lady!?|You're slowing down the game!
speak;Joshua;Hold on, give me a break!|You got me.|I lost.|I've had enough.|It's just like you said.|I shouldn't gamble anymore.
speak;Larachel;Are you quitting on me?|Where's your spirit?
speak;Joshua;...Man.|I just don't get it.|Not at all.|You must really have some sort of divine powers on your side.|I mean, I've been fixing every single game, and I still can't wi-
speak;Larachel;Fixing?|What do you mean?|The game's not broken.|I'm doing fine!
speak;Joshua;Uh...|No, I-|Nothing.|Anyway, I'm all done.|I don't want to play with you anymore.|Go take someone else for a ride.
speak;Larachel;A ride?|Like on a horse?|What are you talking about?
speak;Joshua;Look, what I'm trying to say is...|You don't know anything, and you STILL managed to beat me!
speak;Larachel;What do you mean, I don't know anything?|Oh!|Such disrespect!|What do you know, other than gambling?|Tell me that!
speak;Joshua;Hm?|Let's see...|I know how to survive in a desert, for one thing.
speak;Larachel;I think we're all quite familiar with the hardships of travel by now!|If that's all you've got, don't go around telling me I'M the ignorant one!
speak;Joshua;Aaaah!|Enough already!|Fine!|Fine!|I was wrong!!!|Anyway, the point is that I'm not gambling with you ANYMORE!

speak;Larachel;Oh!|He ran away!|...Why do they always run away?|Who will I play with now?|Oh, I have an idea!|We can build a gambling hall in Rausten!|Yes, I'm brilliant!|I simply must bring this up with Uncle next time I see him!

name: SupportLarachelAndDozla
_source: speak;Larachel;Oh, I cannot believe it.|There is something very wrong with this world.
speak;Dozla;Hm?!|What is it?|What's happened, Princess L'Arachel?

speak;Larachel;Hello, Dozla.|Listen to this.|The other day, I paid a visit to a nearby village.|I found something inconceivable there.|Not one of them had ever heard of the beautiful banisher of darkness before.
speak;Dozla;What?!|Even with your anonymous campaign to rid the world of monstrosities?|I cannot fathom how those people could be so uninformed!

speak;Larachel;Last night, I was so distraught that I quite nearly drowned my pillow in tears.|This will never do, Dozla.|I must be more famous.|The entire world must know of my legend.|The troubadours must be made to sing my praises far and wide.
speak;Larachel;The five heroes who banished evil...|My own sacred ancestor...|Oh, to be like them...|I so long to be praised by the masses, too.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|And you shall be, Princess!

speak;Larachel;But I get the feeling that we're going to have to change our methodology.|Appealing to the common people is of the utmost importance.|First and foremost, we need a plan of action.|A means to win their hearts.|Please, Dozla, I want you to think of something, too.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Leave it to your trusted Dozla!
speak;Larachel;Dozla, have you thought of any good plans?
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Prepare yourself for joy, Princess L'Arachel!|I, Dozla, have come up with a plan of masterpiece proportions!
speak;Larachel;Oh!|That is good news!|Don't keep me waiting, Dozla.|Let me hear it.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha!|Here goes!|All of the heroes from the dawn of time had two names, did they not?|So what you need, Princess, is another name.|Something with oomph!
speak;Larachel;Oh, Dozla!|What a splendid idea!|An alias would make it easier for the people to remember me.|Very well, Dozla, we must come up with a wonderful epithet for me.
speak;Dozla;Hmm...|Aha! It's come to me, Princess L'Arachel!|How do you like the sound of “the green-haired battle princess”?
speak;Larachel;Um, no.|I want something with more force.|Something with more...impact.|I've got it!|What do you think of “the beautiful princess of peerless beauty”?!
speak;Dozla;Oh!|It's fantastic!|You're amazing, Princess L'Arachel!|What a splendid nickname!
speak;Larachel;Of course it is.|L'Arachel, “the beautiful princess of peerless beauty”!|It has such a nice ring to it.|Just rolls off the tongue, doesn't it?

speak;Larachel;What we do now is vital to our success, Dozla.|It wouldn't do for me to ride about calling myself by my own nickname.|It must be spread about in a nonchalant manner.|Dozla, starting now, I want you to refer to me exclusively by my epithet, “L'Arachel, the beautiful princess of peerless beauty,” when you're among the soldiers.|And don't forget to slip it into everyday conversation, too.
speak;Larachel;How is it progressing, Dozla?|Is it working?

speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|You will be pleased, Princess L'Arachel!|Just recently I saw a group of villagers together gossiping.|They'd seen a suspicious young woman in fantastic garb riding around at night.|And they called that enigmatic woman “the beautiful princess of peerless beauty”!
speak;Larachel;Yes!|They were most certainly talking about me then.|At last, I am becoming known amongst the people of the land.|Those three long trips I took around the area were worth the trouble.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|You're so right, Princess L'Arachel!|There can be no doubt that the villagers were appropriately impressed.

speak;Larachel;Yet I find it passing strange.|How is it that no one has appeared to imitate me? The beautiful banisher of darkness was well enough known, after all.|It's only natural that someone somewhere would have aspired to be like me.|The fact that no imitators have appeared has me very worried, I must say.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|How right you are!|But you are peerless, Princess L'Arachel, as your nickname says!|It would be impossible for anyone to claim your beauty as her own!

speak;Larachel;Well, that is true.|It certainly was not easy for me, after all.|Yet now, I am destined to be remembered in the future as a hero.|I wonder how my legend will be passed on after I leave this earth.|I am so looking forward to it.|“The beautiful princess of peerless beauty,”
speak;Larachel;Ah...|How enchanting.|Already, I weep for the world that will one day be robbed of my beauty.
speak;Larachel;I must do something spectacular this battle to ensure my name is remembered.|Let's go, Dozla.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Ready as ever, Princess L'Arachel!

name: SupportLarachelAndRennac
_source: speak;Larachel;And what do you mean, "yipes"?|Is meeting me honestly such an unpleasant affair?
speak;Rennac;It's just that my job becomes difficult when noisy people like you are about.
speak;Larachel;Noisy?|How rude!|Couldn't you have said showy?|Or flamboyant, perhaps!?
speak;Rennac;But that would be lying.|You really are noisy.|Do you even realize that you were yelling just now?
speak;Larachel;Yell?|Me!?|Why, I never!|You've gone too far!|Rennac, you would do well to remember that your number-one priority is guarding me.
speak;Rennac;That's not the case anymore.|These people respect my abilities and value my skills.
speak;Larachel;Very well, I grant that you've made yourself useful out here.|However, sir, you know nothing about how to treat a lady!|You would do well to refine yourself.
speak;Rennac;Now, who's being rude?|I happen to be quite the gentleman.|For instance, I have some small renown as a fabulous dancer.
speak;Larachel;You?|A dancer?|I wonder if you're not merely flattering yourself...
speak;Rennac;You don't think I can dance?|Then test me!|You'll see how well I can dance!|Come on, get down off your horse.
speak;Larachel;Me?|Dance with you?|Do you believe I would dance with a commoner?|Please, our stations would never permit it.
speak;Rennac;It's not a matter of station.|If you permit us to dance, you would see.|Unless...|Wait a minute, maybe YOU'RE the one who can't dance!

speak;Larachel;Rennac!|You overstep yourself!|All right!|If you dare speak such blasphemies, then I have no choice!|When next we meet, I will test your vainglorious boast myself!|But remember, my dancing with one such as you is a rare occasion.|Because it will be so special, I expect you to be most grateful.|Got it!?
speak;Larachel;Very well.|I suggest you devote yourself to practicing while you've the time.
speak;Rennac;Now, you're the one who's gone too far!|I'm going to make you eat your words.
speak;Larachel;So...Rennac.|We finally meet again.|Do you remember our agreement?
speak;Rennac;Princess L'Arachel!|Well, of course I remember, but...|Surely, this isn't the place for a, er, dance off, is it?
speak;Larachel;Stop your complaining!|You will make yourself available at MY leisure, sir.|Now then, shall we dance?
speak;Rennac;Are you serious?!|In THIS place?|It's preposterous!|It's ridiculous...
speak;Rennac;Yes, yes, I know what happens next.|Oh, bother...
speak;Larachel;You're much better than I imagined you'd be.

speak;Rennac;Thank you.|My father was a merchant.|We found ourselves invited to many balls.|It was my job to dance with the wives and daughters of his associates.|I found that I had a taste for it, and with practice, I improved my skill.
speak;Larachel;Is that so?|I see...|It's not fair you kept that secret.|Your dance skills were quite adequate.|Your treatment of ladies, however, is still sorely lacking.|Next...
speak;Rennac;Uh-oh.|I really have no time to chat.|I must be going.|Farewell.
speak;Larachel;I don't know why, but...|I'm quite vexed...

speak;Larachel;Don't you know that it's rude to sigh when you see someone, Rennac?|You may be a fair dancer, but your smooth moves belie your gruff manners.|You should learn from me.|If you were truly happy, you would not sigh so.|Tell me, Rennac, what is it that makes you happy?
speak;Rennac;Makes me happy?|Let me see...|Uh...|I've never really thought about it.|If pressed, I'd have to say gold.
speak;Larachel;Gold, did you say?|So if you had gold, you would be happy.|Is that it?

speak;Rennac;Well, if you have enough gold, you can buy whatever you desire.|Mercenaries work so that they can get paid.|It's why they fight.|Knights fight because they have sworn oaths, but there is more...|They've been promised a certain social status by fulfilling their oaths.
speak;Larachel;So, by getting what you desire, you can be happy?|Is that it?
speak;Larachel;Rather than lament over what you do not possess, you should treasure what you do.|That's a very important lesson to learn, don't you think?|Isn't that the road to true happiness?
speak;Rennac;Princess L'Arachel...|I know you mean well when you say things like that.|But coming from someone who has everything, it means very little.
speak;Larachel;This has nothing to do with my station in life.|And as for you, what need have you of money or fame?|You have me!|Merely serving me must be the greatest pleasure man can know.
speak;Rennac;So, that's what this is about, is it?
speak;Larachel;Your employer is sweet and lovely.|That is something most people dream of having.|Surely you cannot aspire to happiness greater than this.
speak;Rennac;I've always wondered, Princess, how your ego grew so large.
speak;Larachel;You complain far too much!|Come, Rennac.|It's time to go.|Follow me, and try not to lag.
speak;Rennac;Ah, Princess L'Arachel!|...Perfect...|True happiness?|Is this really what happiness feels like?

name: SupportDozlaAndMyrrh
_source: speak;Myrrh;I...|I'm not lost.|I'm traveling with Ephraim.|I'm his...friend.
speak;Dozla;Oho!|In that case, you and I are allies, are we not?|My name's Dozla.|It's an honor to meet you!
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|You're a quiet lassie, aren't you?|And you're so tiny, too.|Seeing you takes me back to the days when Princess L'Arachel was a child.|Tell me, lassie, how old are you?
speak;Myrrh;It's impolite to ask a woman her age.|That's what Ephraim says.|I think you're being rude.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Aren't you the sassy one!|You're still young.|I don't think you need to worry about age just yet.
speak;Dozla;Me?|I'm all of forty-seven years old.
speak;Dozla;Huh?|Gwah ha ha!|Stop teasing me, lassie!|You don't have to be shy.|Just tell me how old you are.
speak;Dozla;Oh, lassie.|What luck meeting you here.|Do you know where I might find Princess L'Arachel?
speak;Myrrh;...I do not.|But that's not important.|Where is Ephraim?
speak;Dozla;If it's Prince Ephraim you're after, just follow the sounds of combat!|There's no better way to motivate your troops than to stand by their side!
speak;Myrrh;That L'Arachel person is probably with Ephraim.|I saw her next to him speaking to him on quite familiar terms.|For some reason, it made my chest feel...funny.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|It must be love!
speak;Dozla;Mm.|I've tasted the sweet and the sour that life serves up, and I know love.|You, my dear, are in love with Princess L'Arachel!
speak;Myrrh;I'm not so sure about that...
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Are you all right, lassie?|There's no need to worry.|No matter how many enemies pop up, I'll protect you.
speak;Myrrh;I appreciate it...|I do feel safe when you're nearby...|Somehow, you remind me of my father.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|I get that a lot!|So tell me, little one, where is your father, anyway?'
speak;Dozla;Er...|What's wrong?!|Did I ask something that I shouldn't have?|I-I'm sorry, lassie.|Please don't cry...

speak;Dozla;Ah!|What do I do?|Wait.|Just think.|I must have run across something like this before.|When Princess L'Arachel was a babe, and she would begin to cry...|She would tug on my beard!|That would always make her happy.|C'mon, lassie, grab a handful of my beard and give it a good, strong yank!
speak;Myrrh;But you were worried about me.|That makes me happy.|You're a nice person after all.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|You've stopped crying.|Hm, that's a good thing.

name: SupportDozlaAndRennac
_source: speak;Rennac;Ah...|Why has fate chosen to treat me so cruelly?
speak;Dozla;Ah, Rennac.|You look so pleased to have been reunited with Princess L'Arachel.|I'm glad we're all in one piece!

speak;Rennac;You haven't changed, Dozla.|Your ability to misread people still ruins all conversation.|I am lamenting, old man!|I am raging against my horrible misfortune!|You're a vassal sworn to serve Princess L'Arachel.|You're supposed to be here.|I, however, am not.|I'm temporary.|Got it?|I'm an employee!|I am NOT a vassal!
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|You're just as interesting as ever.|You're still hard to follow, but...

speak;Rennac;This is not a conversation for you to enjoy, and it's not at all hard to follow!|It's not that I don't enjoy being in this army, but traveling with her again...|I mean, I haven't even been properly paid for the last job.

speak;Dozla;Oh, so it's about money, is it?|In that case, you've no worries, Rennac.|All you have to do is see Princess L'Arachel safely back to Rausten.|Once that's done, His Majesty will pay you any amount you desire.
speak;Rennac;That's what I heard the last time, but do you have any idea how much I desire?|When he hears it, His Majesty may very well explode!
speak;Rennac;Huh?|You can't even buy a proper blade for that price!
speak;Rennac;You've got the wrong number of zeroes, old man.
speak;Dozla;Oh, my apologies.|So you want 500 gold, eh?
speak;Rennac;No!|That's smaller!|It cannot get smaller!|I want more!|It's 50,000!|50,000 gold!|And I'll bend 50,000 ears to get it if I have to!|Someone must listen!

speak;Dozla;Oh, right.|I understand!|You need 50,000 ears, is that it?|Very well, when we return to Rausten we'll get 50,000 people together!|Wait...that's 100,000 ears.|Well anyway, you'll have all the ears you need!
speak;Rennac;It's just a figure of speech, old man.|Bah! I was a fool to complain.
speak;Rennac;Life is...a fickle beast, is it not, old man?
speak;Dozla;Why are you so solemn, Rennac?|You can't win battles if you've no hope!
speak;Rennac;This journey has taught me the hollowness and the transience of life's pleasures.|Ah, to what end do we toil on this unforgiving earth?|Why do we live?

speak;Dozla;Why do we live?|Well, if you're not alive, then you're dead, and...|Er...if you're dead, then you can't eat, and...|What was I saying?|I think I must be getting hungry.|I wonder what's for dinner.|My belly's a-rumbling!
speak;Rennac;It must be nice to have no worries other than what to eat, old man.|And not just you, either.|I'm sure that a certain young lady has nothing to worry about, either.

speak;Dozla;What's that?|Do you mean Princess L'Arachel?|That girl believes the world will turn out just as she envisions it.|I doubt if the word “worry” even has any meaning to her in the first place.

speak;Rennac;What a completely envious position to be in.|I may not look it now, but I'm the son of a wealthy Carcino merchant.|I believed that you could move the world if you but had the gold.|Money was everything, and with money, nothing was beyond my reach!|I adored money!|I loved money!|You see?
speak;Dozla;What good fortune for you that your father was a thriving merchant.

speak;Rennac;That's just it...|There are people who can do anything without any money at all...|She's overbearing and egotistical, yet she has us all jumping through hoops.|That's a skill normal people don't possess.
speak;Dozla;That's Princess L'Arachel!|She makes the impossible possible!|You're with her because she made a deep impression on you, too, right?
speak;Rennac;A deep impression?|It's more like I'm in shock, and my brain's been frozen.
speak;Dozla;What?|Your brain's frozen?|That'll never do!|Did you forget to wear a hat?|Let me at it.|I'll thaw it out.
speak;Rennac;Knock it off!|I was speaking figuratively!|You know?|As in “not literally”?|You're too strong to joke around like that!|Stop it!
speak;Rennac;Sigh...|What a pair the two of you make...|You know, you're the only one who can keep up with Princess L'Arachel, old man.
speak;Dozla;You know, Rennac.|I was just thinking about something.|These battles are tough on an old man like me.|I might not make it through to see the end of this.
speak;Rennac;Where did that come from?|It better not be an omen.
speak;Dozla;I want to see Princess L'Arachel in her wedding dress one day.|That's my one wish in life.|To see her happily wed.
speak;Rennac;Telling me about it isn't going to make it happen.|Trying to find a worthy prince who's willing to take Princess L'Arachel?|That's no easy task to accomplish.
speak;Dozla;If I end up food for the crows, if I cannot escort the princess home, I want you to take care of her for me.

speak;Rennac;What?|Why?|No, I won't do it.|You can't make me!|Sorry, but NO!|You're the vassal, old man.|I'm nothing more than an escort, a thief.|When this war's over, I'm going to collect my pay and then disappear.|You got it?|Once Princess L'Arachel settles down, she'll probably never leave Rausten again.|It's got nothing to do with me.
speak;Dozla;That's cold, Rennac...|I'm disappointed.|I'm sure she'll be so lovely.|Princess L'Arachel, the bride...|If I gently close my eyes, I can envision what a glorious spectacle it will be.
speak;Rennac;If all you need is someone to listen, I'll play along.|What kind of spectacle?
speak;Dozla;The loving couple exchanging their sacred vows.|The joyous citizens of Rausten!
speak;Dozla;The newlyweds will smile and wave as the royal coach passes through the crowds.|Can you see the flowers?|The silver and gold inlay and the gems glittering in the sun?
speak;Rennac;What?|They have a gem-encrusted coach?|Now that's something I must see.|I'll be on the street, waving a flag, then I'll race up and offer my congratulations!
speak;Dozla;Would you really?|That's happy news.|Princess L'Arachel will be so surprised to see you running after them!
speak;Rennac;Yeah, and then she'll look at me with that smug face and say,|“Oh, Rennac.|Whatever are you doing here?|Come along!|Fall in and follow us.”
speak;Dozla;And then Princess L'Arachel will set out across the continent on her honeymoon...|I've got it!|You'll be her guard on her honeymoon!|Fantastic!|That's wonderful!
speak;Dozla;Now you're a true vassal to Princess L'Arachel, body and soul.|Gwah ha ha!
speak;Rennac;I've got a terrible feeling I'll never get away from Princess L'Arachel...

name: SupportDuesselAndKnoll
_source: speak;Duessel;Don't tell me you've joined up here as well, have you?
speak;Knoll;...General Duessel.|Prince Lyon no longer holds the capital.|My reason for remaining is gone...
speak;Duessel;Knoll, I have something I would ask you.|What exactly happened to His Majesty and Prince Lyon?
speak;Knoll;Do you have the courage to hear that answer?|I think perhaps that it will not be an answer you want to hear.

speak;Knoll;Are you familiar with a certain foreign anecdote of comedic nature?|It involves two starving men and a single loaf of bread.|If they break the loaf in two, both men will die of starvation...
speak;Duessel;Knoll, I'm not asking for a riddle.|Let's not waste any more time here.|I'm ready to hear the truth.|Nothing you tell me could surprise me.
speak;Knoll;If that is your wish, General Duessel...|I will speak frankly.|This is something that Prince Lyon does not know.|Something that no one should know.
speak;Knoll;We students of ancient magic, along with Prince Lyon himself, were researching certain arcane techniques lost long ago.|We were able to reproduce one...|phenomenon, but only briefly.
speak;Knoll;I should be more concise.|Prince Lyon and I pierced the veil that clouds our futures.
speak;Duessel;What?|You...could see into the future?|How is that possible?|What magic is powerful enough to-

speak;Knoll;Time is like the water of a river.|It flows ever on, never stopping.|Certain disturbances can cause ripples that speed swiftly downstream.|If you can see the water, you can read the flow, the ripples, the waves.

speak;Knoll;It is possible, General.|Possible and, at times, easy.|Just think of it.|If you knew a storm was coming in advance, you could evacuate everyone in its way.|If you could see what was to come, you could help those who might have died.|Prince Lyon explained this to us with much joy in his voice and heart.|His power would, at long last, be able to help the citizens of Grado.
speak;Knoll;We continued our work.|There were ceremonies, rituals-such horrors...|And then we saw it.|In the near future, Grado would be ravaged by catastrophe.

speak;Knoll;No, it's not the conflict in which we are currently embroiled.|This event is still in our future.|We saw Grado.|We saw the earth crumble.|We saw our people dying.|We saw the shape our future would take.
speak;Duessel;What?|That's madness...|Idiocy!|I've lived a long life, and I've never heard of anything like that.|Not ever.

speak;Knoll;I am not surprised that you do not believe me, General.|We could not believe it, either.|We tried to disprove what we had seen.|But nothing could shake the vision.|In this disaster, Grado would be destroyed.|Countless would die.|Those who died quickly would be spared the slow horror of starvation.|This was when the emperor died, by the way.|Lyon was shattered by despair.|He devoted himself to research, and then came the Dark Stone...
speak;Duessel;So that's what happened?|Is that when the decision to invade Renais was made?
speak;Knoll;I don't know.|Only one person knows the truth behind that.
speak;Knoll;I have told you only the truths I have seen.
speak;Duessel;You're tired, aren't you?|Worn to the bone.|I understand how you feel, but on the battlefield, this only invites death.
speak;Knoll;You are probably right...|And yet that might be best.
speak;Duessel;What are you planning to do from here on?
speak;Knoll;I do not know...|I have lost my way.|Perhaps I should have been executed in the capital.

speak;Knoll;I once studied dark magic alongside Prince Lyon.|He was such a gentle soul.|You could see it-he was too kind to survive.|Prince Lyon dreamt of finding happiness for all of Grado's citizens.
speak;Knoll;And now, Prince Lyon is no more.|I have lost everything.

speak;Duessel;I have also lost everything.|And we have both lost our ways.|We are dead men who have stayed too long away from our graves.|But remember, Knoll...|You cannot see the future, but you can look back at your past.|Look and learn.|And remember.|What gave your life meaning, and what has taken meaning from you now?
speak;Duessel;If you still hold the convictions that guided you in Grado, you can start anew.|That...|That is what I must do.|We may be diminished by our shame, but we are not dead yet, my friend.

speak;Knoll;General Duessel...|I am not as strong as you.|Still, I believe you are right.|I, too, shall search for a new path.|A path that guides me to realizing the dreams Prince Lyon once held so dear.

name: SupportLuteAndArtur
_source: speak;Lute;Oh!|I was just observing this chemida beetle.
speak;Artur;You haven't changed at all, have you, Lute?
speak;Artur;You spent most of your time sequestered in your room, studying your books.|On the rare occasion you went outside, you were paralyzed with fascination.

speak;Lute;Of course!|There are so many fascinating things to be learned from nature!|There are a great many books out there, and I have read most of them, of course.|But I've found that what is written can differ greatly from how things truly are.|Take this chemida beetle, for example.|I've been reading from “The Glossary of Falibrian Entomology” lately.|According to the glossary, their wings fall off once they reach maturity.|However, I have just found an adult beetle whose wings still work perfectly!|Exceptions do exist to the rules my books outline.|This is a rare specimen.|I wonder, should we take it back with us?
speak;Artur;Sigh...|I hope this isn't another of your pranks.
speak;Artur;Do you remember when I loaned you my copy of “Lux Aeterna”?|You replaced my bookmark with the tail of a sedgel lizard.|You scared ten years off my life, I swear it!
speak;Artur;And!|Knowing full well that I have a...|mild...|fear of spiders, you caught a small army of them and unleashed them in my room!
speak;Lute;I thought that if I immersed you in the thing you feared, maybe you might be able to overcome your fear entirely!|And I went to a lot of trouble trying to catch those spiders!
speak;Lute;Well, I did get a bit of a kick out of the experience myself.|Why?|Did it bother you?
speak;Artur;YES!|Oh, don't worry about it.|At least you did it because you cared about me, right?|I'll just accept it as the best gesture of kindness you can manage, Lute.
speak;Artur;You're right.|I am tired.|How could you tell, Lute?|I was trying my best not to show it.
speak;Lute;Oh, come on!|There's no one better than me at spotting things like this!|I can tell, you're mentally exhausted.

speak;Artur;I don't know what I expected, but...|I had no idea war would be like this.|One battle after another, overwhelming odds...|and monsters!?|In this day and age, we're fighting monsters from the legends and epics?|I know how much is at stake, but sometimes...|I get so tired.

speak;Lute;When you're tired, there's nothing better than a good meal and a long sleep.|And if you look at page 990 of “De Floris Mysticis,” there's a special herb that, once decocted into a potion, will help relax your muscles.|Look for the parfina flower, and reduce it into a thick syrup before drinking.|Oh, and I hear music helps you sleep.|If you like, I can hum something for you.
speak;Artur;Thank you.|However, I think I'll pass on your offer, delightful though your humming must be.|You must be tired as well.|Take care of yourself, and rest when you can.
speak;Lute;I will.|In fact, maybe I'll just hum to myself instead.|Will you be all right?
speak;Artur;I'm fine.|I feel quite refreshed, in fact.
speak;Lute;Refreshed?|How so?|Was it some new kind of magic?
speak;Artur;Perhaps, from a certain point of view.|Your every word has nurtured my soul...
speak;Lute;Hm.|I'm not sure I get it, but as long as you're feeling better!
speak;Artur;What is it?|You look like you have something on your mind.
speak;Lute;Oh.|No.|I was just thinking about monsters.
speak;Lute;Yes.|All these monsters are our enemies, I know, but...|They're not all bad, are they?
speak;Lute;They're kind of cute, don't you think?|I mean, like those revenants, for example.
speak;Artur;It's fair to say I will never understand your tastes.|Besides, I thought you enjoyed using them as, well, magic practice.
speak;Lute;Oh, I do.|I do indeed.|I use my magic to rip them to shreds...|with love, of course.
speak;Artur;Your way of expressing love is somewhat frightening...
speak;Artur;Should I, ah, expect you to attack me with magic, too?
speak;Lute;Hm?|Why would I attack you with my magic?
speak;Lute;No.|Your strange logic baffles even my brilliant, brilliant mind.|That's why I'm curious.
speak;Artur;I'm just giving you a hard time, Lute.|All right.|I'll just come straight out and say it.
speak;Artur;In fact, I love you, and I'm hoping perhaps that you love me.

speak;Lute;Er...|Um...|A-according to “A Young Girl's Primer to Nazonian Magic,” that most ancient tome long sought by, er, the terrible Demon King himself...|it's not uncommon for a party to assign feelings of...|er, love to the reanimated hordes they confront on the battlefield, and considering my incredible brain and the remarkable skills I-
speak;Lute;Well, that is...|What I mean is...
speak;Artur;What's wrong with you?|I don't often see you lose your cool.
speak;Lute;Well...|My books don't tell me anything about how to deal with love!|So...
speak;Artur;Heh...|Heh heh heh...|Ha ha ha ha!!!
speak;Lute;I'm sorry.|I'm a little out of my depth when it comes to love.
speak;Artur;No, you're not.|Love needs no textbooks.|Just be yourself, and listen to your feelings.
speak;Lute;Is...|that all I need to do?

name: OnLevelSelect_10A
_source: speak;Narrator;The Caer Pelyn Range...|According to Ewan, a little-known passage to Jehanna lies there, hidden within its cracked red bedrock and knife-edged peaks.

speak;Narrator;To avoid Carcino and combat, Eirika's troops take the mountain path.|They begin climbing higher and higher toward Caer Pelyn.|Unbeknownst to the group, hordes of dark creatures now roam the peaks.

name: Intro
_source: speak;Ewan;We're almost there!|Come on!|My teacher lives just up ahead.
speak;Innes;...This fog's getting thick.|I don't expect any more surprise attacks, but that doesn't mean we-
speak;Ewan;Quick worrying, mister!|You're gonna get left behind.
speak;Innes;...Don't speak to me, boy.|I don't tolerate insolence.
speak;Eirika;Innes, he's only a child.|There's no reason to be so rude.|He is helping us after all.
speak;Ewan;That's right.|Without me, you'd never get where you're going.|So come on already!
speak;Ewan;Huh?|That's gonna make it awfully hard to get where we need to go.
speak;Innes;...What do you know about that fort?|It looks like it's been abandoned for some time.|Is anyone using it?
speak;Ewan;Nope.|It's really run-down.|Nobody ever goes there.|It's been empty for ages.|I've been inside, so I know.
speak;Innes;Is that right?|Then what's that sound, and where is it coming from?
speak;Ewan;Huh?|What sound?|Hey, you're right...|I do hear a weird noise.|You could hear that?|Neat!|You've got really good hearing.|I wonder what it is...
speak;Eirika;There it is again.|Prince, is this...
speak;Innes;Get your troops ready.|Tell them to prepare for battle...|We've been spotted.|Monsters are coming.
speak;Tethys;Ewan, it's dangerous here.|Get behind me.
speak;Tethys;No.|You're too young.|You're not ready for this.|Are you going to do as I say or not?|I don't know what I would do if you were to get injured.

speak;Larachel;What spacious chambers.|Hm...|A bit musty, but I like it.|I've decided.|We'll bed here for the night.|I do wonder where Rennac disappeared to, though.|I told him not to wander off, but...
speak;Dozla;Hmph!|Lady L'Arachel, this could be trouble.
speak;Dozla;Look there!|Through that break in the fog...|Looks like we've got some nasty creatures running 'bout this place.

speak;Larachel;...I can't see a thing.|But this can be nothing but good fortune shining down on us again.|Losing our way in the mountains and running into these abominations?|There can be no doubt.|We were brought here to destroy these foul things!|Come, Dozla!|We fight!
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|My heart cries out for battle!

speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Time to show what I am made of!|My <red>axe</> will chop any foe down!|Maybe my  ol'<red>Sword</> will work too?|Maybe even pick up <red>Dark</> magic?|Either way, these monsters will die!|Gwah ha ha!
speak;Larachel;It's time to shine!|If it's my <red>Staff</>, <red>Light</>, I will strike evil!|I could probably beat evil with <red>Dark</> magic too!|I am the best afterall!

name: DozlaTalkLarachel
_source: speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|What is it, Lady L'Arachel?
speak;Larachel;We're going to join these good people and eradicate these unclean monstrosities.
speak;Dozla;Sounds fun!|What would you have me to do?
speak;Larachel;Oh, just carry on in your normal manner.|Destroy, destroy, destroy.|But do be sure to enjoy yourself.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|I am your obedient servant!

name: EirikaTalkLarachel
_source: speak;Larachel;Hello!|So it's true!|Blessings do come in threes!
speak;Eirika;L'Arachel, this place is dangerous.|You should find safe haven elsewhere.
speak;Larachel;Oh, you needn't worry about us.|As you well know, my divine mission is to purge the land of these obscenities.|I will show you the splendor that is L'Arachel in action!|Bear witness!
speak;Eirika;If you insist.|At least let us join forces for the time being.

name: Outro
_source: speak;Larachel;Please, speak nothing of it.|It is heaven's dictate that I come here to cleanse this charming place of monsters.|What's important is-|Oh my!|I just realized I have not yet had the honor of your name.
speak;Eirika;Oh, you're right.|How strange...|We've met so often now that I had assumed you already...|Please forgive my lack of manners.|My name is Eirika.
speak;Eirika;It's all right, Seth.|She's clearly not our enemy.

speak;Larachel;Eirika...|Aha!|So you must be Princess Eirika of Renais!|It is simply an honor to meet you.|And how strange that we should meet again in this place.|You must be lost as well.|This continent is so confusing.
speak;Eirika;Um, yes.|Actually, we're not lost at all.|You see...
speak;Larachel;Is that so!|Well, clearly, I must be allowed to accompany you.
speak;Eirika;You want to travel with us?|I appreciate your offer, but our journey is far too perilous.|I do not wish to pull you into this madness.
speak;Larachel;No, no, no.|There can be no doubt that we were sent here to aid you.|It is all part of the grand design.|I, L'Arachel, shall play my role and fulfill my divine duties.|This I swear!
speak;Seth;Are you sure this is wise, Princess?
speak;Larachel;...Well, that's that, Dozla.|You and I are now traveling with Eirika and her companions.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|I understand.|For you, Lady L'Arachel, I would do absolutely anything!|I would run to the ends of this world and dive into a sea of evil!
speak;Larachel;How very like you, my dear, dedicated Dozla!|So noble!|Come!|We're off!
speak;Ewan;Teeeaaaacher...|Hellooooooo...|That's strange.|He's not here.|Must be out wandering again.
speak;Eirika;He's out?|That poses a problem.|Do you know when he'll return?
speak;Ewan;Hmmm...|I don't know.|He often goes out and looks for people in need.
speak;Saleh;...I believe I told you it would be best to stay away.
speak;Saleh;I've been charged with a mission and must depart again soon.
speak;Eirika;Y-you...|We've met before, haven't we?|You were looking for someone...
speak;Saleh;...Oh, yes.|And now we meet again.

speak;Ewan;These people say they want to go through Caer Pelyn.|I could guide them myself, but I thought it might be better if you went, too. |That's why I brought them here.|What do you say?|Will you guide them?
speak;Saleh;...Very well.|I'm heading there now.|If you need to go to Caer Pelyn, you're free to follow me.

speak;Saleh;We have little interest in the outside world, but we do not refuse travelers.|I should warn you.|The road is not easy, and you look very weary.|You should rest a night before attempting the mountains.
speak;Innes;We do need rest, it's true.|We are all exhausted from our encounter with those creatures.|We must give our men time to heal, or they'll be useless in an emergency.
speak;Ewan;It's settled then.|I'll go on ahead and let the elder know we're coming.|See?|Even when there's no fighting to be done, I'm still useful!
speak;Eirika;No, wait!|...He's gone.|I wonder if he'll be all right.
speak;Innes;Idiotic boy.|I understand his need to be helpful, but...
speak;Saleh;Ewan knows this land well.|You needn't worry about him.|We'll depart at sunrise.|I suggest you all get some rest.
speak;Eirika;Who?|You...|You're General Glen of Grado.|We met once in the capital, didn't we?|You were very kind to me.|However, if you're here now, I have to assume this means...

speak;Glen;Yes, it does.|I wish our reunion could come under different circumstances.|Eirika, I must tell you, I come here on the direct orders of the emperor.|I'm to bring to justice the rebel army leader who's been terrorizing Carcino.|It's you, Eirika.|They say you've been murdering innocents.

speak;Glen;...If you have something to say, I would hear it.|I know all too well that Grado has robbed you of your homeland, but even so...|I do not believe revenge could drive a woman like you to such depths.|And yet...|here you are in Carcino with a small army under your command.|And the emperor tells us that you massacred everyone in Port Kiris.
speak;Innes;...This is ridiculous.|Believe what you want.|Could one of the legendary Imperial Three honestly be as stupid as this?

speak;Innes;Carcino betrayed Frelia and set a pack of mercenary dogs to kill me.|And you paint Eirika a rebel instigator?|It's an absurd farce.|Your emperor commits horrors, and you believe Eirika is a criminal?
speak;Innes;You truly are blind, aren't you?|You're one of the Imperial Three, and yet you can't see your emperor's plan?

speak;Eirika;That's enough, Innes.|There's no need to provoke him.|General Glen, we've told you what we know to be true, what we've seen firsthand.|We don't want to fight you...|But if you push us, we will drive you back to Grado with your tail between your legs.

speak;Glen;...I see.|You...are more observant than you know.|I am ignorant of the emperor's designs.|General Duessel and I both questioned the wisdom of this war.|And if you really are innocent of the crimes attributed to you...|Why would His Majesty lie to us?|I must know the answer.

speak;Glen;The Princess Eirika I met long ago was kind and merciful in spirit.|You've faced relentless hardship, and yet that selfsame spirit remains true.|...Let's put our fight aside for now.|I will learn the truth.|Then I will once again perform the duties of my office.|If you have lied to me today, I will hound you to the very grave itself.
speak;Valter;Glen.|Where do you think you're going?

speak;Valter;Tsk, tsk.|What am I to make of this?|Those little birds I saw flitting away into the mountains looked vaguely familiar.|What do you suppose would happen if it were known you let Eirika escape?
speak;Glen;Do as you will.|I'm returning to the capital.|I have questions for the emperor.|Clear the path, Valter.
speak;Valter;Hold on now.|No reason to rush off, is there?|After all, this is where you're going to die.|See?
speak;Valter;Heh heh...|We were a grand trio-the Imperial Three.|You, Duessel, and me.|But my place among you was stolen, and I was exiled from Grado.
speak;Glen;You slaughtered people who had no intention of fighting.|The emperor's punishment was just and warranted.

speak;Valter;Heh heh...heh heh heh...|After my fall from glory, only desire kept me alive.|Desire for revenge.|My hatred burned so fierce that I was only barely able to keep my sanity.|That hatred keeps me warm still today.|Oh, how it burns...
speak;Valter;Hear me, Glen, wyvern general of the Imperial Three.|I live for battle.|I crave it.|I have no need for peace.|That is why you must die.
speak;Valter;Heh heh...|This is merely the beginning.|Endless battle, war without end...|Heh heh...|ha hahahahahaha!

name: CinaFightValterAndGlen
_source: speak;Valter;A battle between generals...|Sends the spirit soaring, eh?|Come, Glen!|Entertain me!|Ha ha ha ha ha ha!

name: OnLevelSelect_11B
_source: speak;Narrator;General Duessel tells them of the enigmatic Dark Stone.|The product of Grado's research into the dark arts, the Dark Stone possesses power far beyond that of the Sacred Stones.
speak;Narrator;According to the rumors swirling about, Vigarde's descent into madness coincides with the creation of the Dark Stone.
speak;Narrator;Ephraim must confirm the existence of the Dark Stone. He decides to travel to Grado by sea.
speak;Narrator;Midway through their passage, however, an eerie fog begins to form...

name: Intro
_source: music;48- Solve the Riddle Orchestral Cover;500
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Selena...|You coward.|Why did you not execute Duessel?
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Selena.|Duessel has betrayed us.|He has bent his knee to Ephraim.|Are you a traitor, too?
speak;Selena;Never!|I am Your Majesty's vassal.|I am yours, body and soul!|Your Majesty, please, another chance, I beg you!|Any order you see fit to issue, I will complete!
speak;Lyon;Selena. I have something for you. If I may, Father?
speak;Lyon;I want you to go to Za'albul Marsh and retrieve something for me.|It is a dragonstone, a very special kind of rock.

speak;Lyon;That's right.|It's very rare.|There are only two in the entire world.|I've heard rumors of a collector there who has one for sale.|It looks like nothing but a common gemstone.|I need it for my research.|If I have that stone...my...|Urg...gaa...
speak;Selena;My prince, are you all right?
speak;Lyon;I'm fine.|Don't worry about me.|Now, please, find me the dragonstone.|Will you approve my request, Father?
speak;Vigarde Zombie;Yes.|Do as my son asks.

speak;Selena;Yes, understood.|Your Majesty, I...would like to renew my oath of service to you here today.|I pledge that I shall never again falter in my duty to you or to Grado.|I beg your leave, my lord.
speak;Ephraim;Is this the first time you've seen the ocean, Myrrh?
speak;Ephraim;It is at that.|You know, this is my first passage on a ship.|I've never appreciated just how enormous the sea is.
speak;Myrrh;Really?|I'd never have guessed you hadn't sailed before.|You seem so calm.
speak;Ephraim;If I'm to lead us, I can't allow any weakness to show through.|I must appear as competent and capable at all times, you understand?
speak;Ephraim;Excuse me, Myrrh.|We'll have to continue this later.
speak;Seth;There's a ship that's pulled up next to us.|Should I ready the company for battle?
speak;Seth;It's hard to say.|The fog makes it difficult to see clearly.|However, her crew seems not to be...human.

speak;Riev;Heh heh heh...|Rise and rage, my precious children of darkness.|Ruin the wood and ride the sea!|Drown your foes, and devour their flesh!|Come celebrate the glorious rebirth of your lord and master, the Demon King!|Heh, heh, heh.

name: T1End
_source: speak;Ephraim;Those creatures are trying to board!|That's fine-it'll bring 'em within reach of my lance.|Push them back!|Board their ship and seize the blasted thing!

name: Turn5Larchel
_source: speak;Ephraim;What?|There's another ship?!|Stay calm, everyone!|We take the fight to them!
speak;Larachel;Friends of justice!|Allies of righteousness and order!|Know that I, L'Arachel, have arrived!|Now, I shall purge the seas of this vile vessel of villainy!
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Nice alliteration, Princess L'Arachel!
speak;Larachel;Hm?|I didn't hear Rennac's voice.|How very odd.|Dozla, where has Rennac run off to this time?
speak;Dozla;Hmmm...|He was with us at mealtime before we boarded, but...
speak;Larachel;That man can be such a distraction.|...Oh well, never mind!|Let's get started destroying these agents of chaos!
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Leave it to me!

speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Time to show what I am made of!|My <red>axe</> will chop any foe down!|Maybe my ol'<red>Sword</> will work too?|Maybe I can even pick up <red>Dark</> magic?|Either way, these monsters will die!|Gwah ha ha!
speak;Larachel;It's time to shine!|If I have my <red>Staff</> or <red>Light</> magic, I will strike evil!|I could probably beat evil with <red>Dark</> magic too!|I am the best after all!

name: LarachelTalkEphraim
_source: speak;Larachel;Fear not, O weary traveler, for I am here to save you!|I grant you the favor of my divine aid.
speak;Ephraim;Who are you?|What are you doing here?
speak;Larachel;Ah! Can it be?|Do you not know the tales of my deeds?|Have you not heard of the beauteous young woman traveling to defeat evil?
speak;Larachel;It's nothing...|Please pay me no mind.|I just feel a bit like being alone and weeping for a while.
speak;Ephraim;What?|No, you can't...|This is no place for crying.|I'm sure you've noticed, but we're under attack by monsters.|If you can do anything to help, we would appreciate it.
speak;Larachel;That's a good idea!|I'll do it.|Now, I want you to observe closely my graceful actions!

name: DozlaTalkLarachel
_source: speak;Larachel;We're going to be working together with those people.|I want you to stay close by.|Are you ready?

name: Outro
_source: speak;Seth;We've destroyed the remaining monsters.|The ship appears to be empty.
speak;Larachel;And once again, the forces of righteousness prevail!
speak;Ephraim;Thank you.|We owe our victory to you.

speak;Larachel;Don't mention it.|My name is L'Arachel.|I'm on a never-ending quest to defeat evil in the name of virtue and order.|Wait...|Your face has a certain familiarity.|I recently met a young woman who greatly resembles you.
speak;Ephraim;Do you mean, Eirika?|She's my sister.
speak;Larachel;Eirika?|Isn't that the name of the princess of Renais.|And you have a very regal air about you yourself, don't you?
speak;Ephraim;My name is Ephraim, Prince of Renais.|We're fighting to end Grado's invasion.|To be honest...
speak;Larachel;Oh my!|In that case, I must accompany you.
speak;Ephraim;Do you understand that we alone are facing all the armies of Grado?|We face untold numbers, and our odds of success are embarrassingly small.
speak;Larachel;You clearly do not know who I am.|Do not be startled by what I'm about to disclose to you...|I am the princess of Rausten, theocracy of the righteous!
speak;Ephraim;You're the princess of Rausten?|Hm.|You certainly don't have the bearing of a commoner, but...

speak;Larachel;Ah, of course.|My natural nobility gives me away every time.|Truth to tell, dire circumstances have led me to begin this journey in secret.|Prince Ephraim of Renais, please be assured that Rausten is your ally.|Let us stand together against the villainous Grado Empire!
speak;Larachel;...Well, that's that, Dozla.|We will now be traveling with Ephraim and his companions.
speak;Dozla;Gwah ha ha!|Understood!|For you, Princess Larachel, I would dive headlong into a sea of evil!|Why, I'd even tie myself up with ropes and chains first!
speak;Larachel;Such fabulous devotion!|You are truly my most loyal attendant.|Let us be off then.

name: Intro
_source: speak;Seth;Perhaps we should rest, milady.|Master Saleh, is it much farther?
speak;Saleh;We're close.|It's only half a day ahead.
speak;Seth;I would ask for a moment's rest before continuing.|We are all exhausted.|We can go no farther today.
speak;Eirika;No, Seth.|I'll be fine.|We must not be delayed by my weakness.
speak;Innes;Whew...|Hah...|I didn't realize we'd be climbing so high.
speak;Saleh;...As I warned you before we set out, the footing here can be treacherous.
speak;Innes;Do you people truly live in this place?|These barren crags seem unfit for human habitation...
speak;Saleh;Material wealth brings strife.|We've no need of these things.|In this, we are of one mind with the Great Dragon.
speak;Eirika;More monsters...|Master Saleh, do these creatures normally inhabit this region?
speak;Saleh;No...|Those things come from Darkling Woods.|It's been a long time since they've wandered this far afield.|It's as the elder says...|Evil omens take many shapes.
speak;Larachel;It looks like those fiends have noticed us as well.|We should move, Eirika.
speak;Saleh;My <red>Anima</> or <red>Staff</> magic will prove useful here.|If needed, I know some <red>Dark</> magic as well.|Though I hope not to use it....

name: House_1Else
condition: region.nid == 'House_1' and unit.nid != 'Eirika' and unit.nid != 'Tethys' and unit.nid != 'Saleh'
_source: speak;Ewan;You were one of the people with my teacher, weren't you?|You think I can fight at your side?|I can use the magic my teacher taught me.|Well, what do you say?

name: House_1Eirika
_source: speak;Eirika;Ewan!|How wonderful.|So you're safe, are you?
speak;Ewan;Yep.|I took care of a whole mess of those things.|More of ‘em might show up at any time, so I'll just follow you to the village.|That's all right, isn't it?
speak;Eirika;I guess so...|It's probably safer than leaving you here by yourself.|Let's stick together, Ewan.

name: House_1Saleh
_source: speak;Ewan;Oh, Teacher!|It's you!|You probably had to fight a ton of creatures to get here!|You're the best!|I hope I can study with you forever.
speak;Saleh;I've told you before...|My mission is my life.|If you wish to learn magic, you'd be better served by another.

speak;Ewan;No way.|I wanna be just like you.|Why would I go study somewhere else?|Wait...|You've gotta go out on a mission again, don't you!|Take me with you!|I've practiced a lot.|I can already use all the magic you taught me!
speak;Saleh;Well, you seem quite adamant.|All right.|You may accompany me.|I think being with me might be safer than remaining on your own.

name: House_1Tethys
_source: speak;Ewan;Yeah.|I tried to fight those monsters.|And you know what?|I killed four of 'em!|With my magic!|That's pretty good, huh?
speak;Tethys;What am I going to do with you?|Anyway, it's not safe here.|Come with me, Ewan.
speak;Ewan;You-you don't believe me...|You watch and see.|I'll show you how far I've come!

name: House_2
_source: speak;Woman1;I can't believe monsters have appeared here in the realm of the Great Dragon.|What is this world coming to?|This staff you help to protect you against the beasts.|Please travel safely.

name: Turn1Scene
_source: speak;Saleh;I'm concerned for Ewan as well.|I'll go with you.|I hope he is safe.
speak;Ewan;Hey!|Wa-wait a moment.|We can work this out...
speak;Ewan;You, uh, aren't interested in talking, are you?
speak;Ewan;Where'd all those freaks come from?|I've got to get back and warn everyone...|But...|I do wonder if Grandmother is all right.

name: Outro
_source: speak;Dara;Saleh?|Is that you, Saleh?|Tell me, is the Great Dragon well?
speak;Saleh;I'm sorry, Elder.|I searched to the west, but I found nothing.
speak;Dara;Is that so...|Hm?|Who's that with you?
speak;Innes;I am Innes, prince of Frelia.|The circumstances of our journey have led us here.|We would like to pass through.

speak;Dara;Hmmm...|We of Caer Pelyn have turned away from the world outside.|The Great Dragon alone holds all our honor and esteem.|In this place, princes and pauper are equals.|Do you have a problem with that?

speak;Dara;Hm...|Well then, be welcomed as guests in our homes.|I see some of you are injured.|You should use this rock moss.|We have little beyond what we need, but we will prepare food and bedding.|You can rest as long as you like.
speak;Innes;We've no wish to trouble you.|We'd just as soon pass straight through.

speak;Dara;Don't let your pride drive you to foolishness.|That girl there looks like she's ready to collapse at any moment.|She's ill from the height of the mountain.|Saleh, prepare some tea for the lass.
speak;Dara;Call me Grandmother, child.|That is what the villages call me.
speak;Eirika;Uh...|Grandmother, may I ask you a question?|This Great Dragon...

speak;Dara;Ah, the inquisitiveness of youth.|Come, lass, listen to my words.|The Great Dragon is...a blessing, one that watches over all mankind.|Why, in days long past, when the Demon King appeared...
speak;Eirika;Demon King?|Are you speaking of the legend of the Sacred Stones?|The hero Grado used the power of the five Sacred Stones to defeat and seal away-

speak;Dara;No, no, that's not right at all.|Ah, how quickly did mankind forget its debt to the Great Dragon.|To hear the story now, one would think humans alone brought about victory.|That is a gross mistelling of the tale.|Only through the Great Dragon's strength could the Demon King be sealed away!
speak;Eirika;The Great Dragon and the Demon King...

speak;Dara;Mankind may have forgotten its debt, but the Great Dragon never forgets.|It watches over the bones of the Demon King in Darkling Woods.|It keeps the Demon King's dark brood from swarming the world of men.|The Great Dragon's vigilance alone has kept us safe from their blind rage.
speak;Eirika;Is that so?|I'm...|I'm sorry, I never knew...
speak;Dara;Hmph.|You don't need to know everything, but you should remember that.
speak;Eirika;Yet, Grandmother, we encountered those creatures on the way here.|And they have begun to appear in the land we live in as well.|What does this mean?
music;52- Into the Shadow of Victory Orchestral Cover;500

speak;Dara;Ah...|You have seen the effects of the omen that has appeared in the south.|There is an energy there that has fouled the air and darkened the sky.|The Great Dragon left Darkling Woods and went south to investigate.|We of the village wished to protect the Great Dragon, so I sent my grandson, Saleh, as long as well.|But they became embroiled in battle, and the Great Dragon disappeared.|Since that time, there's been no sign of the Great Dragon either here or abroad.|We grew worried and directed Saleh to look for any trace of the Great Dragon.|I am worried that the source of that foul energy may be responsible.
speak;Eirika;A foul energy...|From the south?|Myrrh said something similar to this, too.|Is the Great Dragon you speak of...one of the Manakete?
speak;Dara;Manakete?!?|How dare you speak so of the Great Dragon!

speak;Dara;But if you've seen the noble Myrrh, perhaps I can proceed more quickly.|You see, our Great Dragon took the form of Mistress Myrrh in her travels.|And you tell me that you have seen the Great Dragon yourself, lass?
speak;Dara;What?!|Where is this brother of yours!?
speak;Eirika;He leads a force of men against Grado.|Myrrh rides beside him.
speak;Dara;Saleh, this is urgent!|You must leave for Grado at once and rescue the Great Dragon!

speak;Larachel;Oh, where are you off to?|If you're going to Grado, the swiftest route takes you through Jehanna.|It would be to your advantage to join us in our journey for a time.|It's far safer then being on your own.
speak;Saleh;You have a point...|Mistress Eirika, protecting the Great Dragon is my duty.|Please allow me to travel with you on the road ahead.
speak;Innes;We are in your debt, Matron.
speak;Dara;Not at all.|All of our guidance comes from the Great Dragon.|Saleh.
speak;Saleh;Yes, I know.|The road to Jehanna lies here.
speak;Eirika;Grandmother, thank you so much for everything.
speak;Dara;I know you'll help the Great Dragon, but please look after Saleh as well.|He's not very personable, but he's the only grandchild I have.

name: Inn
_source: speak;Man2;Ah...|I wonder if that dancer will ever come this way again.|I don't know why, but her dances really pepped me up.|Even after a hard day's work, I felt as fresh as if I'd just woken up!|It sure would be nice if she would dance for me again someday.

name: House_1
_source: speak;Ewan;Er, hello.|My name's Ewan.|I'm training to be a sage.|I need to find a woman by the name of Marisa.|I don't know where she's gone.|If you'll help me find her, I'll gladly travel with you.|I'm a useful guy to know.|In a pinch, I can use the magic I've learned so far.|So what do you say?|Do we have a deal?

name: Intro
_source: speak;Seth;Prince Ephraim, we've docked in Taizel.|There's no sign of enemy troops at this time.
speak;Ephraim;Understood.|Let's move quickly and prepare to go ashore.|We've a straight road to the capital from here, but we'll be fighting for every step.
speak;Seth;Yes, and the fighting will only grow fiercer as we near the capital.|If I may, my lord, I'd like to make a suggestion...
speak;Saleh;This is the town, isn't it, Ewan?
speak;Ewan;Yep.|Thanks a lot, Teacher.|This is where Marisa is supposed to be.|I have to tell her what's going on, or she'll end up working for free.
speak;Saleh;What happened?|I heard there was some mistake, but...

speak;Ewan;Yeah, the mercenary guild got Marisa mixed up with someone else.|I don't know where she was supposed to go, but they sent her here instead.|I figured I'd better let her know about the mix-up, right?|So what are you going to do now?
speak;Saleh;I'm heading back to the village.|I've looked near and far, but I haven't been able to locate the Lord Dragon.|I must report my findings.
speak;Saleh;I'll be going now.|Remember what I told you, Ewan...
speak;Ewan;I know, I know.|Don't be reckless with magic.
speak;Ewan;Well, I'd better get going and find Marisa.|That looks like a good place to start asking around.
speak;Ephraim;...That won't do, Seth.|I cannot approve of sending reservists to the front lines.

speak;Seth;But...|The Grado army outnumbers our own by a tremendous amount.|We have talented soldiers, but that counts for nothing against those numbers.|Currently, we have some ready reservists in the rear, protecting our supply convoy.|What good is defending our convoy if it comes at the cost of losing the front?|We must abandon our rear guard and strengthen the van, or we've already lost.
speak;Ephraim;This is enemy territory.|We cannot surrender the convoy!

speak;Ephraim;Seth, I know you only want to improve the odds of our success.|And I know you make these suggestions in part to protect me from harm.|However, I have no intention of changing my mind in this.|I-|...Myrrh?
speak;Soldier;Prince Ephraim!|It's a trap!|The city's crawling with Grado men!|We're under attack!
speak;Ephraim;All troops prepare to fight!|To arms!

name: EnemyT1
_source: speak;Caellach;Soldiers of Grado!|You call yourselves warriors?|You're pathetic!|Fort Rigwald?|You lost it!|Your General Duessel?|A traitor!|Where is the honor of the Grado Imperial Army?|It wallows in filth and mud.|Is this the ending you envisioned?|Is this how you would be remembered?|Will you let the bards sing of how you fell to the renegade Ephraim?|I think not!|Now get up and fight!|Kill them all!|And bring me Ephraim's head!

name: Turn2
_source: speak;Riev;Heh heh heh...|Caellach.|Interesting.|What are you doing here?|You were ordered to loose your dogs of war on Jehanna, were you not?

speak;Caellach;Keep silent, you decrepit fool.|I told you, Jehanna's under control.|My plan is in full effect.|All we need do now is wait.|You see, Jehanna is an overripe fruit.|It's being devoured by worms from within.|We can pluck it anytime we wish.

speak;Riev;Heh heh heh...|Oh, how your plans seem to have gone awry.|Even now, Eirika makes her way toward Jehanna.|Your perfect fruit has turned to rot while you did nothing.|It's time.|You will return to the capital with me.
speak;Caellach;What?!|Are you truly serious, you old goat?|Glen...|No, it's that black-hearted Valter...|What's he playing at now?

speak;Riev;There's no call for that sort of talk.|That one has his uses after all.|You can leave the defeat of Ephraim to your subordinates.|Oh yes, and you can use the troops I brought with me as well.|It will, no doubt, be an interesting battle.|Heh heh heh...|Let's go now, Caellach.|You wouldn't want to hurt a certain someone's feelings, would you?

name: MarisaTalkEwan
_source: speak;Ewan;Marisa, the mercenary guild sent you here, didn't they?|They assigned you to fight under Commander Gerik, right?
speak;Marisa;That's right.|But the chief's not here.
speak;Ewan;I know.|It was all a mistake.|Your commander's over there, working on another job.|He wants you to join him.
speak;Ewan;Hey, wait! Wait!|Take me with you!|This group's headed east, too.|Let's stick with them for now.

name: Outro
_source: speak;Seth;The enemy troops have been defeated.|We're taking care of the wounded now.

speak;Ephraim;Understood.|We'll rest in this city until we're prepared to advance.|Replenish supplies and rest the troops.|Remind every soldier that anyone who breaks the city's laws will be severely punished.|Anything else?
speak;Seth;We should prepare defenses along the east in case of assault.|The capital's not far, and fresh troops could be here at any time.
speak;Ephraim;Good point.|All right, set up three rotating watches.|Then-
speak;Seth;Yes, she's been missing since this morning.|There are no signs of a struggle.|I feel she left of her own accord.
speak;Ephraim;Where did she go?|Didn't anyone see her?
speak;Seth;One of the guards reports having seen a young lady heading east.|He said she seemed unsteady on her feet.|It may have been her.
speak;Ephraim;Prepare to move out.|We head east.
music;52- Into the Shadow of Victory Orchestral Cover;500
speak;Ephraim;I'm not just acting on emotion, Seth.|The capital lies to the east as well.

speak;Ephraim;Seth, you will obey your commander and sovereign, do you hear me?|Listen, I know what you said is true.|I am king in all but title now.|I know I must place my duty as commander above my life as a man.|And once I am crowned, I most certainly will do exactly that.|However, I am not ready to divorce myself from my compassion just yet.|I will find the balance somehow, the means to save my country and her people.|That is the king I wish to become, and so that is the man I must be.|I need your help in this, Seth.
speak;Seth;...I understand, Prince Ephraim.|If that is your decision, then I will do my best to assist you.
speak;Ephraim;I'm counting on it.|Please be safe, Myrrh.

name: OnLevelSelect_13A
_source: speak;Narrator;Jehanna, home of dancing white sands. This largely barren desert nation is infamous for its mercenary forces.

speak;Narrator;In accordance with her husband's dying wish, the beautiful Ismaire rules Jehanna.|The Queen of the White Dunes governs Jehanna with Grace and Honor.|When he was young, her son left Jehanna.|His whereabouts remain unknown.
speak;Narrator;After passing through Caer Pelyn, Eirika arrives in Jehanna.|There, she finds the nation embroiled in combat with Grado's forces.

name: Intro
_source: speak;Cormag;My brother is...dead?|That can't be!|That's impossible!
speak;Valter;There's no mistake.|Look for yourself.|I've brought his corpse with me.|That's him right over there, isn't it?

speak;Valter;Not a pretty sight, eh?|You'll be hard pressed to ready that for a proper burial.|But listen, Cormag.|There's no reason for you to grieve.|After all, who is better than you to replace your brother in His Majesty's service?|Picture it.|General Cormag, the new and improved Sunstone, eh?

speak;Valter;Glen's last orders were to find and subdue Eirika.|'Tis a pity I was delayed.|I arrived to witness the final blow myself.|I watched Eirika run her blade right through his chest and then flee.
speak;Valter;Hm?|What would you do if I told you?|Without orders from His Majesty...
speak;Valter;...In the eastern mountains of Carcino.|The forests are thick in that region.|It won't be easy finding her, but...
speak;Valter;Gone already?|I've sent a gift your way, Eirika, but I trust you can handle it.|You're my girl after all.|I need you to be strong for me...|Heh heh...|ha ha ha ha ha!
speak;Innes;Go on.|What news do you bring?

speak;Messenger;Prince Innes!|You're alive and well!|When the reinforcements rode into Carcino, you were nowhere to be seen...|We thought perhaps the enemy forces had reached you and...|It's good to see you well, milord.
speak;Innes;I'm sorry to have troubled you.|But remember, the duty I bear is a harsh master.|It will not let me die easily.
speak;Innes;Yes, what word do you bring of Frelia?|Speak!

speak;Messenger;Yes, Your Highness!|Frelia has invaded Carcino and engaged the traitor Pablo's mercenary army.|With aid from the elder Klimt, we are crushing the foe where we find them.|Pablo's faction is retreating ever southward, toward Jehanna...
speak;Innes;Towards Jehanna?|They must be planning to join with the Grado forces there.
speak;Eirika;Pardon me, but I must know...|Do you have word of my brother?
speak;Messenger;Yes.|Prince Ephraim has forced them surrender of Grado's fortress at Rigwald.|He is now marching onward toward the imperial capital.
speak;Innes;That fool...|Emperor Vigarde himself and his imperial guard are in the capital.|It's too strong a force...|Even for Ephraim.
speak;Eirika;No...|I believe in my brother.|I know he fights still.|The bracelet tells me so.
speak;Larachel;Ah, Eirika.|Is it time to go already?
speak;Eirika;L'Arachel.|We're going to break through the Grado lines and join the army of Jehanna.|You should keep to the rear where it's safe...

speak;Larachel;No, I will stay with you.|Confronting evil boldly is the sworn duty of any ally of justice.|And it may be that Grado's goal is the Stone of Jehanna...|I cannot stand by and let it be destroyed.
speak;Eirika;L'Arachel?|Where did you come by such information?
speak;Larachel;Hm?|That...uh, well...the...wind whispered to me in the night.

speak;Larachel;Yes, that's right.|...And according to that gentle breeze, there are knights riding this way from Rausten even as we speak.|If we can but hold out until they arrive, the battle will surely be ours.|Come, Eirika.|Let us be on our way.
music;48- Solve the Riddle Orchestral Cover;500
speak;Caellach;They should be arriving anytime now.|Are you ready, Aias?

speak;Aias;Mm. Everything's in place.|This Princess Eirika supposedly defeated General Glen.|I wonder...|If it's true, then she's a foe to be reckoned with, and no doubt.|Still, there's no reason to worry.|I can best her.|I know it.
